sentences.english: She’s gone to Italy on a special assignment.
sentences.chinese: 她去意大利执行一项特殊任务。

sentences.english: a history assignment
sentences.chinese: 历史作业

detailed_translations.english: a piece of work that is given to someone as part of their job

name: assist
trans: 协助, 帮助, 辅助 (verb.)

sentences.english: The family decided to assist me with my chores.
sentences.chinese: 家人决定分担我的琐事。

sentences.english: The family decided to assist me with my chores.
sentences.chinese: 家人决定分担我的琐事。

detailed_translations.english: to help someone to do something
If you assist someone, you help them to do a job or task by doing part of the work for them

name: assistance
trans: 援助, 协助, 帮助, 救助 (noun.)

sentences.english: We offer financial assistance to students.
sentences.chinese: 我们向学生提供经济援助。

sentences.english: Can I be of any assistance (=  can I help you  ) ?
sentences.chinese: 我能帮什么忙吗？

detailed_translations.english: help or support

name: assistant
trans: 助理, 助手, 辅助, 副 (noun.)

sentences.english: a clerical assistant
sentences.chinese: 文书助理

sentences.english: ...the assistant secretary of defence.
sentences.chinese: …助理国防部长。

detailed_translations.english: someone who helps someone else in their work, especially by doing the less important jobs

detailed_translations.chinese: 辅助的，助理的；有帮助的
detailed_translations.english: Assistant is used in front of titles or jobs to indicate a slightly lower rank. For example, an assistant director is one rank lower than a director in an organization.

name: associate
trans: 副学士, 副, 准 (adj.); 联想, 助理, 同事 (noun.); 关联, 交往 (verb.)

sentences.english: Through science we've got the idea of associating progress with the future.
sentences.chinese: 通过科学我们已有了将进步与未来联系起来的观念。

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…联系在一起；使联合，结合；交往	[ə'səuʃiət]
detailed_translations.english: to make a connection in your mind between one thing or person and another
someone who is a member etc of something, but who is at a lower level and has fewer rights
someone who you work or do business with

name: association
trans: 协会, 关联, 公会, 联想 (noun.)

sentences.english: Scotland has all kinds of happy associations for me.
sentences.chinese: 苏格兰给我各种各样愉快的联想。

detailed_translations.english: a relationship with a particular person, organization, group etc

name: assume
trans: 假设, 承担, 假定, 猜 (verb.)

sentences.english: I think we can safely assume (=  it is almost certain  ) that interest rates will go up again soon.
sentences.chinese: 我想我们几乎可以肯定，利率很快会再次上调。

sentences.english: When it got to midnight and Paul was still not back, I began to assume the worst (=  think that the worst possible thing had happened  ) .
sentences.chinese: 到午夜时保罗还没回来，我就开始往最坏的地方想了。

sentences.english: Whoever they appoint will assume responsibility for all financial matters.
sentences.chinese: 不管他们任命的是谁，他都要负责财务方面的所有事务。

sentences.english: These relationships assume great importance in times of crisis.
sentences.chinese: 在危急时刻，这些关系显得尤为重要。

detailed_translations.english: to think that something is true, although you do not have definite proof

name: assumption
trans: 假设, 假定, 设想, 假想 (noun.)

sentences.english: You would be making an assumption that's not based on any fact that you could report.
sentences.chinese: 你会做出不以你能报道的任何事实为依据的一种假设。

detailed_translations.english: something that you think is true although you have no definite proof

name: assure
trans: 保证, 确保 (verb.)

sentences.english: The document is genuine, I can assure you .
sentences.chinese: 我能向你保证，这文件是真的。

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone that something will definitely happen or is definitely true so that they are less worried

name: at
trans: 在 (prep.)

sentences.english: They live at 18 Victoria Street.
sentences.chinese: 他们住在维多利亚街18 号。

sentences.english: Does this train stop at Preston?
sentences.chinese: 这列火车在普雷斯顿停吗？

sentences.english: I was waiting at the bus stop.
sentences.chinese: 我在公共汽车站等着。

sentences.english: Liz and her friend sat down at a corner table.
sentences.chinese: 莉兹和她的朋友在靠角落的一张桌子旁坐下。

sentences.english: Turn left at the church.
sentences.chinese: 在教堂那里朝左转。

sentences.english: We’ll meet at Harry’s (=  at Harry’s house  ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们将在哈里家碰头。

sentences.english: I spent an unpleasant hour at the dentist’s.
sentences.chinese: 我在牙医诊所度过了难熬的一小时。

sentences.english: The film starts at 8 o'clock.
sentences.chinese: 电影8点钟开始。

detailed_translations.english: used to say exactly where something or someone is, or where something happens

name: atmosphere
trans: 气氛, 大气, 氛围, 大气层 (noun.)

sentences.english: The hotel had a lovely relaxed atmosphere .
sentences.chinese: 那家宾馆的气氛轻松愉快。

sentences.english: The atmosphere at home was rather tense.
sentences.chinese: 家里的气氛很紧张。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling that an event or place gives you

name: attach
trans: 附加, 附上, 附, 附着 (verb.)

sentences.english: When approving a merger, the commission can attach conditions.
sentences.chinese: 委员会在批准公司合并时可能附加条件。

detailed_translations.chinese: 缚， 系， 贴， 附加； 使依恋， 使喜爱； 使附属； 认为有
detailed_translations.english: to allow something to happen, but only if someone agrees to do a particular thing or accept a particular idea

name: attack
trans: 攻击, 袭击, 进攻, 发作 (noun.); 攻打 (verb.)

sentences.english: a bomb attack
sentences.chinese: 炸弹袭击

sentences.english: a knife attack
sentences.chinese: 持刀攻击

sentences.english: an arson attack
sentences.chinese: 纵火袭击

sentences.english: victims of racial attacks
sentences.chinese: 种族袭击的受害者

detailed_translations.chinese: 攻击， 进攻； 突然发作
detailed_translations.english: an act of violence that is intended to hurt a person or damage a place

name: attempt
trans: 尝试, 企图, 试图, 试 (noun.)

sentences.english: Weather conditions prevented them from attempting the jump.
sentences.chinese: 天气状况使他们无法尝试跳伞。

detailed_translations.chinese: 尝试， 试图， 努力
detailed_translations.english: to try to do something, especially something difficult

name: attend
trans: 出席, 参加, 就读, 参与 (verb.)

sentences.english: Only 12 people attended the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 只有12个人出席了会议。

sentences.english: Please let us know if you are unable to attend.
sentences.chinese: 如果不能出席，请通知我们。

sentences.english: On his deathbed the General was attended by several doctors.
sentences.chinese: 将军临终时有几名医生在照料他。

detailed_translations.english: to go to an event such as a meeting or a class

name: attention
trans: 注意, 注意力, 关注, 重视 (noun.)

sentences.english: My attention wasn’t really on the game.
sentences.chinese: 我的注意力其实不在比赛上。

sentences.english: She tried to pay attention to what he was saying.
sentences.chinese: 她尽量注意听他说话。

sentences.english: If you paid more attention in class, you might actually learn something!
sentences.chinese: 要是你上课更认真些，也许能实实在在地学到些东西！

sentences.english: Scott sat down at his desk and turned his attention to the file he had in front of him.
sentences.chinese: 斯科特在自己的办公桌前坐下，将注意力转向面前的文件。

sentences.english: As a society we need to give more attention to the needs of older people.
sentences.chinese: 生活在同一社会里，我们得更加关注长者的需求。

sentences.english: Now he’s gone, I can give you my undivided attention .
sentences.chinese: 现在他已经走了，我可以把全部注意力都放在你身上。

sentences.english: This game is fun and is sure to keep the attention of any young student.
sentences.chinese: 这个游戏很有趣，一定能使年幼学生保持注意力。

sentences.english: They listened to the speech with close attention .
sentences.chinese: 他们很认真地听演讲。

sentences.english: Attention to detail is essential in this job.
sentences.chinese: 关注细节是这份工作所必需的。

sentences.english: During the lecture Sarah’s attention began to wander .
sentences.chinese: 上课时，萨拉开始走神了。

detailed_translations.english: when you carefully listen to, look at, or think about someone or something

name: attitude
trans: 态度, 姿态, 心态, 姿 (noun.)

sentences.english: As soon as they found out I was a doctor, their whole attitude changed.
sentences.chinese: 他们一听说我是医生，态度就完全改变了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 态度， 看法； 姿势
detailed_translations.english: the opinions and feelings that you usually have about something, especially when this is shown in your behaviour

name: attorney
trans: 律师, 检察官, 受权, 检察长 (noun.)

sentences.english: ...a prosecuting attorney.
sentences.chinese: …一位公诉律师。

detailed_translations.english: a lawyer

name: attract
trans: 吸引, 招揽, 吸纳, 引来 (verb.)

sentences.english: I’m not usually attracted to blondes.
sentences.chinese: 我一般不喜欢金发女子。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone interested in something, or make them want to take part in something

name: attraction
trans: 吸引力, 吸引, 景点, 胜地 (noun.)

sentences.english: Sexual attraction is a large part of falling in love.
sentences.chinese: 堕入爱河很大部分是由于性吸引。

sentences.english: gravitational/magnetic attraction
sentences.chinese: 地心引力；磁力

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of liking sb, especially sexually

name: attractive
trans: 具吸引力, 吸引力, 诱人, 迷人 (adj.)

sentences.english: an attractive young woman
sentences.chinese: 妩媚动人的年轻女子

sentences.english: Women seem to find him attractive .
sentences.chinese: 女性似乎觉得他很有吸引力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有吸引力的， 引起注意的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is attractive is good looking, especially in a way that makes you sexually interested in them

name: audience
trans: 观众, 听众, 受众, 观众席 (noun.)

sentences.english: The show attracts a regular audience of about 20 million.
sentences.chinese: 这个节目吸引了大约两千万固定观众收看。

sentences.english: Goya was one of the first painters to look for a wider audience for his work.
sentences.chinese: 戈雅是最早为自己的作品寻找更多观赏者的画家之一。

detailed_translations.english: the people who watch or listen to a particular programme, or who see or hear a particular artist’s, writer’s etc work

name: aunt
trans: 阿姨, 姑姑, 姨妈, 姑妈 (noun.)

sentences.english: Aunt Mary
sentences.chinese: 玛丽姑妈

detailed_translations.english: the sister of your father or mother, or the wife of your father’s or mother’s brother

name: author
trans: 作者, 笔者, 作家, 本文 (noun.)

sentences.english: Nothomb is a Belgian author.
sentences.chinese: 诺东是位比利时作家。

sentences.english: It’s clear that the author is a woman.
sentences.chinese: 显然，这位作者是女性。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has written a book

name: authority
trans: 权威, 管理局, 事务监督, 权力 (noun.)

sentences.english: an agreement between the US and Colombian authorities
sentences.chinese: 美国和哥伦比亚当局的一份协议

sentences.english: Only the president has the authority to declare war.
sentences.chinese: 只有总统才有权宣战。

sentences.english: I need to speak to someone in authority (= who has a position of power ) .
sentences.chinese: 我得找管事的人谈谈。

detailed_translations.english: [plural] the people or organizations that are in charge of a particular country or area

name: automatic
trans: 自动, 全自动, 自动化 (adj.)

sentences.english: an automatic weapon
sentences.chinese: 自动武器

sentences.english: an automatic gearbox
sentences.chinese: 自动变速箱

sentences.english: My camera is fully automatic .
sentences.chinese: 我的照相机是全自动的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 自动的； 必然发生的； 无意识的
detailed_translations.english: an automatic machine is designed to work without needing someone to operate it for each part of a process
a weapon that can fire bullets continuously

name: automatically
trans: 自动 (adv.)

sentences.english: Join now and you will automatically receive 50% off your first purchase.
sentences.chinese: 现在加入，立即享受首次购物五折优惠。

detailed_translations.english: as the result of a situation or action, and without you having to do anything more

name: autumn
trans: 秋天, 秋, 秋季, 秋日 (noun.)

sentences.english: autumn mists
sentences.chinese: 秋天的雾霭

detailed_translations.english: the season between summer and winter, when leaves change colour and the weather becomes cooler

name: available
trans: 可用, 可, 提供, 现有 (adj.)

sentences.english: Tickets are available from the box office.
sentences.chinese: 售票处有票出售。

sentences.english: Meetings were held to update employees as soon as new information became available .
sentences.chinese: 一有新的信息就开会告诉员工。

sentences.english: Further building can continue when money is made available .
sentences.chinese: 有了资金就可以继续进一步的施工。

sentences.english: Every available space on the wall was covered in pictures.
sentences.chinese: 墙上每一个可用的地方都挂上了画。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可利用的，现有的；可获得的
detailed_translations.english: something that is available is able to be used or can easily be bought or found

name: average
trans: 平均, 普通, 一般, 人均 (adj.); 平均水平, 平均值, 平均数, 海损 (noun.)

sentences.english: The average American has not even thought about next year’s election.
sentences.chinese: 普通的美国人甚至还没有想过明年的选举。

sentences.english: In an average week I drive about 250 miles.
sentences.chinese: 平常我每周开车约250英里。

detailed_translations.english: having qualities that are typical of most people or things

name: avoid
trans: 避免, 避开, 躲避, 回避 (verb.)

sentences.english: Road safety is taught to young children to avoid road accidents.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子受到道路安全知识的教育，以避免交通事故。

sentences.english: It is important to take measures to avoid the risk of fire.
sentences.chinese: 采取措施避免火灾风险很重要。

sentences.english: Alan narrowly avoided an accident.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦险出事故。

detailed_translations.english: to prevent something bad from happening

name: awake
trans: 清醒, 醒, 醒来, 苏醒 (adj.); 唤醒 (verb.)

sentences.english: I hope he’s awake now.
sentences.chinese: 我希望他现在醒着。

sentences.english: She was still only half awake when I brought her a cup of coffee.
sentences.chinese: 我给她端去咖啡的时候，她还是半睡半醒的样子。

sentences.english: How do you stay awake during boring lectures?
sentences.chinese: 听无聊的课你是怎样不让自己睡着的？

sentences.english: Emma lay awake half the night, worrying.
sentences.chinese: 埃玛忧心忡忡，半宿都没睡着。

sentences.english: The noise brought him wide awake (=  completely awake  ) .
sentences.chinese: 那声音使他睡意全无。

sentences.english: It was midday when she awoke.
sentences.chinese: 她醒来时已是中午。

detailed_translations.english: not sleeping
to wake up, or to make someone wake up

name: award
trans: 奖, 奖项, 奖励, 裁决 (noun.)

sentences.english: Moodie has been awarded a golf scholarship at the University of Hawaii.
sentences.chinese: 穆迪获授夏威夷大学高尔夫奖学金。

sentences.english: The movie has won a number of awards.
sentences.chinese: 该片获得了多个奖项。

detailed_translations.english: to officially give someone something such as a prize or money to reward them for something they have done
something such as a prize or money given to someone to reward them for something they have done

name: aware
trans: 意识到, 知道, 知悉, 察觉 (adj.)

sentences.english: I don't think people are really aware of just how much it costs.
sentences.chinese: 我认为人们并不真正明白这要花多少钱。

sentences.english: Were you aware that something was wrong?
sentences.chinese: 你有没有意识到已经出了问题？

detailed_translations.english: knowing or realizing sth

name: awareness
trans: 意识, 觉知, 认识, 觉察 (noun.)

sentences.english: Health officials have tried to raise awareness (=  improve people’s knowledge  ) about AIDS.
sentences.chinese: 卫生部官员努力提高人们对艾滋病的认识。

detailed_translations.english: knowledge or understanding of a particular subject or situation

name: away
trans: 走, 带走, 离开, 远离 (adv.)

sentences.english: Go away!
sentences.chinese: 走开！

sentences.english: Dinah was crying as she drove slowly away.

trans: 啤酒, 杯啤酒, 啤, 瓶啤酒 (noun.)

sentences.english: a pint of beer
sentences.chinese: 一品脱啤酒

sentences.english: We sell draught beer (=  beer served from a large container, not a bottle  ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们出售散装啤酒。

detailed_translations.english: an alcoholic drink made from  malt  and  hop s

name: before
trans: 之前, 前 (prep.); 以前 (adv.)

sentences.english: The new road should be completed before the end of the year.
sentences.chinese: 这条新公路应该在年底前完工。

sentences.english: Let’s meet at our house before the show.
sentences.chinese: 看演出前在我们家碰头吧。

sentences.english: Larry arrived home before me.
sentences.chinese: 拉里在我之前到家。

sentences.english: We only got back from Scotland the day before yesterday (=  two days ago  ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们前天才从苏格兰回来。

sentences.english: Other students joined in the protest, and before long (=  soon  ) there was a crowd of 200 or so.
sentences.chinese: 其他学生也加入了抗议队伍，不久就有200人左右了。

detailed_translations.english: earlier than something or someone

name: beforehand
trans: 事先, 事前, 预先, 提前 (adv.)

sentences.english: The police need to be briefed beforehand on how to deal with this sort of situation.
sentences.chinese: 需要事先告诉警察这种情况怎样处理。

sentences.english: When you give a speech, it’s natural to feel nervous beforehand.
sentences.chinese: 你在演讲之前感到紧张是很自然的。

detailed_translations.english: before something else happens or is done

name: begin
trans: 开始, 首先, 开头, 展开 (verb.)

sentences.english: As everybody’s here, let’s begin.
sentences.chinese: 大家都到齐了，我们就开始吧。

sentences.english: In the third year students begin the study of classical Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 学生在三年级开始学古代汉语。

sentences.english: The president begins talks with the prime minister tonight.
sentences.chinese: 总统将于今晚和首相展开会谈。

detailed_translations.english: to start doing something
to start doing something

name: beginning
trans: 开始, 开端, 开头, 初 (noun.)

sentences.english: There’s a short poem at the beginning of every chapter.
sentences.chinese: 每一章的开头都有一首短诗。

sentences.english: From the beginning of my career as a journalist, I’ve been writing about gender issues.
sentences.chinese: 从我一开始干记者这一行，我就写性别议题的题材。

sentences.english: I thought he loved me; perhaps he did in the beginning .
sentences.chinese: 我以为他爱我，也许开始时他确实是爱我的。

sentences.english: That chance meeting marked the beginning of a long and happy relationship.
sentences.chinese: 那次邂逅展开了一段长久而幸福的关系。

sentences.english: This is just the beginning of a new and different life for you.
sentences.chinese: 这只是你新的别样生活的开始。

sentences.english: I said he would cause trouble, right from the beginning.
sentences.chinese: 我一开始就说过，他会惹事。

sentences.english: I opposed it from the very beginning.
sentences.chinese: 我一开始就反对。

sentences.english: The whole trip was a disaster from beginning to end.
sentences.chinese: 旅途从头到尾都在出乱子。

sentences.english: I think I have the beginnings of a cold.
sentences.chinese: 我感觉要感冒了。

sentences.english: He rose from humble beginnings to great wealth.
sentences.chinese: 他出身卑微，如今已腰缠万贯。

detailed_translations.english: the start or first part of an event, story, period of time etc

name: behalf
trans: 代表, 名义, 代, 说情 (noun.)

sentences.english: She asked the doctor to speak to her parents on her behalf.
sentences.chinese: 她请医生代她同她父母谈谈。

sentences.english: On behalf of everyone here, may I wish you a very happy retirement.
sentences.chinese: 请允许我代表在座的各位祝你退休后生活愉快。

detailed_translations.english: instead of someone, or as their representative

name: behave
trans: 行为, 表现, 做人, 行为举止 (verb.)

sentences.english: She behaved in a very responsible way .
sentences.chinese: 她表现得很有责任心。

sentences.english: I couldn't believe these people were behaving in this way.
sentences.chinese: 我无法相信这些人竟这样行事。

detailed_translations.chinese: 表现，举止；运转，做出反应
detailed_translations.english: to do things that are good, bad, sensible etc
The way that you behave is the way that you do and say things, and the things that you do and say

name: behaviour
trans: 行为, 举止, 举动 (noun.)

sentences.english: It is important to reward good behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 表现好要给予奖励，这是很重要的。

detailed_translations.english: the things that a person or animal does

name: behind
trans: 背后, 后面, 身后 (prep.)

sentences.english: I turned to speak to the person standing behind me.
sentences.chinese: 我转身和站在我后面的那人说话。

sentences.english: Someone could easily creep up behind us.
sentences.chinese: 很可能有人跟在我们后面。

sentences.english: The car behind was hooting impatiently.
sentences.chinese: 后面那辆车不耐烦地按着喇叭。

sentences.english: Jane shut the door behind her.
sentences.chinese: 简随手关上身后的门。

sentences.english: The manager was sitting behind a large desk.
sentences.chinese: 经理坐在一张大办公桌的后面。

detailed_translations.english: at or towards the back of a thing or person

name: being
trans: 被, 正在, 作为, 成为 (verb.)

sentences.english: a law that first came into being in 1912
sentences.chinese: 于1912年制定的一条法律

sentences.english: human beings
sentences.chinese: 人

detailed_translations.english: existence

name: belief
trans: 信念, 信仰, 相信, 信心 (noun.)

sentences.english: a strong belief in God
sentences.chinese: 笃信上帝

sentences.english: When you get something wrong, it can shake your belief in yourself.
sentences.chinese: 如果有什么事情没做好，就会动摇你对自己的信心。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling that something is definitely true or definitely exists

name: believe
trans: 相信, 认为, 信, 坚信 (verb.)

sentences.english: You shouldn’t believe everything you read.
sentences.chinese: 你不应尽信书上看来的东西。

sentences.english: I believed him, even though his story sounded unlikely.
sentences.chinese: 我相信了他，尽管他的话听上去难以置信。

sentences.english: I don’t believe a word of it (=  I think it is completely untrue  ) .
sentences.chinese: 我一句话也不相信。

sentences.english: Did you honestly believe that I’d be stupid enough to do that?
sentences.chinese: 你真的认为我会傻到做那样的事情吗？。

detailed_translations.english: to be sure that something is true or that someone is telling the truth

name: bell
trans: 贝尔, 铃, 钟, 钟声 (noun.)

sentences.english: church bells
sentences.chinese: 教堂的钟

detailed_translations.english: a piece of electrical equipment that makes a ringing sound, used as a signal or to get someone’s attention

name: belong
trans: 属于, 归属, 所属, 属於 (verb.)

sentences.english: The house had belonged to her family for three or four generations.
sentences.chinese: 这座房子属于她家已有三四代了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 属于，应归入；居住；适宜；应被放置
detailed_translations.english: If something belongs to you, you own it

name: below
trans: 下面 (adv.); 低于, 以下, 下 (prep.)

sentences.english: an animal that lives below ground
sentences.chinese: 生活在地下的动物

sentences.english: Water was dripping onto the floor below.
sentences.chinese: 水滴到下面的地板上。

sentences.english: I could hear voices in the courtyard below my window.
sentences.chinese: 我能听到院子里有人在我的窗下说话。

sentences.english: They camped a few hundred feet below the summit.
sentences.chinese: 他们在山峰下面几百英尺的地方扎了营。

sentences.english: Down below, people were talking and laughing.
sentences.chinese: 下面，人们谈笑风生。

sentences.english: Somewhere far below, a door slammed.
sentences.chinese: 下面远远的什么地方有一扇门砰地关上了。

sentences.english: The kitchen is directly below her bedroom.
sentences.chinese: 厨房就在她卧室的正下方。

sentences.english: Captain Parker went below (=  to the lower level of the ship  ) , leaving Clooney in charge.
sentences.chinese: 帕克船长下去了，让克卢尼掌舵。

detailed_translations.chinese: 在下面，在较低处；在本页下面
detailed_translations.english: in a lower place or position, or on a lower level

name: belt
trans: 皮带, 带, 腰带, 胶带 (noun.)

sentences.chinese: 他解开皮带。

detailed_translations.english: a band of leather, cloth etc that you wear around your waist to hold up your clothes or for decoration

detailed_translations.chinese: 用带子系住；用皮带抽打
detailed_translations.english: to fasten something with a belt

name: bench
trans: 板凳, 长凳上, 长椅上, 长凳 (noun.)

sentences.chinese: 我们坐在公园的长椅上。

trans: 弯曲, 弯腰, 屈服, 曲 (verb.); 弯, 折弯, 弯道, 弯管 (noun.)

sentences.chinese: 李俯下身来亲她。

sentences.english: She bent her head.
sentences.chinese: 她低下头。

sentences.english: Bend your knees, but keep your back straight.
sentences.chinese: 膝盖弯曲，背部保持挺直。

a curved part of something, especially a road or river

trans: 下方, 下 (prep.)

sentences.chinese: 现在，顶部图层应当有小箭头指向下面的图层。

sentences.chinese: 山上的炮楼把下面的海港地区置于射程之内。

sentences.english: They must all be drowning beneath him, in the watery caves of the rock!
sentences.chinese: 他们一定是在他下面的水里，就在那岩石充满了水的洞中游泳了！

trans: 效益, 利益, 好处, 造福 (noun.); 受益, 获益, 得益, 有利于 (verb.)

sentences.english: They are working together to benefit the whole community.
sentences.chinese: 他们在为整个社区的利益共同努力。

trans: 旁边, 旁 (prep.)

sentences.chinese: 温迪走过来，坐在我身边。

sentences.english: the table beside the bed
sentences.chinese: 床边的桌子

sentences.chinese: 当时我就站在她的旁边。

detailed_translations.english: next to or very close to the side of someone or something

name: best
trans: 最好, 最佳, 最棒, 最 (adj.)

sentences.english: He won the best actor award.
sentences.chinese: 他获得最佳男演员奖。

sentences.english: What’s the best way to cook this fish?
sentences.chinese: 这鱼怎么烧最好？

sentences.english: The best thing to do is to stop worrying.
sentences.chinese: 最好的办法就是不要再担心。

sentences.english: Our pilots are given the best possible training.
sentences.chinese: 我们的飞行员接受最好的训练。

sentences.english: We use only the very best ingredients.
sentences.chinese: 我们只用最好的原料。

detailed_translations.english: better than anything else or anyone else in quality, skill, how effective it is etc

name: bet
trans: 打赌, 敢打赌, 赌, 猜 (verb.); 赌注, 下注 (noun.)

sentences.english: How much do you want to bet?
sentences.chinese: 你想赌多少钱？

sentences.english: a £50 bet
sentences.chinese: 50英镑的赌注

detailed_translations.english: to risk money on the result of a race, game, competition, or other future event
an agreement to risk money on the result of a race, game etc or on something happening, or the money that you risk

name: better
trans: 更好, 较好, 好些, 美好 (adj.); 最好 (adv.)

sentences.english: Your stereo is better than mine.
sentences.chinese: 你的音响比我的好。

sentences.english: There must be a better way to do this.
sentences.chinese: 一定还有更好的办法来做这件事。

sentences.english: He can speak French a lot better than I can.
sentences.chinese: 他法语讲得比我好多了。

detailed_translations.english: more useful, interesting, satisfactory, effective, suitable etc

name: between
trans: 之间, 间 (prep.)

sentences.english: He supplements his regular meals by eating between meals.
sentences.chinese: 他在两餐之间吃点东西来补充正餐。

sentences.english: The object of these experiments was to find the connection, if any, between the two phenomena.
sentences.chinese: 这些实验的目的就是探索这两种现象之间的联系，如果存在着任何联系的话。

trans: 超越, 超出 (prep.)

sentences.english: They crossed the mountains and headed for the valleys beyond.
sentences.chinese: 他们翻过山，向更远处的山谷进发。

sentences.english: Beyond the river, cattle were grazing.
sentences.chinese: 河的那边，牛在吃草。

sentences.english: She drove through Westport, and stopped a few miles beyond at a wayside inn.
sentences.chinese: 她驱车穿过西港，在几英里外的一个路边旅馆停了下来。

detailed_translations.english: on or to the further side of something

name: bicycle
trans: 自行车, 辆自行车, 脚踏车, 单车 (noun.)

sentences.english: Can James ride a bicycle yet?
sentences.chinese: 詹姆斯会骑自行车了吗？

detailed_translations.english: a vehicle with two wheels that you ride by pushing its pedals with your feet

name: bid
trans: 出价, 投标, 申办, 竞标 (noun.)

sentences.english: the person who places the highest bid
sentences.chinese: 出价最高的人

sentences.english: We’ve made a bid of nearly £400 million for the company.
sentences.chinese: 我们出价近四亿英镑收购那家公司。

sentences.english: A takeover bid for the airline was launched today.
sentences.chinese: 今天有人出价收购该航空公司。

sentences.english: She bid £100 for a Victorian chair.
sentences.chinese: 她出价100英镑买一把维多利亚时代的椅子。

sentences.english: The two men ended up bidding against each other at the auction.
sentences.chinese: 结果那两个人在拍卖会上较起劲来。

detailed_translations.english: an offer to pay a particular price for something, especially at an  auction
to offer to pay a particular price for goods, especially in an auction

name: big
trans: 大, 大型, 重大, 巨大 (adj.)

sentences.english: a big house
sentences.chinese: 大房子

sentences.english: I need a bigger desk.
sentences.chinese: 我需要一张大一点的桌子。

sentences.english: She had a big grin on her face.
sentences.chinese: 她脸上挂着大大的笑容。

sentences.english: a big increase in crime
sentences.chinese: 犯罪率的大幅上升

sentences.english: Los Angeles is the biggest city in California.
sentences.chinese: 洛杉矶是加利福尼亚最大的城市。

sentences.english: The garage isn’t big enough for two cars.
sentences.chinese: 这个车库不够大，停不下两辆汽车。

sentences.english: When they lose, they lose in a big way (=  to a large degree  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们要输就输得很惨。

sentences.english: There was this great big (=  extremely big  ) spider in the sink.
sentences.chinese: 洗涤槽里有只特大的蜘蛛。

detailed_translations.english: of more than average size or amount

name: bike
trans: 自行车, 辆自行车, 脚踏车, 骑自行车 (noun.)

sentences.english: Let’s go for a bike ride.
sentences.chinese: 我们去骑会儿自行车吧。

sentences.english: She bikes to work every day.
sentences.chinese: 她每天骑自行车上班。

detailed_translations.english: a bicycle
to ride a bicycle

name: bill
trans: 条例草案, 比尔, 法案, 本条例草案 (noun.)

sentences.english: Have you paid the phone bill?
sentences.chinese: 电话费你付了吗？

detailed_translations.english: a written list showing how much you have to pay for services you have received, work that has been done etc

name: bin
trans: 滨, 斌, 彬, 滨河路 (noun.)

sentences.english: Put your rubbish in the bin.
sentences.chinese: 把你的垃圾放进箱子。

sentences.english: But you know how it is with us human you take something good you dissect it scrutinise it time and again not believing your good fortune and finally cast it to the "no" bin.
sentences.chinese: 可是你知道的，对我们人类来说，你以为某件事物很好、你仔细分析它、细看它一次又一次，不相信你的好运，最后又把它丢到「不」的箱子里（不再理它），这真是很消极又愚蠢的。

detailed_translations.english: a large container for storing things, such as goods in a shop or substances in a factory

name: bird
trans: 鸟, 只鸟, 鸟儿, 小鸟 (noun.)

sentences.english: wild birds
sentences.chinese: 野鸟

sentences.english: The dawn was filled with the sound of birds.
sentences.chinese: 黎明时分，鸟鸣声不绝于耳。

sentences.english: a flock of birds
sentences.chinese: 一群飞鸟

sentences.english: a wooden bird cage
sentences.chinese: 木制鸟笼

detailed_translations.english: a creature with wings and feathers that can usually fly. Many birds sing and build nests, and female birds lay eggs

name: birth
trans: 出生, 诞生, 生育, 降生 (noun.)

sentences.english: Congratulations on the birth of your daughter!
sentences.chinese: 恭喜你生了个女儿！

sentences.english: He only weighed 2 kilos at birth.
sentences.chinese: 他出生时体重只有两公斤。

sentences.english: Henry has been blind from birth.
sentences.chinese: 亨利先天失明。

sentences.english: What’s your date of birth ?
sentences.chinese: 你的出生日期是哪一天？

sentences.english: The exact place of birth is not recorded.
sentences.chinese: 确切的出生地没有记录。

sentences.english: They believe that the position of the planets at the time of birth determines the fate of the individual.
sentences.chinese: 他们相信，出生时的星象决定了一个人的命运。

sentences.english: More and more women are choosing to have home births.
sentences.chinese: 越来越多的女性选择在家分娩。

sentences.english: Smoking in pregnancy has been linked to premature birth.
sentences.chinese: 孕期吸烟已被认为与早产有关联。

sentences.english: the association between birth weight and blood pressure
sentences.chinese: 出生体重和血压的关系

sentences.english: The drug was found to cause serious birth defects.
sentences.chinese: 这种药被发现可造成严重的先天缺陷。

sentences.english: a woman of noble birth
sentences.chinese: 一位出身于贵族的女子

detailed_translations.english: the time when a baby comes out of its mother’s body

name: birthday
trans: 生日, 岁生日, 过生日, 生日那天 (noun.)

sentences.english: It’s my birthday on Monday.
sentences.chinese: 星期一是我的生日。

sentences.english: My aunt called to wish me a happy birthday.
sentences.chinese: 我姑妈打电话来祝我生日快乐。

sentences.english: The City of Cleveland Orchestra is celebrating its 200th birthday.
sentences.chinese: 克利夫兰市管弦乐队正在庆祝乐队成立200周年。

detailed_translations.english: the day in each year which is the same date as the one on which you were born

name: biscuit
trans: 饼干, 饼乾, 块饼干, 饼 (noun.)

sentences.english: a packet of chocolate biscuits
sentences.chinese: 一包巧克力饼干

sentences.english: cheese and biscuits
sentences.chinese: 奶酪和饼干

detailed_translations.english: a small thin dry cake that is usually sweet and made for one person to eat

name: bit
trans: 位, 比特, 咬, 钻头 (noun.)

sentences.english: He’s taken the engine to bits .
sentences.chinese: 他把发动机拆开了。

detailed_translations.english: a small piece of something

name: bite
trans: 咬, 咬住, 啃 (verb.); 咬一口, 咬伤, 叮咬, 撕咬 (noun.)

sentences.english: The dog bit him and made his hand bleed.
sentences.chinese: 那只狗把他的手咬出血了。

sentences.english: The dog’s been badly bitten by fleas.
sentences.chinese: 狗被跳蚤咬得很厉害。

detailed_translations.english: to use your teeth to cut, crush, or chew something

name: bitter
trans: 苦, 苦涩, 苦味, 痛苦 (adj.)

sentences.english: His photo stirred up bitter memories.
sentences.chinese: 他的照片勾起了痛苦的回忆。

detailed_translations.english: making you feel very unhappy and upset

name: black
trans: 黑色, 黑, 黑人, 黑衣 (adj.); 布莱克 (noun.)

sentences.english: a black evening dress
sentences.chinese: 黑色晚礼服

sentences.english: It was still pitch black (= very dark ) out.
sentences.chinese: 外面依然一片漆黑。

detailed_translations.english: having the darkest colour, like coal or night

name: blade
trans: 叶片, 刀片, 刀锋, 刀刃 (noun.)

sentences.english: a razor blade
sentences.chinese: 剃刀刀片

detailed_translations.english: a hard block of baked clay used for building walls, houses etc

name: bridge
trans: 桥, 桥梁, 大桥, 座桥 (noun.)

sentences.english: He walked back over the railway bridge.
sentences.chinese: 他从铁路桥上走了回去。

sentences.english: They recreate themselves with playing bridge.
sentences.chinese: 他们以打桥牌作消遣。

detailed_translations.english: a structure built over a river, road etc that allows people or vehicles to cross from one side to the other

name: brief
trans: 简短, 短暂, 简要, 简略 (adj.); 简介, 简报 (noun.)

sentences.english: We stopped by Alice’s house for a brief visit.
sentences.chinese: 我们顺路在艾丽斯家小坐片刻。

sentences.english: Let’s keep this conversation brief; I have a plane to catch.
sentences.chinese: 我们长话短说吧，我还要赶飞机。

sentences.english: A Defense Department spokesman briefed reporters.
sentences.chinese: 一位国防部发言人向记者们介绍了情况。

detailed_translations.english: continuing for a short time

detailed_translations.chinese: 向…介绍基本情况，做…的提要
detailed_translations.english: If someone briefs you, especially about a piece of work or a serious matter, they give you information that you need before you do it or consider it
a short spoken or written statement giving facts about a law case

name: briefly
trans: 简要, 扼要, 简述 (noun.); 简略, 简单, 短暂, 简短 (adv.)

sentences.english: We stopped off briefly in London.
sentences.chinese: 我们在伦敦短暂停留。

detailed_translations.english: for a short time

name: bright
trans: 明亮, 光明, 亮, 鲜艳 (adj.)

sentences.english: Her eyes were hurting from the bright lights.
sentences.chinese: 明亮的光线刺痛了她的眼睛。

sentences.english: bright sunshine
sentences.chinese: 灿烂的阳光

sentences.english: a large bright room
sentences.chinese: 明亮的大房间

sentences.english: He was an exceptionally bright child.
sentences.chinese: 他是个特别聪明的孩子。

detailed_translations.english: shining strongly, or with plenty of light

name: brilliant
trans: 辉煌, 灿烂, 才华横溢, 光辉 (adj.)

sentences.english: She closed her eyes against the brilliant light.
sentences.chinese: 强烈的光线下，她闭起了眼睛。

sentences.english: We sat outside in the brilliant sunshine.
sentences.chinese: 我们坐在外面，沐浴在灿烂的阳光下。

sentences.english: She was dressed in brilliant white.
sentences.chinese: 她穿着一身耀眼的白色。

sentences.english: The film was absolutely brilliant.
sentences.chinese: 这部电影极为出色。

detailed_translations.english: brilliant light or colour is very bright and strong

name: bring
trans: 带来, 带, 把, 使 (verb.)

sentences.english: Did you bring an umbrella?
sentences.chinese: 你带伞了吗？

sentences.english: The senator’s speech brought an angry response from Civil Rights groups.
sentences.chinese: 那名参议员的话引起了一些民权组织的愤怒。

sentences.english: The discovery of gold brought thousands of people to the Transvaal.
sentences.chinese: 黄金的发现把成千上万的人引到了德兰士瓦。

detailed_translations.english: to take something or someone with you to the place where you are now, or to the place you are talking about

name: broad
trans: 广阔, 广泛, 宽阔, 宽广 (adj.)

sentences.english: We went along a broad passage.
sentences.chinese: 我们走在一条宽阔的走廊上。

sentences.english: He was six feet tall, with broad shoulders.
sentences.chinese: 他身高六英尺，肩膀宽阔。

detailed_translations.english: a road, river, or part of someone’s body etc that is broad is wide

name: brother
trans: 哥哥, 兄弟, 哥, 大哥 (noun.)

sentences.english: I have two brothers, William and Mark.
sentences.chinese: 我有两个兄弟，威廉和马克。

sentences.english: My big brother (=  older brother  ) has always looked after me.
sentences.chinese: 我哥哥一直照顾我。

sentences.english: my twin brother
sentences.chinese: 我的双胞胎兄弟

sentences.english: We must work together, brothers!
sentences.chinese: 我们必须携手工作，伙计们！

detailed_translations.english: a male who has the same parents as you

name: brown
trans: 棕色, 褐色, 咖啡色 (adj.); 布朗, 棕, 褐, 布朗大学 (noun.)

sentences.english: This particular model is available in brown, white, or grey.
sentences.chinese: 这个型号的产品有棕色、白色和灰色的。

sentences.english: the browns and greens of the landscape
sentences.chinese: 棕绿相映的风景

detailed_translations.english: the colour of earth, wood, or coffee

name: brush
trans: 刷, 刷子, 画笔, 电刷 (noun.); 刷牙 (verb.)

sentences.english: a scrubbing brush
sentences.chinese: 硬毛刷，板刷

detailed_translations.english: an object that you use for cleaning, painting, making your hair tidy etc, made with a lot of hairs,  bristle s  , or thin pieces of plastic, fastened to a handle

name: buck
trans: 降压, 巴克, 龅, 赛珍珠 (noun.); 振作 (verb.)

sentences.english: He was a rebel who bucked the system (=  opposed rules or authority  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他是一个反抗体制的叛逆者。

sentences.english: He owes me ten bucks.
sentences.chinese: 他欠我十美元。

detailed_translations.english: to oppose something in a direct way
a US, Canadian, or Australian dollar

name: bucket
trans: 桶, 水桶, 斗, 铲斗 (noun.)

sentences.english: He let down a bucket into the well to draw water.
sentences.chinese: 他把吊桶放进井里打水。

detailed_translations.english: an open container with a handle, used for carrying and holding things, especially liquids

name: buddy
trans: 巴迪, 伙计, 哥们, 好友 (noun.)

sentences.english: We’re good buddies.
sentences.chinese: 我们是好朋友。

detailed_translations.chinese: 伙伴，好朋友；密友；小男孩
detailed_translations.english: a friend

name: budget
trans: 预算, 预算案, 财政预算案, 财政预算 (noun.)

sentences.english: We’ll have to budget more carefully.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须更仔细地安排开支。

sentences.english: This scheme enables you to budget the cost through fixed monthly payments.
sentences.chinese: 这个计划可以让你把费用分摊在每个月里等额偿还。

sentences.english: Cheap flights are available from budget travel agents from $240.
sentences.chinese: 起价$240的廉价机票可从一些经济旅行社那里买到。

detailed_translations.english: to carefully plan and control how much money you spend and what you will buy with it

detailed_translations.chinese: 低廉的， 收费公道的
detailed_translations.english: Budget is used in advertising to suggest that something is being sold cheaply
the money that is available to an organization or person, or a plan of how it will be spent

name: bug
trans: 臭虫, 虫子, 虫, 错误 (noun.)

sentences.english: There’s a nasty bug going round (=  that a lot of people have caught  ) .
sentences.chinese: 现在流行着一种很烦人的传染病。

sentences.english: a 24-hour flu bug
sentences.chinese: 一天即愈的流感

detailed_translations.chinese: 虫子；小病；故障，缺陷；窃听器
detailed_translations.english: an illness that people catch very easily from each other but is not very serious

detailed_translations.chinese: 烦扰， 纠缠； 在…装窃听器
detailed_translations.english: to put a  bug (=  small piece of electronic equipment  )  somewhere secretly in order to listen to conversations

name: build
trans: 建立, 构建, 建造, 打造 (verb.)

sentences.english: The purpose is to build new houses for local people.
sentences.chinese: 目的是要为当地居民建造新的住宅。

sentences.english: The road took many years to build.
sentences.chinese: 这条路修了好几年。

sentences.english: They needed $3 million to build the bridge.
sentences.chinese: 他们需要300万美元来修建这座桥。

sentences.english: It is the female birds that build the nests.
sentences.chinese: 筑巢的是雌鸟。

sentences.english: She had built a reputation as a criminal lawyer.
sentences.chinese: 她已经树立起了刑事诉讼律师的声望。

sentences.english: She’s been busy building her career.
sentences.chinese: 她忙于创建自己的事业。

detailed_translations.english: to make something, especially a building or something large

name: builder
trans: 建设者, 成器, 建筑工地, 助剂 (noun.)

sentences.english: The builders have finished the roof.
sentences.chinese: 建筑工人们已经完成了屋顶的建造。

detailed_translations.english: a person or a company that builds or repairs buildings

name: building
trans: 建筑, 建设, 大楼, 建筑物 (noun.); 构建, 建立, 建造, 建 (verb.)

sentences.english: The offices are on the top two floors of the building.
sentences.chinese: 办公室在大楼最高的两层。

sentences.english: a farmhouse and other farm buildings
sentences.chinese: 农舍以及其他的农场建筑

sentences.english: There is a limited supply of land for building.
sentences.chinese: 建筑用地供应有限。

detailed_translations.english: a structure such as a house, church, or factory, that has a roof and walls

name: bump
trans: 凹凸, 撞, 磕碰, 肿块 (noun.)

sentences.chinese: 她的后脑勺上肿起了一块。

sentences.english: He had a few injuries, mostly bumps and bruises.
sentences.chinese: 他有几处受了伤，大都是肿块和瘀青。

to hit or knock against something

name: bunch
trans: 堆, 束, 串, 一群 (noun.)

sentences.english: She bunched the cloth up and threw it away.
sentences.chinese: 她把布揉成一团扔了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 集中， 挤在一起； 形成一束

a group of things that are fastened, held, or growing together
to hold or tie things together in a bunch

name: burn
trans: 烧伤 (noun.); 烧, 燃烧, 烧掉, 刻录 (verb.)

sentences.english: I burnt all his old letters.
sentences.chinese: 我把他以前的信全烧了。

sentences.english: Cars were burned and shops were looted during the rioting.
sentences.chinese: 暴乱期间，汽车被焚，商店遭抢劫。

sentences.english: The Grand Hotel had burnt to the ground .
sentences.chinese: 格兰德大酒店被大火夷为平地。

sentences.english: Make sure the iron isn’t too hot or you’ll burn the cloth.
sentences.chinese: 注意熨斗温度不能过高，免得烫坏布料。

sentences.english: He dropped his cigarette and burnt a hole in the carpet.
sentences.chinese: 他的香烟掉下来，把地毯烫了一个洞。

detailed_translations.chinese: 燃烧；烧毁，灼伤；激起…的愤怒
detailed_translations.english: to destroy or damage something with fire
an injury caused by fire, heat, the light of the sun, or acid

name: burst
trans: 爆裂, 突发, 爆, 迸发 (noun.)

sentences.english: The pipes had burst and the house was under two feet of water.
sentences.chinese: 水管爆裂，房子被水淹了两英尺。

sentences.english: a sudden burst of activity/energy/anger/enthusiasm
sentences.chinese: 活动 / 能量 / 怒火 / 热情的迸发

detailed_translations.english: if something bursts, or if you burst it, it breaks open or apart suddenly and violently so that its contents come out
the act of something bursting or the place where it has burst

name: bury
trans: 埋葬, 埋, 掩埋, 葬 (verb.); 埋没 (noun.)

sentences.english: Electric cables are buried beneath the streets.
sentences.chinese: 电缆埋在街道的下面。

detailed_translations.english: to put someone who has died in a  grave

detailed_translations.chinese: (Bury)人名；(法)比里；(英、西)伯里；(德、意、罗、波、捷、匈)布里；(俄)布雷

name: bus
trans: 总线, 巴士, 公共汽车, 公交车 (noun.)

sentences.english: I took a bus to San Francisco.
sentences.chinese: 我乘公共汽车去旧金山。

sentences.english: Buses run at 15 and 30 minutes past the hour.
sentences.chinese: 公共汽车在每小时的15分和30分时发车。

detailed_translations.english: a large vehicle that people pay to travel on

name: business
trans: 业务, 商业, 商务, 生意 (noun.)

sentences.english: Students on the course learn about all aspects of business.
sentences.chinese: 这门课程的学生要学习商业活动的各个方面。

sentences.english: Carl began in the music business by running a recording studio.
sentences.chinese: 卡尔是从经营录音棚开始干音乐这一行的。

sentences.english: We do business with a number of Italian companies.
sentences.chinese: 我们和一些意大利公司做生意。

sentences.english: ...recording Ben as he goes about his business.
sentences.chinese: …摄录本做自己的事的样子。

detailed_translations.english: the activity of making money by producing or buying and selling goods, or providing services

name: busy
trans: 忙, 忙碌, 繁忙, 忙于 (adj.)

sentences.english: She’s busy now – can you phone later?
sentences.chinese: 她现在正忙，你稍后打来好吗？

sentences.english: a busy mother of four
sentences.chinese: 一个忙忙碌碌、育有四个孩子的妈妈

sentences.english: There were lots of activities to keep the kids busy .
sentences.chinese: 有很多活动可以让孩子们不闲着。

sentences.english: December is the busiest time of year for shops.
sentences.chinese: 十二月份是一年中商店最繁忙的时期。

detailed_translations.english: if you are busy, you are working hard and have a lot of things to do

name: but
trans: 但, 但是, 不过 (conj.)

sentences.english: It’s an old car, but it’s very reliable.
sentences.chinese: 这是一辆旧车，但是性能非常可靠。

sentences.english: They rushed to the hospital, but they were too late.
sentences.chinese: 他们急忙赶到医院，但是已经太迟了。

sentences.english: We’ve invited the boss, but she may decide not to come.
sentences.chinese: 我们邀请过老板，但她有可能决定不来。

sentences.english: an expensive but extremely useful book
sentences.chinese: 价钱很贵却是非常有用的一本书

sentences.english: ‘Has he got any experience?’ ‘No, but he’s keen to learn.’
sentences.chinese: “他有经验吗？”“没有，但他非常好学。”

detailed_translations.english: used to connect two statements or phrases when the second one adds something different or seems surprising after the first one

name: butcher
trans: 屠夫, 屠户, 肉店, 杀人狂 (noun.); 宰 (verb.)

sentences.english: Pigs were butchered, hams were hung to dry from the ceiling.
sentences.chinese: 猪被宰杀了，火腿吊在屋顶下风干。

detailed_translations.english: to kill animals and prepare them to be used as meat
A butcher is a shopkeeper who cuts up and sells meat. Some butchers also kill animals for meat and make foods such as sausages and meat pies.

name: butter
trans: 黄油, 奶油, 牛油, 酥油 (noun.)

sentences.english: Can I have some bread and butter?
sentences.chinese: 能给我一些面包和黄油吗?。

sentences.english: Do you like butter?
sentences.chinese: 你喜欢黄油吗？

sentences.english: We never use cheese, butter or something like that to cook it.
sentences.chinese: 我们从未使用乳酪，黄油或者类如此物来烹调食品。

detailed_translations.english: a solid yellow food made from milk or cream that you spread on bread or use in cooking
to spread butter on something

name: button
trans: 按钮, 键, 钮, 钮扣 (noun.)

sentences.english: small pearl buttons
sentences.chinese: 小的珍珠纽扣

sentences.english: A button was missing from his shirt.
sentences.chinese: 他的衬衫上掉了一颗纽扣。

sentences.english: She undid (=  unfastened  ) the buttons of her blouse.
sentences.chinese: 她解开衬衫的纽扣。

detailed_translations.english: a small round flat object on your shirt, coat etc that you pass through a hole to fasten it
to fasten clothes with buttons, or to be fastened with buttons

name: buy
trans: 买, 购买, 采购, 买入 (verb.)

sentences.english: People say the judge had been bought by the Mafia.
sentences.chinese: 人们都说法官被黑手党收买了。

detailed_translations.english: to pay money to someone, especially someone in a position of authority, in order to persuade them to do something dishonest
to pay money to someone, especially someone in a position of authority, in order to persuade them to do something dishonest

name: buyer
trans: 买方, 买家, 买主, 采购员 (noun.)

sentences.english: There were several potential buyers.
sentences.chinese: 有好几个潜在的买家。

sentences.english: discounts for first-time buyers
sentences.chinese: 为首次购买的顾客提供的折扣

detailed_translations.english: someone who buys something expensive such as a house or car

name: by
trans: 由, 通过, 的 (prep.)

sentences.english: She stood by the window.
sentences.chinese: 她站在窗边。

sentences.english: I was attacked by a dog.
sentences.chinese: 我被一条狗袭击。

sentences.english: a church designed by the famous architect, Sir Christopher Wren
sentences.chinese: 著名建筑师克里斯托弗·雷恩爵士设计的一座教堂

sentences.english: We are all alarmed by the rise in violent crime.
sentences.chinese: 我们都对暴力罪案的增加感到忧虑。

sentences.english: interference by the state in the affairs of the Church
sentences.chinese: 国家对教会事务的干预

sentences.english: his appointment by the BBC as a producer
sentences.chinese: 英国广播公司委任他为制片人

detailed_translations.english: beside or near something

name: bye
trans: 再见, 拜拜, 拜, 回见 (noun.)

sentences.english: Bye, Dave.
sentences.chinese: 再见，戴夫。

detailed_translations.english: goodbye

name: bye
trans: 再见, 拜拜, 拜, 回见 (noun.)

sentences.english: Bye, Dave.
sentences.chinese: 再见，戴夫。

detailed_translations.english: goodbye

name: cabinet
trans: 内阁, 柜, 橱柜, 柜子 (noun.)

sentences.english: The President chose loyal supporters to serve in his cabinet.
sentences.chinese: 总统选择了忠诚的支持者到他的内阁服务。

sentences.english: Every year we used the State of the Union as an organizing tool for the cabinet and staff to come up with new policy ideas, and then we worked hard on how best to present them.
sentences.chinese: 每年国情咨文都被内阁和幕僚们作为我们提出新政策思路的一个组织工具，然后我们努力下功夫，让它们以最佳方式呈现在人们面前。

detailed_translations.english: the politicians with important positions in a government who meet to make decisions or advise the leader of the government

name: cable
trans: 电缆, 索, 有线, 有线电视 (noun.)

sentences.english: The miners rode a conveyance attached to a cable made of braided steel wire.
sentences.chinese: 矿工们乘坐连着钢索的缆车。

sentences.english: cables and switches for computers
sentences.chinese: 电脑的缆线和开关

sentences.english: She sent a cable to her mother.
sentences.chinese: 她给母亲发了封电报。

detailed_translations.english: a thick strong metal rope used on ships, to support bridges etc

name: cake
trans: 蛋糕, 饼, 糕, 块蛋糕 (noun.)

sentences.english: We had cake and ice cream.
sentences.chinese: 我们吃了蛋糕和冰激凌。

sentences.english: a chocolate cake
sentences.chinese: 巧克力蛋糕

detailed_translations.english: a soft sweet food made by baking a mixture of flour, butter, sugar, and eggs

name: calculate
trans: 计算, 算, 测算 (verb.); 算了 (noun.)

sentences.english: These instruments calculate distances precisely.
sentences.chinese: 这些仪器计算距离非常精确。

detailed_translations.chinese: 计算， 推算； 计划， 打算
detailed_translations.english: to find out how much something will cost, how long something will take etc, by using numbers

name: calculation
trans: 计算, 测算, 核算, 运算 (noun.)

sentences.english: Cathy did a rough calculation.
sentences.chinese: 凯茜作了一个粗略的计算。

detailed_translations.english: the act or process of using numbers to find out an amount

name: calculator
trans: 计算器 (noun.)

sentences.english: a pocket calculator
sentences.chinese: 一个袖珍计算器

detailed_translations.english: a small electronic machine that can add, multiply etc

name: calendar
trans: 日历, 历法, 历, 日程表 (noun.)

sentences.english: There was a calendar on the wall above, with large squares around the dates.
sentences.chinese: 墙的上方曾有一本日历，日期框在大方格里。

sentences.english: The Christian calendar was originally based on the Julian calendar of the Romans.
sentences.chinese: 公历最初是基于罗马的儒略历的。

detailed_translations.english: a set of pages that show the days, weeks, and months of a particular year, that you usually hang on a wall

name: call
trans: 叫, 打电话给, 打电话, 称呼 (verb.); 调用, 呼叫, 电话 (noun.)

sentences.english: You may call it harmless fun, but I call it pornography.
sentences.chinese: 你可能会说这是无恶意的小玩笑，但是我却认为这是色情。

sentences.english: I heard someone calling in the distance.
sentences.chinese: 我听到远处有人在叫。

detailed_translations.english: to use a word or name to describe someone or something in a particular way

name: calm
trans: 平静, 冷静, 镇静, 镇定 (adj.); 平息 (verb.)

sentences.english: Glen was calm and composed at the funeral.
sentences.chinese: 格伦在葬礼上表现得平静而镇定。

detailed_translations.english: relaxed and quiet, not angry, nervous, or upset

name: camp
trans: 营地, 阵营, 营, 夏令营 (noun.)

sentences.chinese: 我们回营地吧，天快黑了。

sentences.chinese: 埃伦•威尔逊湖边的营地

sentences.chinese: 士兵们在黎明前拔营出发了。

trans: 竞选, 运动, 战役, 竞选活动 (noun.)

name: can
trans: 可以, 能, 能够 (modal.)

detailed_translations.english: When food or drink is canned, it is put into a metal container and sealed so that it will remain fresh.

name: can
trans: 可以, 能, 能够 (modal.)

sentences.english: ...fruits and vegetables that will be canned, skinned, diced, or otherwise processed.
sentences.chinese: …将要经过装罐、去皮、切块或其他加工程序的水果和蔬菜。

detailed_translations.english: When food or drink is canned, it is put into a metal container and sealed so that it will remain fresh.

name: cancel
trans: 取消, 撤销, 注销, 抵消 (verb.)

sentences.chinese: 恐怕我得取消我们明天的会议。

sentences.chinese: 现在许多癌症可以治愈。

sentences.chinese: 去年她得知自己患了癌症。

name: candidate
trans: 候选人, 候选, 人选, 应聘者 (noun.)

sentences.chinese: 总统候选人

sentences.chinese: 这次考试的应试者不可以使用计算器。

name: candy
trans: 糖果, 糖, 坎蒂, 凯蒂 (noun.)

sentences.chinese: …一块糖果。

糖果（等于sweets）；冰糖（等于sugar candy，rock candy）；毒品
detailed_translations.english: Candy is sweet foods such as chocolate or toffees

detailed_translations.chinese: 新潮的（服饰）；甜言蜜语的

trans: 帽, 帽子, 上限, 盖 (noun.)

sentences.chinese: 一座漂亮的金色圆顶塔

trans: 能干, 能够, 能力, 精干 (adj.)

detailed_translations.english: relating to money that you use to start a business or to make more money

sentences.chinese: 他还未到可以开车的年龄。

sentences.chinese: 教学事业

trans: 城堡, 座城堡, 古堡, 卡塞尔 (noun.)

sentences.chinese: 查明起火原因是我们的责任。

name: cease

sentences.chinese: 天花板很高的房间

sentences.chinese: 今天是爸爸的生日，我们打算出去吃饭庆祝一下。

sentences.english: My folks are celebrating their 50th anniversary.
sentences.chinese: 我父母正在庆祝他们结婚50周年。

name: celebration
trans: 庆典, 庆祝活动, 庆祝, 庆祝会 (noun.)

sentences.chinese: 市中心热闹的新年庆祝活动

name: cell
trans: 细胞, 单元格, 电池, 牢房 (noun.)

sentences.chinese: 癌细胞

name: cellphone

name: cent
trans: 时分, 美分, 分, 百分之 (noun.)

sentences.chinese: 几周前价值30美分的1杯米如今卖到了1美元。

detailed_translations.english: 1/100th of the standard unit of money in some countries. For example, there are 100 cents in one dollar or in one  euro  : symbol ¢.

name: centimetre

sentences.english: ...a tiny fossil plant, only a few centimetres high.
sentences.chinese: …一块小小的植物化石，只有几厘米高。

name: central
trans: 中央, 中部, 中心, 中枢 (adj.); 中区, 环 (noun.)

sentences.chinese: 他住在伦敦市中心。

sentences.chinese: 屋顶由一根中心柱支撑着。

sentences.english: chocolates with soft centres
sentences.chinese: 软夹心巧克力

sentences.english: The title isn’t quite centred on the page, is it?
sentences.chinese: 标题并不在这页的正中间，是吗？

detailed_translations.english: the middle of a space, area, or object, especially the exact middle

name: century

name: cereal

sentences.chinese: 他抓住我的衣领。

sentences.english: He loosened his collar and tie .
sentences.chinese: 他松开了领子和领带。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a shirt, coat etc that fits around your neck, and is usually folded over

detailed_translations.chinese: 抓住；给…上领子；给…套上颈圈
detailed_translations.english: to catch someone and hold them so that they cannot escape

name: colleague
trans: 同事, 同僚, 同行, 同仁 (noun.)

sentences.english: a colleague of mine from the bank
sentences.chinese: 我在银行的一位同事

sentences.english: She discussed the idea with some of her colleagues.
sentences.chinese: 她和几位同事讨论了这个想法。

detailed_translations.english: someone you work with – used especially by professional people

name: collect
trans: 收集, 搜集, 采集, 收藏 (verb.); 对方付费 (noun.)

sentences.english: After 25 years of collecting recipes, she has compiled them into a cookbook.
sentences.chinese: 她搜集了25年食谱，把它们编成一本烹饪书。

sentences.english: The company collects information about consumer trends.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司搜集有关消费者趋向的信息。

sentences.english: We’ve been out collecting signatures for our petition.
sentences.chinese: 我们出去为我们的请愿征集签名。

detailed_translations.english: to get things of the same type from different places and bring them together
to get things of the same type from different places and bring them together

name: collection
trans: 集合, 收集, 收藏, 采集 (noun.)

sentences.english: a stamp collection
sentences.chinese: 一批邮票收藏品

sentences.english: a computerized data collection system
sentences.chinese: 计算机化的数据收集系统

detailed_translations.english: a group of objects, often of the same sort, that have been collected

name: college
trans: 大学, 学院, 高校, 大学生 (noun.)

sentences.english: a teacher training college
sentences.chinese: 师范学院

sentences.english: Donna left school and went to art college.
sentences.chinese: 唐娜中学毕业后进了艺术学院。

sentences.english: Some people who want to go to college still can’t get there.
sentences.chinese: 有些想上大学的人仍然无法如愿。

detailed_translations.english: a school for advanced education, especially in a particular profession or skill

name: colour
trans: 颜色, 色彩, 彩色, 色 (noun.)

sentences.english: Her eyes suddenly met his and she coloured slightly.
sentences.chinese: 她的目光突然和他相遇，她微微有点脸红了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…涂颜色，粉饰；歪曲；使脸红
detailed_translations.english: when someone colours, their face becomes redder because they are embarrassed

detailed_translations.chinese: 颜色；风格；气色，面色；外貌
detailed_translations.english: red, blue, yellow, green, brown, purple etc

name: column
trans: 列, 柱, 专栏, 栏 (noun.)

sentences.english: He writes a weekly column for ‘The Times’.
sentences.chinese: 他每周为《泰晤士报》写一篇专栏文章。

detailed_translations.english: an article on a particular subject or by a particular writer that appears regularly in a newspaper or magazine

name: combination
trans: 组合, 结合, 相结合, 联合 (noun.)

sentences.english: a combination nightclub and café
sentences.chinese: 夜总会兼咖啡馆

detailed_translations.english: two or more different things that exist together or are used or put together

name: combine
trans: 结合, 相结合, 组合, 合并 (verb.); 联合收割机 (noun.)

sentences.english: Diets are most effective when combined with exercise.
sentences.chinese: 节食和锻炼相结合是最有效的。

sentences.english: Ruth hesitated, uncertain of how to combine honesty and diplomacy in her answer.
sentences.chinese: 露丝犹豫了，她不知道怎样回答才能既诚实又婉转。

detailed_translations.english: if you combine two or more different things, or if they combine, they begin to exist or work together

detailed_translations.chinese: 联合企业； 联合收割机
detailed_translations.english: a machine used by farmers to cut grain, separate the seeds from it, and clean it

name: come
trans: 来, 过来, 到来, 来到 (verb.)

sentences.english: Let me know when they come.
sentences.chinese: 他们来了就告诉我。

sentences.english: Can you come here for a minute?
sentences.chinese: 你到这里来一会儿好吗？

sentences.english: Come a bit closer and you’ll be able to see better.
sentences.chinese: 靠近一些就能看得更清楚。

sentences.english: What time will you be coming home ?
sentences.chinese: 你什么时候能回家？

detailed_translations.english: to move towards you or arrive at the place where you are

name: comfort
trans: 安慰, 舒适, 抚慰, 慰藉 (noun.)

sentences.english: I dress for comfort, not fashion.
sentences.chinese: 我穿衣服只讲舒服，不追求时髦。

sentences.english: Alan was very reluctant to leave the warmth and comfort of the fire.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦很不情愿离开暖和舒适的火堆。

sentences.english: Now you can watch your favorite movies in the comfort of your own home.
sentences.chinese: 现在你可以舒舒服服地在自己家里看你最喜欢的电影了。

sentences.english: Whenever he was upset, he would turn to her for comfort and advice.
sentences.chinese: 他每当心烦意乱时，就会去向她寻求安慰和建议。

sentences.english: He longed to take her in his arms and comfort her.
sentences.chinese: 他很想把她搂在怀里安慰她。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of being physically relaxed and satisfied, so that nothing is hurting you, making you feel too hot or cold etc
to make someone feel less worried, unhappy, or upset, for example by saying kind things to them or touching them

name: comfortable
trans: 舒适, 舒服, 自在, 惬意 (adj.)

sentences.english: The bed wasn’t particularly comfortable.
sentences.chinese: 这床不大舒服。

detailed_translations.english: making you feel physically relaxed, without any pain or without being too hot, cold etc

name: command
trans: 命令, 指挥, 司令部, 指挥部 (noun.)

sentences.english: He commanded his men to retreat.
sentences.chinese: 他命令手下撤退。

sentences.english: He commands the 4th Battalion.
sentences.chinese: 他指挥第四营。

sentences.english: the power and finances commanded by the police
sentences.chinese: 警方掌握的权力和资金

detailed_translations.english: (of sb in a position of authority) to tell sb to do sth

name: comment
trans: 评论, 注释, 意见, 评述 (noun.); 发表评论, 置评, 发表意见, 述评 (verb.)

sentences.english: Have you any comment to make about the cause of the disaster?
sentences.chinese: 你对发生灾难的原因有何评论？

sentences.english: The results are a clear comment on government education policy.
sentences.chinese: 这些结果是对政府教育政策明显的批评。

detailed_translations.english: an opinion that you express about someone or something

name: commercial
trans: 商业, 商用, 商业性, 商务 (adj.); 广告 (noun.)

sentences.english: Our top priorities must be profit and commercial growth.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须把利润和贸易增长作为我们的第一要务。

detailed_translations.chinese: 商业的， 商务的； 商品化的， 商业性的
detailed_translations.english: related to business and the buying and selling of goods and services

name: commission
trans: 委员会, 佣金, 监察委员会, 统筹委员会 (noun.)

sentences.english: The Government set up a commission to investigate allegations of police violence.
sentences.chinese: 政府成立了一个委员会调查对警察施暴行为的指控。

detailed_translations.chinese: 委任状；委员会；佣金，回扣；授权，委托
detailed_translations.english: a group of people who have been given the official job of finding out about something or controlling something
to formally ask someone to write an official report, produce a work of art for you etc

name: commit
trans: 提交 (noun.); 犯, 承诺, 触犯 (verb.)

sentences.english: Women commit fewer crimes than men.
sentences.chinese: 女性犯罪比男性少。

detailed_translations.chinese: 犯， 干； 使承诺； 把…托付给； 调拨…供使用， 拨出
detailed_translations.english: to do something wrong or illegal

name: commitment
trans: 承诺, 承担, 决心, 致力于 (noun.)

sentences.english: Are you ready to make a long-term commitment ?
sentences.chinese: 你是否准备好作出长久的承诺？

detailed_translations.english: a promise to do something or to behave in a particular way

name: committee
trans: 委员会, 委, 委员, 事务委员会 (noun.)

sentences.english: a committee meeting
sentences.chinese: 委员会会议

detailed_translations.english: a group of people chosen to do a particular job, make decisions etc

name: common
trans: 常见, 共同, 普通, 普遍 (adj.)

sentences.english: Heart disease is one of the commonest causes of death.
sentences.chinese: 心脏病是最常见的死因之一。

sentences.english: They share a common interest in photography.
sentences.chinese: 他们在摄影方面兴趣相投。

detailed_translations.english: happening often and to many people or in many places

name: communicate
trans: 沟通, 交流, 传达, 通信 (verb.)

sentences.english: We communicated mostly by e-mail.
sentences.chinese: 我们主要是用电子邮件沟通。

sentences.english: A baby communicates its needs by crying.
sentences.chinese: 婴儿用哭来表达需要。

detailed_translations.english: to exchange information or conversation with other people, using words, signs, writing etc

name: communication
trans: 通信, 沟通, 通讯, 交际 (noun.)

sentences.english: Radio was the pilot’s only means of communication.
sentences.chinese: 无线电是飞行员唯一的通信手段。

sentences.english: There has been a breakdown in communication (= failure to communicate ) .
sentences.chinese: 沟通失败。

sentences.english: Paris has good communications with many European cities.
sentences.chinese: 巴黎与许多欧洲城市之间交通便捷。

detailed_translations.english: the process by which people exchange information or express their thoughts and feelings

name: community
trans: 社区, 社会, 小区, 群落 (noun.)

sentences.english: The new arts centre will serve the whole community.
sentences.chinese: 这座新的艺术中心将为整个社区服务。

sentences.english: the Polish community in London
sentences.chinese: 在伦敦的波兰侨民团体

detailed_translations.english: the people who live in the same area, town etc

name: company
trans: 公司, 企业 (noun.)

sentences.english: Which company do you work for?
sentences.chinese: 你在哪家公司上班？

sentences.english: I called the phone company about the bill.
sentences.chinese: 我就电话账单的事给电话公司打了电话。

sentences.english: The company was set up just after the war.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司是战后不久成立的。

sentences.english: People judge you by the company you keep (= the people you spend time with ) .
sentences.chinese: 人们根据你交往的朋友来判断你的为人。

detailed_translations.english: a business organization that makes or sells goods or services

name: compare
trans: 比较, 相比, 对比, 比拟 (verb.)

sentences.english: The report compares the different types of home computer available.
sentences.chinese: 这份报告比较了市场上不同类型的家用计算机。

detailed_translations.chinese: 比较， 对照； 把…比作
detailed_translations.english: to consider two or more things or people, in order to show how they are similar or different

name: comparison
trans: 比较, 对比, 相比, 对照 (noun.)

sentences.english: Her paintings invite comparison with those of the early Impressionists (= they remind you of them ) .
sentences.chinese: 她的画作让人想起早期的印象派作品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 比较， 对照； 比拟， 比喻
detailed_translations.english: the process of comparing two or more people or things

name: compete
trans: 竞争, 竞相, 争, 比赛 (verb.)

sentences.english: The banks have long competed with American Express's charge cards and various shop cards.
sentences.chinese: 这些银行长期以来一直与美国运通公司的记账卡和各种商店卡竞争。

detailed_translations.chinese: 比赛， 竞争， 对抗
detailed_translations.english: if one company or country competes with another, it tries to get people to buy its goods or servicesrather than those available from another company or country

name: competition
trans: 竞争, 比赛, 竞赛, 大赛 (noun.)

sentences.english: Going to trade fairs is an ideal opportunity to size up the competition .
sentences.chinese: 参加商品交易会是估量竞争规模的理想机会。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which people or organizations try to be more successful than other people or organizations

name: competitive
trans: 竞争, 竞争力, 竞争性, 具竞争力 (adj.)

sentences.english: Competitive sports encourage children to work together as a team.
sentences.chinese: 竞技体育鼓励孩子们进行团队协作。

sentences.english: Advertising is an intensely competitive business.
sentences.chinese: 广告业是一个竞争激烈的行业。

detailed_translations.english: relating to competition

name: complain
trans: 抱怨, 埋怨, 投诉, 报怨 (verb.)

sentences.english: Residents are complaining because traffic in the area has increased.
sentences.chinese: 由于这个地区的交通流量有所增加，居民都在抱怨。

sentences.english: ‘You never ask my opinion about anything,’ Rod complained.
sentences.chinese: “你什么事都不问问我的看法。”罗德抱怨道。

sentences.english: Employees complained bitterly about working conditions.
sentences.chinese: 雇员们对工作条件十分不满。

detailed_translations.english: to say that you are annoyed, not satisfied, or unhappy about something or someone

name: complaint
trans: 投诉, 申诉, 抱怨, 怨言 (noun.)

sentences.english: If you wish to make a complaint, you should see the manager.
sentences.chinese: 如果你要投诉，应该去找经理。

sentences.english: The sales assistants are trained to deal with customer complaints in a friendly manner.
sentences.chinese: 售货员都受过培训，要以友好的态度处理顾客的投诉。

detailed_translations.english: a statement in which someone complains about something

name: complete
trans: 完整, 齐全, 完全, 完备 (adj.); 完成, 填写 (verb.)

sentences.english: Students must complete the course.
sentences.chinese: 学生必须学完这门课程。

sentences.english: The building took two years to complete.
sentences.chinese: 这幢大楼花了两年时间才完工。

sentences.english: The darkness was almost complete.
sentences.chinese: 几乎是漆黑一片。

sentences.english: a complete stranger
sentences.chinese: 一个完全陌生的人

detailed_translations.english: to finish doing or making something, especially when it has taken a long time
used to emphasize that a quality or situation is as great as it could possibly be

name: completely
trans: 完全, 彻底, 全面, 全然 (adv.)

sentences.english: I completely forgot that it’s his birthday today.
sentences.chinese: 我完全忘了今天是他的生日。

sentences.english: He had never completely recovered from his illness.
sentences.chinese: 他病后一直没有完全康复。

sentences.english: a completely new range of low-cost computers
sentences.chinese: 全新的低价电脑系列

sentences.english: I’m not completely sure.
sentences.chinese: 我不能十分肯定。

sentences.english: Portuguese is pronounced completely differently from Spanish.
sentences.chinese: 葡萄牙语的发音和西班牙语的完全不同。

detailed_translations.english: to the greatest degree possible

name: complex
trans: 复杂, 复, 复合, 复数 (adj.); 情结, 配合物, 复合物 (noun.)

sentences.english: a complex system of highways
sentences.chinese: 复杂的公路网

sentences.english: Photosynthesis is a highly complex process.
sentences.chinese: 光合作用是一个非常复杂的过程。

sentences.english: Peter seemed to have an instant understanding of the most complex issues.
sentences.chinese: 再复杂的问题彼得似乎也是一看就明白。

sentences.english: It was a very complex relationship between two complex people.
sentences.chinese: 这是两个复杂的人之间非常复杂的关系。

detailed_translations.chinese: 由许多部分组成的，复合的；复杂的，难懂的
detailed_translations.english: consisting of many different parts and often difficult to understand

detailed_translations.chinese: 综合体， 集合体； 情结， 夸大的情绪反应
detailed_translations.english: a group of buildings, or a large building with many parts, used for a particular purpose

name: complicated
trans: 复杂, 繁复, 复杂性, 错综复杂 (adj.); 复杂化, 并发, 合并 (verb.)

sentences.english: a complicated pattern
sentences.chinese: 复杂的图案

sentences.english: The human brain is an incredibly complicated organ.
sentences.chinese: 人脑是一个结构极其复杂的器官。

detailed_translations.english: consisting of many closely connected parts

name: component
trans: 组件, 组成部分, 构件, 分量 (noun.)

sentences.english: Gorbachev failed to keep the component parts of the Soviet Union together.
sentences.chinese: 戈尔巴乔夫没能使苏联各组成部分保持在一起。

detailed_translations.english: the component parts of something are the parts that it consists of
one of several parts that together make up a whole machine, system etc

name: comprehensive
trans: 综合, 全面, 综合性, 全方位 (adj.)

sentences.english: We offer our customers a comprehensive range of financial products.
sentences.chinese: 我们为客户提供全面的金融产品。

sentences.english: a comprehensive guide to British hotels and restaurants
sentences.chinese: 一本介绍英国酒店和餐厅的详尽指南

sentences.english: The following guidelines do not aim to be totally comprehensive.
sentences.chinese: 以下指导原则并非想要面面俱到。

detailed_translations.english: including all the necessary facts, details, or problems that need to be dealt with

name: comprise
trans: 包括 (verb.)

sentences.english: The house comprises two bedrooms, a kitchen, and a living room.
sentences.chinese: 这座房子有两间卧室、一间厨房和一间起居室。

sentences.english: Women comprise a high proportion of part-time workers.
sentences.chinese: 兼职人员中妇女占了很大一部分。

detailed_translations.english: to consist of particular parts, groups etc

name: computer
trans: 计算机, 电脑, 台电脑, 台计算机 (noun.)

sentences.english: a huge global computer network
sentences.chinese: 巨大的全球计算机网络

sentences.english: the latest computer software
sentences.chinese: 最新的计算机软件

detailed_translations.english: an electronic machine that stores information and uses programs to help you find, organize, or change the information

name: concentrate
trans: 精矿, 浓缩, 浓缩物, 精 (noun.); 集中精力, 集中, 集中注意力, 专心 (verb.)

sentences.english: Now please concentrate.
sentences.chinese: 现在请集中注意力。

sentences.english: Adrian was finding it difficult to concentrate.
sentences.chinese: 阿德里安觉得自己很难集中注意力。

sentences.english: Italian industry is concentrated mainly in the north.
sentences.chinese: 意大利的工业主要集中在北部。

sentences.english: orange juice made from concentrate
sentences.chinese: 用浓缩橙汁冲兑的橙汁

detailed_translations.english: to think very carefully about something that you are doing

name: concentration
trans: 浓度, 集中, 浓缩, 药浓度 (noun.)

sentences.english: She needed all her powers of concentration to stop herself from slipping on the icy road.
sentences.chinese: 她需要集中全部注意力才能不让自己在结冰的路上滑倒。

sentences.english: Lack of concentration was a real problem.
sentences.chinese: 注意力不集中是个大问题。

sentences.english: I lost my concentration and fell asleep.
sentences.chinese: 我精神一放松就睡着了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 集中； 专注， 专心； 浓缩； 浓度
detailed_translations.english: the ability to think about something carefully or for a long time

name: concept
trans: 概念, 理念, 观念, 观 (noun.)

sentences.english: a new concept in business travel
sentences.chinese: 商务旅行的新理念

sentences.english: our basic concepts of decent human behaviour
sentences.chinese: 我们对得体的人类行为的基本观念

sentences.english: It’s very simple, once you grasp the concept .
sentences.chinese: 你一旦掌握了这个概念之后就很简单了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 概念， 观念； 设想
detailed_translations.english: an idea of how something is, or how something should be done

name: concern
trans: 关注, 关心, 关怀, 关切 (noun.)

sentences.english: He was moved by her obvious concern.
sentences.chinese: 她明显的关心使他感动。

detailed_translations.chinese: 关切的事，有关的事；关心，挂念；关系，关联；公司，企业
detailed_translations.english: a feeling of wanting someone to be happy and healthy

detailed_translations.chinese: 涉及， 有关； 使关心， 使担心
detailed_translations.english: if a story, book, report etc concerns someone or something, it is about them

name: concerned
trans: 关心, 有关, 担心, 而言 (adj.); 关注, 涉及 (verb.)

sentences.english: Divorce is very painful, especially when children are concerned.
sentences.chinese: 离婚是非常痛苦的，涉及孩子的话更是如此。

sentences.english: Some of the farmers concerned suffer particularly from the low prices.
sentences.chinese: 涉及的农民当中，有些人因低价受到的损失尤为惨重。

sentences.english: We are trying to reach an agreement with all concerned (= everyone who is involved or affected ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们试图与相关各方达成协议。

detailed_translations.english: involved in something or affected by it

detailed_translations.chinese: 关心（concern的过去时和过去分词）；与…有关

name: concerning
trans: 关于, 有关 (verb.)

sentences.english: calls from young children concerning lost pets
sentences.chinese: 小孩子打来的有关宠物走失的电话

sentences.english: the facts concerning Marr’s car crash
sentences.chinese: 有关马尔撞车事故的事实

detailed_translations.english: about or relating to

name: concert
trans: 音乐会, 演唱会, 场音乐会, 听音乐会 (noun.)

sentences.english: a rock concert
sentences.chinese: 摇滚音乐会

sentences.english: a concert of French choral music
sentences.chinese: 法国合唱音乐会

sentences.english: We were going to a concert in Bath Abbey.
sentences.chinese: 我们要去听一场在巴斯修道院内举行的音乐会。

sentences.english: She still does about 100 concerts every year.
sentences.chinese: 她每年仍然举行100场左右的演唱会。

detailed_translations.english: a performance given by musicians or singers

detailed_translations.chinese: 音乐会用的；在音乐会上演出的

name: conclude
trans: 得出结论, 总结, 缔结, 结束 (verb.)

sentences.english: When the investigation is concluded, the results will be sent to the US Attorney’s office.
sentences.chinese: 等到调查结束后，结果会被送到联邦检察官办公室。

sentences.english: Francis, having concluded his business with James, left for Miami.
sentences.chinese: 弗朗西斯完成了和詹姆斯的买卖后就去了迈阿密。

detailed_translations.english: to complete something you have been doing, especially for a long time

detailed_translations.chinese: 推断出，推论出；缔结，议定
detailed_translations.english: to decide that something is true after considering all the information you have

name: conclusion
trans: 结论, 结语, 得出结论, 总结 (noun.)

sentences.english: These are the report’s main conclusions.
sentences.chinese: 这些就是这篇报告的主要结论。

sentences.english: It is still too early to reach a conclusion on this point.
sentences.chinese: 在这一点上作出结论还为时过早。

sentences.english: There are perhaps two main conclusions to be drawn from the above discussion.
sentences.chinese: 从以上的讨论也许可以得出两个主要的结论。

sentences.english: All the evidence pointed to the conclusion that he was guilty.
sentences.chinese: 所有证据都表明他是有罪的。

sentences.english: It’s important not to jump to conclusions.
sentences.chinese: 决不要贸然下结论。

sentences.english: The police came to the inescapable conclusion that the children had been murdered.
sentences.chinese: 警方得出了无法回避的结论: 这些儿童被谋杀了。

sentences.english: At the conclusion of the meeting, little progress had been made.
sentences.chinese: 会议开到最后，没有取得多少进展。

detailed_translations.english: something you decide after considering all the information you have

name: condition
trans: 条件, 状况, 状态, 条件下 (noun.)

sentences.english: Profits increased by £1.5m, despite the difficult economic conditions.
sentences.chinese: 尽管经济形势不佳，利润还是增长了150万英镑。

detailed_translations.english: the state that something is in, especially how good or bad its physical state is

name: conduct
trans: 进行, 开展 (verb.); 行为, 操守, 品行 (noun.)

sentences.english: The Senator’s conduct is being investigated by the Ethics Committee.
sentences.chinese: 该参议员的行为正受到道德委员会的调查。

sentences.english: an inquiry into the conduct of the police
sentences.chinese: 对警方行为的调查

sentences.english: his arrest for disorderly conduct
sentences.chinese: 他因妨害治安行为而遭逮捕

detailed_translations.chinese: 举止， 行为； 指导； 管理； 实施
detailed_translations.english: the way someone behaves, especially in public, in their job etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 进行； 管理， 指挥， 引导； 传输， 传导
detailed_translations.english: to stand in front of a group of musicians or singers and direct their playing or singing

name: conference
trans: 会议, 大会, 研讨会, 发布会 (noun.)

sentences.english: Representatives from over 100 countries attended the International Peace Conference in Geneva.
sentences.chinese: 来自一百多个国家的代表出席了在日内瓦举行的国际和平大会。

detailed_translations.english: a large formal meeting where a lot of people discuss important matters such as business, politics, or science, especially for several days

name: confidence
trans: 信心, 自信, 自信心, 置信 (noun.)

sentences.english: I have never betrayed a confidence.
sentences.chinese: 我从未泄露过别人的秘密。

sentences.english: They spent their evenings drinking wine and sharing confidences.
sentences.chinese: 晚上他们就喝喝酒，说说知心话。

detailed_translations.english: a secret or a piece of information that is private or personal

name: confident
trans: 自信, 信心, 充满信心, 充满自信 (adj.)

sentences.english: Despite her disability, Philippa is very confident.
sentences.chinese: 菲莉帕虽然有残疾，却很自信。

detailed_translations.chinese: 确信的， 肯定的； 自信的
detailed_translations.english: sure that something will happen in the way that you want or expect

name: confine
trans: 局限, 限制, 限于, 局限于 (verb.)

sentences.english: We confined our study to ten cases.
sentences.chinese: 我们把研究限定在十个案例以内。

sentences.english: Any soldier who leaves his post will be confined to barracks (= made to stay in the barracks ) .
sentences.chinese: 任何擅离职守的士兵都要受到在营房里关禁闭的处罚。

sentences.english: within the confines of the prison
sentences.chinese: 在监狱范围内

detailed_translations.english: to keep someone or something within the limits of a particular activity or subject
limits or borders

name: confirm
trans: 确认, 证实, 确定, 印证 (verb.)

sentences.english: New evidence has confirmed the first witness’s story.
sentences.chinese: 新的证据证实了第一个证人的说法。

sentences.english: To confirm my diagnosis I need to do some tests.
sentences.chinese: 为了证实我的诊断，我要做一些化验。

sentences.english: Could you confirm the dates we discussed?
sentences.chinese: 你能确认我们商讨过的日期吗？

sentences.english: After a six-month probationary period, her position was confirmed.
sentences.chinese: 经过六个月的试用期后，她获准正式担任该职。

detailed_translations.english: to state or show that sth is definitely true or correct, especially by providing evidence

name: conflict
trans: 冲突, 矛盾, 抵触, 争端 (noun.)

sentences.english: the threat of industrial conflict in the coalfields
sentences.chinese: 煤田发生劳资纠纷的风险

sentences.english: Marx points out the potential conflicts below the surface of society.
sentences.chinese: 马克思指出了隐藏在社会表层之下的潜在矛盾。

sentences.english: His views on the literal truth of the Bible brought him into conflict with other Christian leaders.
sentences.chinese: 他坚持《圣经》字面真理的观点使他与其他的基督教领袖发生了冲突。

sentences.english: Doctors exercise considerable power and often come into conflict with politicians.
sentences.chinese: 医生行使很大的权力，常常和政客们发生冲突。

sentences.english: a lawyer specializing in conflict resolution
sentences.chinese: 专门解决纠纷的律师

detailed_translations.english: a state of disagreement or argument between people, groups, countries etc

name: confused
trans: 困惑, 迷茫, 糊涂, 混淆 (adj.)

name: confusing
trans: 令人困惑, 混乱, 令人迷惑, 困惑 (adj.); 混淆 (verb.)

name: confusion
trans: 混乱, 困惑, 混淆, 迷茫 (noun.)

sentences.english: a scene of indescribable confusion
sentences.chinese: 难以形容的混乱场面

sentences.english: To avoid confusion, the teams wore different colours.
sentences.chinese: 为了避免混淆，各队穿着不同颜色的服装。

detailed_translations.english: a very confusing situation, that usually has a lot of noise and action, so that it is difficult for someone to understand it or control it

name: congratulation
trans: 祝贺, 贺信, 恭喜, 庆贺 (noun.)

sentences.english: letters of congratulation
sentences.chinese: 祝贺信

sentences.english: Give Oscar my congratulations.
sentences.chinese: 请向奥斯卡转达我的祝贺。

detailed_translations.english: when you tell someone that you are happy because they have achieved something or because something nice has happened to them

name: connect
trans: 连接, 联系, 连, 接通 (verb.)

sentences.english: We’d like two rooms with connecting doors (= doors that join the rooms ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们想要两个有门相通的房间。

sentences.english: I didn’t connect the two events in my mind.
sentences.chinese: 我心里没把这两件事联系起来。

detailed_translations.english: to join two or more things together

name: connection
trans: 连接, 联系, 接线, 涉嫌 (noun.)

sentences.english: Police have so far failed to establish a connection between the two murders.
sentences.chinese: 到目前为止警方尚未确定两宗凶杀案之间有关联。

sentences.english: The evidence was there in the file but no one made the connection .
