sentences.chinese: 格温是个意志很坚定的女性。

detailed_translations.english: having a strong desire to do something, so that you will not let anyone stop you

name: develop
trans: 发展, 开发, 制定, 培养 (verb.)

sentences.english: Knowledge in the field of genetics has been developing very rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 遗传学领域的知识发展非常迅速。

sentences.english: Corsica has developed its economy around the tourist industry.
sentences.chinese: 科西嘉岛的经济是围绕旅游业发展起来的。

sentences.english: exercises to develop muscle strength
sentences.chinese: 锻炼肌肉力量的运动

sentences.english: He had developed a certain affection for me.
sentences.chinese: 他对我产生了一些好感。

sentences.english: The land was developed for low-cost housing.
sentences.chinese: 这块土地被开发建造廉价住宅。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually grow or become bigger, more advanced, stronger, etc.; to make sth do this

name: development
trans: 发展, 开发, 研制, 发育 (noun.)

sentences.english: child development
sentences.chinese: 儿童发育

sentences.english: The funds will be used for marketing and product development.
sentences.chinese: 这笔资金将用于市场营销和产品开发。

detailed_translations.english: the process of gradually becoming bigger, better, stronger, or more advanced

name: device
trans: 装置, 设备, 器件, 器 (noun.)

sentences.english: modern labour-saving devices
sentences.chinese: 省力的现代设备

detailed_translations.chinese: 器械， 装置； 设计； 手段， 策略
detailed_translations.english: a machine or tool that does a special job

name: devil
trans: 魔鬼, 恶魔, 鬼子, 撒旦 (noun.)

sentences.english: What on earth is wrong with the poor devil?
sentences.chinese: 这可怜的家伙到底怎么了？

detailed_translations.chinese: 魔鬼；撒旦；家伙；恶棍；淘气鬼；冒失鬼
detailed_translations.english: the most powerful evil spiritin some religions, especially in Christianity

detailed_translations.chinese: 虐待，折磨；（用扯碎机）扯碎；（替作家，律师等）做助手；抹辣味料烤制或煎煮

name: diagram
trans: 图, 图表, 示意图, 框图 (noun.)

sentences.english: This diagram will illustrate what I mean.
sentences.chinese: 这个图表可说明我的意思。

sentences.english: This is a simpler diagram than the one I just showed you but the principles are the same.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个比我刚展示的还要更简单的图解，但是原理是一样的。

sentences.english: A table or diagram containing the name and address range of each peripheral addressable by the processor within the memory space.
sentences.chinese: 一个在内存空间中的，包含每个外设的名字和可由处理器设置的地址范围的表格或图表。

detailed_translations.english: to show or represent something in a diagram

detailed_translations.chinese: 图解， 简图， 图表
detailed_translations.english: a simple drawing or plan that shows exactly where something is, what something looks like, or how something works

name: diamond
trans: 金刚石, 钻石, 颗钻石, 菱形 (noun.)

sentences.english: a diamond engagement ring
sentences.chinese: 订婚钻戒

detailed_translations.chinese: 钻石，金刚石；菱形；方块牌
detailed_translations.english: a clear, very hard valuable stone, used in jewellery and in industry

name: diary
trans: 日记, 写日记, 日记本, 记日记 (noun.)

sentences.english: Inge kept a diary (= wrote in a diary ) during the war years.
sentences.chinese: 英奇在战争年代里一直写日记。

detailed_translations.english: a book in which you write down the things that happen to you each day

name: die
trans: 死, 死去, 模具, 模 (verb.)

sentences.english: He died in 1985 at the age of 76.
sentences.chinese: 他1985年去世，终年76岁。

sentences.english: Her father died suddenly in an accident when she was only ten.
sentences.chinese: 她年仅10岁时父亲突然死于一场意外事故。

sentences.english: She died peacefully in her sleep at the age of 98.
sentences.chinese: 她在睡眠中安然辞世，享年98岁。

sentences.english: The bullet went straight through his head, and he died instantly.
sentences.chinese: 子弹穿过他的头部，他当场死亡。

sentences.english: Our love will never die.
sentences.chinese: 我们的爱始终不渝。

detailed_translations.english: to stop living and become dead

name: diet
trans: 饮食, 节食, 膳食, 日常饮食 (noun.)

sentences.english: She doesn’t eat a very healthy diet.
sentences.chinese: 她的饮食不是很健康。

sentences.english: It is important to have a balanced diet.
sentences.chinese: 饮食均衡很重要。

sentences.english: Rice is the staple diet (= the main food that a group of people usually eat ) .
sentences.chinese: 大米是主食。

detailed_translations.english: the kind of food that a person or animal eats each day

name: differ
trans: 不同, 有所不同, 不一, 相差 (verb.)

sentences.english: The two systems differ in many respects.
sentences.chinese: 这两个系统在许多方面不同。

sentences.english: Experts have differing views on the subject.
sentences.chinese: 在这个问题上专家们意见不同。

detailed_translations.english: to be different from something in some way

name: difference
trans: 差异, 差分, 区别, 差别 (noun.)

sentences.english: There’s a big difference between knowing that something is true, and being able to prove it.
sentences.chinese: 知道什么正确与能够证明它正确，这之间有很大的不同。

sentences.english: There's not much difference in price between the two computers.
sentences.chinese: 这两种计算机价格上没有多大的差别。

sentences.english: We have our differences , but she's still my sister.
sentences.chinese: 我们之间虽然不和，但她仍旧是我的妹妹。

detailed_translations.english: a way in which two or more people or things are not like each other

name: different
trans: 不同, 与众不同, 一样, 差异 (adj.)

sentences.english: The place looks completely different now.
sentences.chinese: 这地方现在完全变了。

sentences.english: They decided to try a radically different approach.
sentences.chinese: 他们决定尝试一种全然不同的办法。

sentences.english: We found women had significantly different political views from men.
sentences.chinese: 我们发现女性的政治观点与男性大不相同。

sentences.english: a slightly different way of doing things
sentences.chinese: 稍有区别的做事方法

sentences.english: What actually happened was subtly different from the PR people’s version.
sentences.chinese: 实际情况与公关部那些人的说法有细微的差别。

sentences.english: The show is refreshingly different from most exhibitions of modern art.
sentences.chinese: 这次展览与大多数现代艺术展不一样，令人耳目一新。

sentences.english: The publishing business is no different from any other business in this respect.
sentences.chinese: 从这一点来讲，出版业和其他任何行业没有什么差别。

sentences.english: It’s a different world here in London.
sentences.chinese: 伦敦这儿的情况完全不同。

detailed_translations.english: not like something or someone else, or not like before

name: difficult
trans: 困难, 难, 艰难, 很难 (adj.)

sentences.english: a difficult question
sentences.chinese: 难解的问题

sentences.english: an immensely difficult task
sentences.chinese: 极为艰巨的任务

sentences.english: Was the exam very difficult?
sentences.chinese: 这次考试很难吗？

sentences.english: It’s difficult to see how more savings can be made.
sentences.chinese: 想要进一步节约看来是很难了。

sentences.english: Don’t be so difficult!
sentences.chinese: 别这么挑剔！

detailed_translations.english: hard to do, understand, or deal with

name: difficulty
trans: 困难, 难度, 难点, 难以 (noun.)

sentences.english: They had great difficulty in finding a replacement.
sentences.chinese: 他们找接替的人费了很大劲

sentences.english: If you have any difficulties, give me a call.
sentences.chinese: 如果你遇到困难，就给我打电话。

sentences.english: She soon got into difficulty with debt.
sentences.chinese: 她很快就因债务陷入了困境。

detailed_translations.english: if you have difficulty doing something, it is difficult for you to do

name: dig
trans: 挖, 挖掘, 掘, 掏 (verb.)

sentences.english: Dig down about 6 inches.
sentences.chinese: 往下挖大约六英寸深。

detailed_translations.english: to move earth, snow etc, or to make a hole in the ground, using a spade or your hands

name: dimension
trans: 维度, 维数, 维, 尺寸 (noun.)

sentences.english: You can have a spiritual dimension to your life without being religious.
sentences.chinese: 即使你不信宗教，也可以在生命中拥有精神层面的内容。

detailed_translations.chinese: 方面;[数] 维；尺寸；次元；容积 vt标出尺寸
detailed_translations.english: a part of a situation or a quality involved in it

name: dinner
trans: 晚餐, 晚饭, 吃饭, 晚宴 (noun.)

sentences.english: What time do you usually have dinner?
sentences.chinese: 你通常什么时候吃饭？

sentences.english: We’re having fish for dinner tonight.
sentences.chinese: 我们今天晚饭吃鱼。

sentences.english: What’s for dinner?
sentences.chinese: 晚饭吃什么？

sentences.english: the Club’s annual dinner
sentences.chinese: 俱乐部的年度晚宴

detailed_translations.english: the main meal of the day, eaten in the middle of the day or the evening

name: direct
trans: 直接, 直, 直达, 直销 (adj.); 指导, 指示, 指挥, 引导 (verb.)

sentences.english: Experienced users have direct access to the main data files.
sentences.chinese: 高级用户可直接浏览主数据文档。

sentences.english: I’m not in direct contact with them.
sentences.chinese: 我和他们没有直接的联系。

sentences.english: Few policy-makers have had direct experience of business.
sentences.chinese: 决策者几乎都没有直接的从商经历。

sentences.english: Women often feel men are too direct and not sympathetic enough.
sentences.chinese: 女人常常觉得男人太直率，不够体贴。

detailed_translations.english: done without any other people, actions, processes etc coming between

name: direction
trans: 方向, 方向前进, 指示, 路向 (noun.)

sentences.english: Which direction did they go in ?
sentences.chinese: 他们朝哪个方向走了？

sentences.english: A very helpful woman gave me directions to the police station.
sentences.chinese: 一个很热心的妇女给我指了去警察局的路。

sentences.english: Be sure you read the directions before using any piece of equipment.
sentences.chinese: 使用任何设备之前一定要先阅读操作指南。

detailed_translations.english: the way something or someone moves, faces, or is aimed

name: directly
trans: 直接, 直, 好坏直接 (adv.)

sentences.english: The new property tax law won’t directly affect us.
sentences.chinese: 新的财产税法不会直接影响到我们。

sentences.english: We hope to bring together the countries directly involved in the conflict.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望让直接卷入冲突的各国重归于好。

sentences.english: Most guests left directly after the wake.
sentences.chinese: 守灵仪式一结束，大部分客人就立刻走了。

detailed_translations.english: with no other person, action, process etc between

name: director
trans: 导演, 主任, 董事, 署长 (noun.)

sentences.english: The company is run by a board of directors (= a group of directors ) .
sentences.chinese: 这家公司由董事会管理。

sentences.english: the director of education
sentences.chinese: 教育局局长

detailed_translations.chinese: 理事；导演；指导者；负责人
detailed_translations.english: someone who controls or manages a company

name: directory
trans: 目录, 名录, 簿, 指南 (noun.)

sentences.english: I couldn’t find your number in the telephone directory.
sentences.chinese: 我在电话簿上找不到你的电话号码。

sentences.english: a new business directory
sentences.chinese: 新的商业名录

detailed_translations.english: a book or list of names, facts etc, usually arranged in alphabetical order

name: dirt
trans: 污垢, 污物, 泥土, 灰尘 (noun.)

sentences.english: You should have seen the dirt on that car!
sentences.chinese: 你没看见那车上沾了多少泥！

sentences.english: His face and hands were black with dirt.
sentences.chinese: 他的脸和手黑乎乎的，全是泥。

sentences.english: Michael threw his handful of dirt onto the coffin.
sentences.chinese: 迈克尔往棺材上撒了一把土。

detailed_translations.english: any substance that makes things dirty, such as mud or dust

name: dirty
trans: 脏, 肮脏, 脏兮兮, 弄脏 (adj.)

sentences.english: a stack of dirty dishes in the sink
sentences.chinese: 洗涤槽里的一堆脏碟子

sentences.english: How did you get so dirty?
sentences.chinese: 你怎么会弄得这么脏？

sentences.english: kids telling dirty jokes
sentences.chinese: 讲着下流笑话的年轻人

sentences.english: a dirty magazine
sentences.chinese: 色情杂志

detailed_translations.english: covered in or marked by an unwanted substance

name: disabled
trans: 禁用, 残疾人, 残疾, 残疾人士 (adj.)

sentences.english: a support group for parents of disabled children
sentences.chinese: 帮助残障儿童父母的援助团

sentences.english: a severely disabled polio patient
sentences.chinese: 严重残疾的小儿麻痺症病人

sentences.english: teachers who work with learning disabled children (= children who have problems learning )
sentences.chinese: 教有学习障碍的儿童的教师

detailed_translations.english: someone who is disabled cannot use a part of their body properly, or cannot learn easily

detailed_translations.chinese: 使…失去能力（disable的过去分词）

name: disagree
trans: 不以为然, 意见不一, 意见不一致, 反对 (verb.)

sentences.english: Barr strongly disagreed with Kronfeld’s statement.
sentences.chinese: 巴尔强烈反对克龙费尔德的说法。

sentences.english: The statements of several witnesses disagree.
sentences.chinese: 几名证人的证词不一致。

detailed_translations.english: to have or express a different opinion from someone else

name: disappear
trans: 消失, 消失不见, 不见, 消 (verb.)

sentences.english: At this point the path seemed to disappear altogether (= disappear completely ) .
sentences.chinese: 小路到这里好像完全消失了。

sentences.english: The two girls disappeared while walking home from school..
sentences.chinese: 这两名女孩在放学回家的路上失踪了。

detailed_translations.english: to become impossible to see any longer

name: disappoint
trans: 失望, 辜负, 令人失望 (verb.)

sentences.english: I hated to disappoint her.
sentences.chinese: 我不愿意让她失望。

sentences.english: Great things were expected of this band, and they didn’t disappoint.
sentences.chinese: 大家对这支乐队的期望很高，而他们也不负众望。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel unhappy because something they hoped for did not happen or was not as good as they expected

name: disappointed
trans: 失望, 大失所望, 失意, 沮丧 (adj.)

sentences.english: Dad seemed more disappointed than angry.
sentences.chinese: 与其说爸爸生气，倒不如说他失望。

sentences.english: disappointed customers
sentences.chinese: 失望的顾客

detailed_translations.chinese: 失望的，沮丧的；受挫折的
detailed_translations.english: unhappy because something you hoped for did not happen, or because someone or something was not as good as you expected

name: disaster
trans: 灾难, 灾害, 灾, 场灾难 (noun.)

sentences.english: One hundred and twenty people died in China’s worst air disaster .
sentences.chinese: 有120人在中国这起最惨烈的空难事故中丧生。

sentences.english: the economic consequences of the Chernobyl nuclear disaster
sentences.chinese: 切尔诺贝利核灾难给经济带来的后果

sentences.english: The 1987 hurricane was the worst natural disaster to hit England for decades.
sentences.chinese: 1987年的飓风是英格兰数十年来遭遇的最为严重的自然灾害。

sentences.english: Their expedition nearly ended in disaster , when one of the climbers slid off the mountain.
sentences.chinese: 一名登山者从山上滑落，他们的探险活动险些以灾难告终。

sentences.english: The drought could spell disaster for wildlife.
sentences.chinese: 干旱可能会对野生生物造成灾难。

sentences.english: Disaster struckwhen two men were killed during their parachute jumps.
sentences.chinese: 灾难突然降临，两名男子在跳伞过程中丧生。

sentences.english: The peace process was on the brink of disaster .
sentences.chinese: 和平进程到了灾难的边缘。

sentences.english: Luckily the pilot saw the other plane just in time, and a disaster was narrowly averted .
sentences.chinese: 幸好驾驶员及时看到了另一架飞机，侥幸避免了一场灾难。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden event such as a flood, storm, or accident which causes great damage or suffering

name: disc
trans: 椎间盘, 光盘, 阀瓣, 盘 (noun.)

sentences.english: three keys attached to a metal disc
sentences.chinese: 穿在金属圆盘上的三把钥匙

detailed_translations.chinese: 圆盘，[电子] 唱片（等于disk）
detailed_translations.english: a round flat shape or object

name: discipline
trans: 纪律, 学科, 管教, 门学科 (noun.)

sentences.english: Martial arts teach respect, discipline, and cooperation.
sentences.chinese: 武术能教人尊重他人、遵守纪律并且相互合作。

sentences.english: Learning poetry is a good discipline for the memory.
sentences.chinese: 背诗是训练记忆力的一种好方法。

sentences.english: Different cultures have different ways of disciplining their children.
sentences.chinese: 不同的文化有不同的管教孩子的方法。

detailed_translations.english: a way of training someone so that they learn to control their behaviour and obey rules
to teach someone to obey rules and control their behaviour

name: discount
trans: 折扣, 打折, 贴现, 折价 (noun.)

sentences.english: They are often available at a discount.
sentences.chinese: 它们经常可以以折扣价买到。

sentences.english: This has forced airlines to discount fares heavily in order to spur demand.
sentences.chinese: 这已经迫使多家航空公司对机票大幅打折以刺激需求。

detailed_translations.english: a reduction in the usual price of something

detailed_translations.chinese: 将…打折扣； 不信； 漠视， 低估
detailed_translations.english: If a shop or company discounts an amount or percentage from something that they are selling, they take the amount or percentage off the usual price

name: discover
trans: 发现, 发掘, 探索, 找出 (verb.)

sentences.english: The body was discovered in a field.
sentences.chinese: 尸体是在一块田地里找到的。

sentences.english: Forest Service crews often discover campfires that have not been put out completely.
sentences.chinese: 林务局工作人员常常发现未完全熄灭的营火。

detailed_translations.english: to find someone or something, either by accident or because you were looking for them

name: discovery
trans: 发现, 探索, 发掘 (noun.)

sentences.english: the discovery of oil in Alaska
sentences.chinese: 在阿拉斯加发现石油

sentences.english: The Hubble Telescope allowed astronomers to make significant discoveries about our galaxy.
sentences.chinese: 哈勃望远镜使天文学家对我们的银河系有了重大发现。

detailed_translations.english: when someone discovers something

name: discuss
trans: 讨论, 探讨, 洽谈, 商讨 (verb.)

sentences.english: Littman refused to discuss the case publicly.
sentences.chinese: 利特曼拒绝公开讨论此案。

sentences.english: If you would like to discuss the matter further, please call me.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想进一步讨论此事，请打电话给我。

sentences.english: This topic will be discussed in Chapter 4.
sentences.chinese: 该主题将在第四章进行详述。

detailed_translations.english: to talk about something with another person or a group in order to exchange ideas or decide something

name: discussion
trans: 讨论, 探讨, 浅, 研讨 (noun.)

sentences.english: class discussions
sentences.chinese: 课堂讨论

sentences.english: the topics suggested for discussion
sentences.chinese: 建议讨论的话题

sentences.english: We have had discussions about her legal situation.
sentences.chinese: 我们就她的法律状况已进行了讨论。

detailed_translations.english: when you discuss something

name: disease
trans: 疾病, 病, 病害, 症 (noun.)

sentences.english: His father died of heart disease.
sentences.chinese: 他父亲死于心脏病。

sentences.english: She contracted the disease while she was abroad on holiday.
sentences.chinese: 她在国外度假时染上了这种疾病。

detailed_translations.chinese: 病， 疾病； 不健全， 弊端
detailed_translations.english: an illness which affects a person, animal, or plant

name: disgusting
trans: 恶心, 令人厌恶, 令人作呕, 令人讨厌 (adj.)

sentences.english: Rubbish was piled everywhere – it was disgusting.
sentences.chinese: 垃圾堆得到处都是，很恶心。

sentences.english: Smoking is a really disgusting habit.
sentences.chinese: 吸烟是一种十分令人讨厌的习惯。

detailed_translations.english: extremely unpleasant and making you feel sick

name: dish
trans: 菜, 道菜, 盘, 碟 (noun.)

sentences.english: a serving dish
sentences.chinese: 上菜用的盘子

sentences.english: an ovenproof dish
sentences.chinese: 耐热盘

sentences.english: The menu includes a wide selection of vegetarian dishes.
sentences.chinese: 菜单上有品种丰富的素食。

detailed_translations.english: a flat container with low sides, for serving food from or cooking food in

name: disk
trans: 磁盘, 盘, 花盘, 圆盘 (noun.)

sentences.english: Red blood cells are roughly the shape of a disk.
sentences.chinese: 红细胞大致呈圆盘状。

sentences.english: The program takes up 2.5 megabytes of disk space and can be run on a standard personal computer.
sentences.chinese: 这个程序占用2.5 兆字节的磁盘空间，可以在标准个人电脑上运行。

detailed_translations.english: (<英> disc)a small flat piece of plastic or metal which is used for storing computer or electronic information

name: dismiss
trans: 解雇, 驳回, 辞退, 解散 (verb.)

sentences.english: He just laughed and dismissed my proposal as unrealistic.
sentences.chinese: 他只是笑了笑，认为我的建议不切实际，拒绝考虑。

sentences.english: Bryant was unfairly dismissed from his post.
sentences.chinese: 布赖恩特被无理免职了。

detailed_translations.english: to refuse to consider someone’s idea, opinion etc, because you think it is not serious, true, or important

name: display
trans: 显示, 展示, 显示器, 陈列 (noun.)

sentences.english: a dazzling display (= very good display ) of flowers
sentences.chinese: 令人目眩神迷的花卉展

sentences.english: The window display caught her eye.
sentences.chinese: 橱窗陈列吸引了她的目光。

sentences.english: shop windows displaying the latest fashions
sentences.chinese: 展示最新时装的商店橱窗

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement of things for people to look at or buy
to show something to people, or put it in a place where people can see it easily

name: dispute
trans: 纠纷, 争端, 争议, 争执 (noun.); 争 (verb.)

sentences.english: It is beyond dispute that advances in medicine have enabled people to live longer.
sentences.chinese: 医学的发展使人们更加长寿，这是无可置疑的。

sentences.english: What happened next is hotly disputed .
sentences.chinese: 关于后来发生了什么，争论很激烈。

detailed_translations.english: a serious argument or disagreement
to argue or disagree with someone

name: distance
trans: 距离, 远程, 远处, 远方 (noun.)

sentences.english: Measure the distance between the two points.
sentences.chinese: 量出两点之间的距离。

sentences.english: The cottage is some distance (= quite a long distance ) from the road.
sentences.chinese: 小屋离开大路有些距离。

sentences.english: Church bells rang in the distance (= they were far away ) .
sentences.chinese: 远处教堂的钟声响起。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of space between two places or things

name: distant
trans: 遥远, 远处, 远方, 远房 (adj.)

sentences.english: the sound of distant gunfire
sentences.chinese: 远处的炮火声

sentences.english: Her honeymoon seemed a distant memory.
sentences.chinese: 她的蜜月似乎成了遥远的记忆。

sentences.english: That affair was in the dim and distant past (= a long time ago ) .
sentences.chinese: 那件事已成为遥远的过去了。

sentences.english: The President hopes to visit Ireland in the not too distant future (= quite soon ) .
sentences.chinese: 总统希望在不久的将来访问爱尔兰。

sentences.english: After the quarrel Sue remained cold and distant.
sentences.chinese: 那次争吵之后，休一直冷淡疏远。

detailed_translations.english: far away in space or time

name: distinct
trans: 鲜明, 截然不同, 独特, 不同 (adj.)

sentences.english: The outline of the ship became more distinct.
sentences.chinese: 船的轮廓变得更加清晰了。

detailed_translations.english: easily or clearly heard, seen, felt, etc.

name: distinction
trans: 区别, 区分, 差别, 鉴别 (noun.)

sentences.english: There are obvious distinctions between the two wine-making areas.
sentences.chinese: 这两个酿酒区之间有明显的不同。

detailed_translations.english: a clear difference or separation between two similar things

name: distinguish
trans: 区分, 分辨, 分清, 区别 (verb.)

sentences.english: The factor that distinguishes this company from the competition is customer service.
sentences.chinese: 使这家公司在竞争中脱颖而出的是其客户服务。

sentences.english: The main distinguishing feature of this species is the leaf shape.
sentences.chinese: 这一品种的主要特征是叶子的形状。

detailed_translations.english: to be the thing that makes someone or something different or special

name: distribute
trans: 分发, 分配, 派发, 分布 (verb.); 分布式 (noun.)

sentences.english: a man distributing leaflets to passers-by
sentences.chinese: 一个向路人派发传单的男子

sentences.english: Make sure that your weight is evenly distributed.
sentences.chinese: 注意让你的重量分布均匀。

detailed_translations.english: to share things among a group of people, especially in a planned way

name: distribution
trans: 分布, 分配, 配电, 配送 (noun.)

sentences.english: a distribution centre
sentences.chinese: 经销中心

detailed_translations.english: the act of sharing things among a large group of people in a planned way

name: district
trans: 区, 地区, 区域, 小区 (noun.)

sentences.english: a house in a pleasant suburban district
sentences.chinese: 地处宜人郊区的一幢房屋

detailed_translations.english: an area of a town or the countryside, especially one with particular features

name: disturb
trans: 打扰, 扰乱, 打搅, 干扰 (verb.)

sentences.english: Sorry to disturb you, but I have an urgent message.
sentences.chinese: 对不起打扰一下，我有个紧急消息。

sentences.english: The thieves fled when they were disturbed by a neighbour.
sentences.chinese: 窃贼们被一名邻居惊动后逃跑了。

sentences.english: (= a sign you put on a door so that people will not interrupt you ) .
sentences.chinese: 请勿打扰。

detailed_translations.chinese: 打扰；妨碍；使不安；弄乱；使恼怒
detailed_translations.english: to interrupt someone so that they cannot continue what they are doing

name: divide
trans: 鸿沟, 分歧 (noun.); 划分, 分裂, 分割, 分化 (verb.)

sentences.english: The book is divided into six sections.
sentences.chinese: 本书分为六部分。

sentences.english: The money will be divided equally among the charities.
sentences.chinese: 这笔钱将被平分给各慈善机构。

detailed_translations.english: if something divides, or if you divide it, it separates into two or more parts

name: division
trans: 划分, 分工, 师, 分部 (noun.)

sentences.english: the division sign (÷)
sentences.chinese: 除号

sentences.english: the Computer Services Division
sentences.chinese: 电脑维修部

detailed_translations.english: the process of finding out how many times one number is contained in another

name: divorce
trans: 离婚, 离异 (noun.)

sentences.english: David’s parents divorced when he was six.
sentences.chinese: 戴维的父母在他六岁时离婚了。

sentences.english: My father threatened to divorce her.
sentences.chinese: 我父亲威胁说要和她离婚。

detailed_translations.chinese: 离婚； 分离， 脱离
detailed_translations.english: if someone divorces their husband or wife, or if two people divorce, they legally end their marriage
the legal ending of a marriage

name: do
trans: 做, 做到, 干, 怎么办 (verb.)

sentences.english: ‘Will Kay come?’ ‘She may do.’
sentences.chinese: “凯来吗？” “或许吧。”

sentences.english: So now you know as much as I do.
sentences.chinese: 那么现在你知道的和我一样多了。

sentences.english: ‘You forgot all about it.’ ‘No, I didn’t.’
sentences.chinese: “你把这事忘记得一干二净。” “没有，我没忘记。”

sentences.english: ‘I want to go home.’ ‘So do I.’
sentences.chinese: “我想回家。” “我也是。”

sentences.english: I didn’t believe the story and neither did he.
sentences.chinese: 我不相信这个故事，他也不信。

detailed_translations.english: used instead of repeating a verb that has already been used
used instead of repeating a verb that has already been used

name: doctor
trans: 医生, 大夫, 看医生, 博士 (noun.)

sentences.english: She was treated by her local doctor.
sentences.chinese: 她由她的本区医生治疗。

sentences.english: I’d like to make an appointment to see Dr Pugh.
sentences.chinese: 我想预约看皮尤医生。

sentences.english: a Doctor of Law
sentences.chinese: 法学博士

detailed_translations.english: someone who is trained to treat people who are ill

name: document
trans: 文档, 文件, 文献, 单据 (noun.); 记录 (verb.)

sentences.english: She produces legal documents for a downtown Seattle law firm.
sentences.chinese: 她为西雅图市区的一家法律事务所撰写法律文件。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of paper that has official information on it
to write about something, film it, or take photographs of it, in order to record information about it

name: dog
trans: 狗, 犬, 狗狗, 狗儿 (noun.)

sentences.english: I could hear a dog barking .
sentences.chinese: 我听到了狗吠声。

sentences.english: He’s taken the dog for a walk .
sentences.chinese: 他去遛狗了。

sentences.english: We used to have a dog when I was young.
sentences.chinese: 我小时候我们养过狗。

sentences.english: the most popular breed of dog
sentences.chinese: 最受人喜欢的犬种

detailed_translations.english: a common animal with four legs, fur, and a tail. Dogs are kept as pets or trained to guard places, find drugs etc.

name: dollar
trans: 美元, 兑美元, 美元汇率, 兑美元汇率 (noun.)

sentences.english: It cost three dollars.
sentences.chinese: 它要三美元。

sentences.english: a ten-dollar bill
sentences.chinese: 一张十元钞票

sentences.english: You can pay in dollars or euros at the airport.
sentences.chinese: 在机场你可以使用美元或欧元。

detailed_translations.english: the standard unit of money in the US, Canada, Australia, and some other countries, divided into 100  cent s  : symbol $

name: domestic
trans: 国内, 国产, 家庭, 家用 (adj.)

sentences.english: ...over 100 domestic flights a day to 30 leading U.S. destinations.
sentences.chinese: …每天飞往美国30个主要目的地的100多个国内航班。

detailed_translations.english: relating to or happening in one particular country and not involving any other countries

name: dominant
trans: 主导, 显性, 占主导地位, 优势 (adj.)

sentences.english: The dominant male gorilla is the largest in the group.
sentences.chinese: 领头的公猩猩是这群大猩猩中体形最大的一个。

sentences.english: Japan became dominant in the mass market during the 1980s.
sentences.chinese: 20世纪80年代日本在大众市场上开始占据优势。

sentences.english: its dominant position within the group
sentences.chinese: 它在该组织中的突出地位

detailed_translations.chinese: 显性的；占优势的；支配的，统治的
detailed_translations.english: more powerful, important, or noticeable than other people or things

name: dominate
trans: 主宰, 支配, 占据主导地位, 称霸 (verb.)

sentences.english: The industry is dominated by five multinational companies.
sentences.chinese: 这个行业受五家跨国公司控制。

sentences.english: New Orleans dominated throughout the game.
sentences.chinese: 新奥尔良队自始至终都控制着这场比赛。

sentences.english: Her loud voice totally dominated the conversation.
sentences.chinese: 她的大嗓门完全主导着这场谈话。

sentences.english: Education issues dominated the election campaign.
sentences.chinese: 教育问题成了这次选举活动的主要辩题。

detailed_translations.english: to control someone or something or to have more importance than other people or things

name: door
trans: 门, 扇门, 门口, 大门 (noun.)

sentences.english: Could you open the door for me?
sentences.chinese: 请你帮我开门好吗？

sentences.english: The door flew open and Ruth stormed in.
sentences.chinese: 门一下子打开了，露丝气冲冲地跑了进来。

sentences.english: Don’t forget to lock the garage door.
sentences.chinese: 别忘了把车库的门锁上。

sentences.english: Marc appeared through a door at the far end of the room.
sentences.chinese: 马克从房间另一端的门口出现。

sentences.english: the family that lives three doors up from us
sentences.chinese: 住在与我们相隔三户的那户人家

detailed_translations.english: a piece of wood, glass, etc. that is opened and closed so that people can get in and out of a room, building, car, etc.; a similar thing in a cupboard/closet

name: dot
trans: 点, 网点, 斑点, 科 (noun.); 点缀 (verb.)

sentences.english: a pattern of dots
sentences.chinese: 圆点图案

sentences.english: She never dots her i’s.
sentences.chinese: 她从来不在i上面加点。

detailed_translations.english: a small round mark or spot
to mark something by putting a dot on it or above it

name: double
trans: 双, 双重, 双倍, 双层 (adj.); 加倍, 翻倍 (verb.)

sentences.english: a double sink
sentences.chinese: 双水槽

sentences.english: a double wardrobe
sentences.chinese: 双门衣柜

sentences.english: the great double doors of the cathedral
sentences.chinese: 大教堂宏伟的双开大门

sentences.english: Don’t park your car on double yellow lines.
sentences.chinese: 不可以在双黄线处停车。

sentences.english: The city was enclosed by walls of double thickness.
sentences.chinese: 该城被两倍厚的墙围了起来。

detailed_translations.english: consisting of two parts that are similar or exactly the same

name: doubt
trans: 怀疑 (verb.); 疑问, 疑惑, 质疑, 疑虑 (noun.)

sentences.english: There was still one little nagging doubt at the back of his mind.
sentences.chinese: 他的心头仍有一丝挥之不去的疑虑。

sentences.english: Kim never doubted his story.
sentences.chinese: 例句：金对于他讲的事情从不怀疑。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of being not sure whether something is true or right
to think that something may not be true or that it is unlikely

name: down
trans: 下来, 向下, 放下, 下降 (adv.); 失望, 下, 倒 (prep.)

sentences.english: David bent down to tie his shoelace.
sentences.chinese: 戴维弯腰系鞋带。

sentences.english: Get down off the table.
sentences.chinese: 从桌子上下来。

sentences.english: Tears were streaming down my face.
sentences.chinese: 我泪流满面。

sentences.english: The sun was going down and it would soon be dark.
sentences.chinese: 夕阳西下，天很快就要黑了。

sentences.english: They came running down the stairs.
sentences.chinese: 他们跑下楼来。

sentences.english: She stood on a balcony looking down into the courtyard.
sentences.chinese: 她站在阳台上朝下面的院子望去。

sentences.english: Glancing down the list of runners, I noticed a familiar name.
sentences.chinese: 我往下扫了一眼赛跑选手的名单，注意到了一个熟悉的名字。

sentences.english: Her hair came down to her waist.
sentences.chinese: 她的头发一直垂到腰际。

sentences.english: Ken fell asleep face down (= with his face towards the ground ) on the couch.
sentences.chinese: 肯趴在长沙发上睡着了。

sentences.english: We heard the sound of laughter down below.
sentences.chinese: 我们听到下面有笑声。

sentences.english: The bathroom is down those stairs.
sentences.chinese: 浴室在那段楼梯下面。

detailed_translations.english: to or towards a lower place or position

name: downstairs
trans: 楼下, 下楼 (adv.)

sentences.english: Rosie ran downstairs to answer the door.
sentences.chinese: 罗茜跑下楼去开门。

sentences.english: Charles was downstairs in the kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 查尔斯在楼下厨房里。

sentences.english: She repainted the downstairs rooms and closed off the second floor.
sentences.chinese: 她重新粉刷了楼下的房间，并把二楼封上了。

detailed_translations.english: towards or on a lower floor of a building, especially a house
Downstairs means situated on the ground floor of a building or on a lower floor than you are
the rooms on the ground floor in a house

name: downtown
trans: 市中心, 市区, 闹市区, 商业区 (noun.)

sentences.english: By day he worked downtown for American Standard.
sentences.chinese: 白天，他在市中心为美国标准公司工作。

sentences.english: ...an office in downtown Chicago.
sentences.chinese: …芝加哥市中心的一间办公室。

sentences.english: ...in a large vacant area of the downtown.
sentences.chinese: …在市中心的一大块空地上。

detailed_translations.english: Downtown is also an adverb
Downtown places are in or toward the centre of a large town or city, where the stores and places of business are
Downtown is also a noun

name: dozen
trans: 打, 十几, 十二, 几十 (noun.)

sentences.english: a dozen eggs
sentences.chinese: 一打鸡蛋

sentences.english: Chris, Helen, and half a dozen others went on holiday together.
sentences.chinese: 克里斯、海伦和其他六个人一起去度假了。

sentences.english: (= about 12 ) cars were parked near the entrance.
sentences.chinese: 入口附近停了大约十二辆汽车。

detailed_translations.english: twelve

name: draft
trans: 草案, 草稿, 起草, 稿 (noun.)

sentences.english: the rough draft of his new novel
sentences.chinese: 他的新小说的草稿

sentences.english: I read the first draft and thought it was very good.
sentences.chinese: 我读了第一稿，觉得非常好。

sentences.english: All parties eventually approved the final draft (= finished form ) of the peace treaty.
sentences.chinese: 各方最后都同意了和平条约的终稿。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of writing or a plan that is not yet in its finished form
to write a plan, letter, report etc that will need to be changed before it is in its finished form

name: drag
trans: 拖动, 拖, 鼠标拖动, 拖曳 (verb.); 阻力, 拖累, 拖放, 阻 (noun.)

sentences.english: He grabbed her arm and dragged her into the room.
sentences.chinese: 他抓住她的手臂把她拖进房间。

sentences.english: He took a drag on his cigarette, and exhaled the smoke.
sentences.chinese: 他咂了口烟，然后吐出烟雾。

detailed_translations.chinese: 拖，拉；迫使，硬拉；拖着脚步走
detailed_translations.english: to pull something along the ground, often because it is too heavy to carry

detailed_translations.chinese: 累赘； 一吸， 一抽
detailed_translations.english: If you take a drag on a cigarette or pipe that you are smoking, you take in air through it

name: drama
trans: 戏剧, 话剧, 戏曲, 剧 (noun.)

sentences.english: the great traditions of ancient Greek drama
sentences.chinese: 古希腊戏剧的伟大传统

sentences.english: a new drama series for Saturday nights
sentences.chinese: 周六晚上播放的新连续剧

sentences.english: a drama critic
sentences.chinese: 戏剧评论员

sentences.english: a courtroom drama
sentences.chinese: 法庭剧

sentences.english: a lavish costume drama
sentences.chinese: 豪华古装剧

sentences.english: He plays a Russian spy in the comedy drama ‘Sleepers’.
sentences.chinese: 他在喜剧片《潜伏特工》中扮演一名俄罗斯间谍。

detailed_translations.chinese: 戏剧， 剧本； 戏剧性事件
detailed_translations.english: a play for the theatre, television, radio etc, usually a serious one, or plays in general

name: dramatic
trans: 戏剧性, 戏剧化, 戏剧, 引人注目 (adj.)

sentences.english: A superb goal by Owen earned United a dramatic victory yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 昨天欧文的一个超级入球为联队赢得了激动人心的胜利。

sentences.english: Some of the most dramatic events in American history happened here.
sentences.chinese: 美国历史上一些最震撼人心的事件发生在这里。

sentences.english: the dramatic scenery of the Grand Canyon
sentences.chinese: 大峡谷的壮丽景致

detailed_translations.chinese: 引人注目的， 激动人心的； 戏剧的
detailed_translations.english: exciting or impressive

name: draw
trans: 画, 绘制, 画画, 得出 (verb.)

sentences.english: Katie had drawn a cottage with a little stream running next to it.
sentences.chinese: 凯蒂画了一间小茅舍，旁边流淌着一条小溪。

sentences.english: She asked the little girl to draw a picture of the man she’d spoken to.
sentences.chinese: 她让小女孩把刚才和她说话的那个男人画出来。

sentences.english: Keith was drawing a complicated-looking graph.
sentences.chinese: 基思在画一张看上去很复杂的图表。

sentences.english: I’ve never been able to draw very well.
sentences.chinese: 我从来就画不好图画。

detailed_translations.english: to produce a picture of something using a pencil, pen etc

name: drawer
trans: 抽屉, 抽屉里 (noun.)

sentences.english: She took a file from her desk drawer .
sentences.chinese: 她从书桌的抽屉里拿出了一个文件夹。

sentences.english: The scissors are in the kitchen drawer (= drawer in a piece of kitchen furniture ) .
sentences.chinese: 剪刀在厨房的抽屉里。

detailed_translations.english: part of a piece of furniture, such as a desk, that you pull out and push in and use to keep things in

name: drawing
trans: 绘图, 图纸, 制图, 绘画 (noun.); 绘制, 画, 画画, 拉伸 (verb.)

sentences.english: a drawing of Canterbury Cathedral
sentences.chinese: 一幅坎特伯雷大教堂的素描画

sentences.english: I’ve never been very good at drawing.
sentences.chinese: 我向来不擅长画图。

detailed_translations.english: a picture that you draw with a pencil, pen etc

name: dream
trans: 梦想, 梦, 梦境, 梦幻 (noun.); 做梦, 梦见 (verb.)

sentences.english: I had lots of dreams last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚我做了很多梦。

sentences.english: Her dream is to make a movie.
sentences.chinese: 她的梦想是要拍一部电影。

sentences.english: It’s quite common to dream that you’re falling.
sentences.chinese: 梦到自己坠落是常有的事。

detailed_translations.english: a series of thoughts, images, and feelings that you experience when you are asleep
to have a dream while you are asleep

name: dress
trans: 礼服, 裙子, 衣服, 连衣裙 (noun.); 打扮, 穿 (verb.)

sentences.english: a gentleman in evening dress
sentences.chinese: 穿晚礼服的绅士

sentences.english: The play was performed in modern dress (= clothes from the present time ) .
sentences.chinese: 这出戏里演员是现代装束。

detailed_translations.english: clothes for men or women of a particular type or for a particular occasion

name: drink
trans: 喝, 喝酒, 饮用, 喝水 (verb.); 饮料, 饮, 杯, 酒后 (noun.)

sentences.english: You should drink plenty of water.
sentences.chinese: 你应该大量喝水。

sentences.english: What would you like to drink?
sentences.chinese: 你想喝点什么？

sentences.english: Take a seat while I get you something to drink .
sentences.chinese: 请坐，我去给你倒杯喝的。

sentences.english: She filled the glass and drank.
sentences.chinese: 她把杯子倒满后喝了起来。

detailed_translations.english: to take liquid into your mouth and swallow it
to take liquid into your mouth and swallow it
an amount of liquid that you drink, or the act of drinking something

name: drive
trans: 开车, 驾驶, 开车送, 开 (verb.); 驱动器, 驱动, 传动, 动力 (noun.)

sentences.english: Can you drive?
sentences.chinese: 你会开车吗？

sentences.english: We watched Dad drive the posts into the ground.
sentences.chinese: 我们看着爸爸把木桩打入地里。

sentences.english: With a few loud whistles, they drove the donkeys out of the enclosure.
sentences.chinese: 随着几声响亮的哨声，他们把驴子赶出了围栏。

detailed_translations.english: to make a car, truck, bus etc move along

name: driver
trans: 司机, 驱动程序, 驾驶员, 驱动 (noun.)

sentences.english: a taxi driver
sentences.chinese: 出租车司机

sentences.english: Do you think you’re a good driver?
sentences.chinese: 你认为自己是个好司机吗？

detailed_translations.english: someone who drives a car, bus etc

name: drop
trans: 滴, 下降, 降, 下跌 (noun.); 放下, 放弃, 掉, 删除 (verb.)

sentences.english: Your button has dropped off.
sentences.chinese: 你的纽扣掉了。

sentences.english: The number of deaths on the roads has dropped sharply.
sentences.chinese: 交通事故死亡人数已大大减少。

detailed_translations.english: to fall suddenly onto the ground or into something

name: drug
trans: 药物, 药品, 毒品, 药 (noun.)

sentences.english: a drug used in the treatment of cancer
sentences.chinese: 用于治疗癌症的一种药物

sentences.english: (= ordered for people ) by doctors can be extremely hazardous if used in the wrong way.
sentences.chinese: 医生开的处方药如果使用不当是非常危险的。

sentences.english: The big drug companies make huge profits.
sentences.chinese: 大型制药公司利润丰厚。

detailed_translations.english: a medicine, or a substance for making medicines

name: drunk
trans: 醉, 喝醉, 醉酒, 灌醉 (adj.)

sentences.english: He must be either mad or drunk.
sentences.chinese: 他要么是疯了，要么是喝醉了。

sentences.english: Last night I got drunk and rolfed my dinner.
sentences.chinese: 昨天晚上我喝醉了，把晚饭全吐出来了。

detailed_translations.english: unable to control your behaviour, speech etc because you have drunk too much alcohol

name: dry
trans: 干, 干燥, 乾, 干爽 (adj.); 擦干 (verb.)

sentences.english: I need to change into some dry clothes .
sentences.chinese: 我要换上干衣服。

sentences.english: Make sure that the surface is clean and dry before you start to paint.
sentences.chinese: 油漆之前一定先要确保表面清洁干燥。

sentences.english: You should store disks in a cool, dry place.
sentences.chinese: 你应该把磁盘存放在阴凉干燥的地方。

sentences.english: The path is dry as a bone (= very dry ) .
sentences.chinese: 这条小道很干燥。

detailed_translations.english: without water or liquid inside or on the surface

name: duck
trans: 鸭, 鸭子, 只鸭子, 烤鸭 (noun.)

sentences.english: If she hadn’t ducked, the ball would have hit her.
sentences.chinese: 如果她没有弯腰躲闪的话，那个球就可能击中她了。

sentences.english: Tim ducked down to comb his hair in the mirror.
sentences.chinese: 蒂姆低下身在镜子前梳头发。

sentences.english: She ducked her head to look more closely at the inscription.
sentences.chinese: 她低下头更仔细地看碑文。

detailed_translations.chinese: 鸭子似的突然扎入水中； 突然低下
detailed_translations.english: to lower your head or body very quickly, especially to avoid being seen or hit
a very common water bird with short legs and a wide beak, used for its meat, eggs, and soft feathers

name: dude
trans: 老兄, 伙计, 哥们, 花花公子 (noun.)

name: due
trans: 由于, 因, 到期, 应有 (adj.)

sentences.english: The team are due to fly to Italy next month.
sentences.chinese: 该球队预定下个月飞往意大利。

sentences.english: Any money due you will be sent by cheque through the post.
sentences.chinese: 应该支付给你的款项将会以支票邮寄给你。

detailed_translations.english: expected to happen or arrive at a particular time

name: dull
trans: 沉闷, 枯燥, 平淡, 乏味 (adj.)

sentences.english: Life is never dull when Elizabeth is here.
sentences.chinese: 有伊丽莎白在这里生活绝不会无聊。

sentences.english: a dull movie
sentences.chinese: 一部沉闷的电影

sentences.english: It sounded pretty dull to me.
sentences.chinese: 在我听来，这很无聊。

sentences.english: The weekly meeting tends to be deadly dull (= very dull ) .
sentences.chinese: 每周一次的会议总是十分无聊。

sentences.english: The bird is dull brown and gray in colour.
sentences.chinese: 这只鸟是暗淡的棕灰色。

detailed_translations.english: not interesting or exciting

name: dumb
trans: 哑, 哑巴, 蠢, 愚蠢 (adj.)

sentences.english: What a dumb question.
sentences.chinese: 多么愚蠢的问题。

sentences.english: a bunch of dumb kids
sentences.chinese: 一帮笨孩子

sentences.english: ‘What is it?’ I asked, playing dumb (= pretending to be stupid ) .
sentences.chinese: “那是什么？” 我装傻问道。

sentences.english: She’s no dumb blonde (= a pretty woman with blonde hair who seems stupid ) .
sentences.chinese: 她可不是那种没有头脑的金发女郎。

detailed_translations.chinese: 哑的；暂不说话的；愚笨的
detailed_translations.english: stupid

name: dump
trans: 转储, 排土场, 垃圾场, 垃圾堆 (noun.); 甩, 甩掉, 倾倒, 抛弃 (verb.)

sentences.english: We dumped our bags at the nearby Grand Hotel and hurried toward the market.
sentences.chinese: 我们把包扔在附近的格兰德旅馆，急匆匆地向市场赶去。

sentences.english: a campaign to stop cheap European beef being dumped in West Africa
sentences.chinese: 阻止在西非倾销廉价欧洲牛肉的运动

detailed_translations.english: If you dump something somewhere, you put it or unload it there quickly and carelessly.

name: during
trans: 期间, 在 (prep.)

sentences.english: During the summer she worked as a lifeguard.
sentences.chinese: 夏天她当过救生员。

sentences.english: He slept calmly during the early part of the night.
sentences.chinese: 他上半夜睡得很安稳。

sentences.english: Foxes remain hidden during the day.
sentences.chinese: 狐狸白天一直躲藏着。

detailed_translations.english: from the beginning to the end of a period of time

name: dust
trans: 灰尘, 尘埃, 粉尘, 尘土 (noun.)

sentences.english: All the furniture was covered in dust .
sentences.chinese: 所有的家具都蒙上了灰尘。

sentences.english: a thick layer of dust
sentences.chinese: 厚厚的一层灰尘

sentences.english: There’s not a speck of dust in the kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 厨房里一尘不染。

sentences.english: Dust particles floated in the sunlight.
sentences.chinese: 阳光里飘浮着尘埃颗粒。

sentences.english: A sudden breeze sent motes of dust (= small bits of dust ) dancing in the air.
sentences.chinese: 突然刮起一阵微风吹得灰尘飞扬。

trans: 地球, 大地, 土, 泥土 (noun.)

sentences.chinese: 地球

sentences.chinese: 大地晃动了。

detailed_translations.english: the planet that we live on

trans: 缓解, 减轻, 缓和, 纾缓 (verb.); 轻松, 易于, 便于, 方便 (noun.)

sentences.english: The plan should ease traffic congestion in the town.

trans: 容易, 轻易, 轻松, 易 (adv.)

sentences.chinese: 英格兰东部的农民

detailed_translations.english: in or from the east of a country or area

trans: 容易, 易, 简单, 轻松 (adj.)

sentences.chinese: 考试很容易。

sentences.chinese: 完成这项任务并不容易。

sentences.chinese: 费利克斯一边吃一边兴奋地聊天。

sentences.chinese: 一个小女孩在吃冰激凌。

sentences.chinese: 她可以吃得很多，但体重从来不会增加。

detailed_translations.english: to put food in your mouth and chew and swallow it
to put food in your mouth and chew and swallow it

trans: 经济, 经济学 (adj.)

sentences.english: Economic reform is needed.

sentences.english: In the current economic climate (= conditions ), we must keep costs down.

trans: 经济 (noun.)

sentences.chinese: 日本经济的减缓

sentences.chinese: 把鸡蛋放在盘子中间，盘边一圈放些蔬菜和香草。

sentences.chinese: 他站在水边，凝视着湖对面。

sentences.chinese: 《每日电讯报》的主编

name: education

sentences.chinese: 她也希望她的孩子可以受到良好的教育。

trans: 教育, 育人, 教学 (adj.); 教务 (noun.)

detailed_translations.english: relating to education

sentences.chinese: 能源效率的显著提高

sentences.chinese: 这种毒品的长期影响

sentences.chinese: 乌鸫在3月产蛋。

sentences.chinese: 这些蛋要26天才能孵化。

sentences.chinese: 乔早餐总是吃熏肉加蛋。

name: elderly

sentences.chinese: 穿着考究的老妇人

sentences.chinese: 老年人在任何选举中都是一股强大的力量。

detailed_translations.english: The elderly are people who are old

name: elect
trans: 选出, 选举, 推选, 推举 (verb.); 当选 (noun.)

sentences.english: the country’s first democratically elected government
sentences.chinese: 该国第一个民主选举产生的政府

sentences.english: You can elect to delete the message or save it.
sentences.chinese: 你可以选择删除或者保存信息。

detailed_translations.english: to choose someone for an official position by voting

name: election
trans: 选举, 大选, 竞选, 选 (noun.)

sentences.english: The Labour Party won the 2001 election by a huge majority.
sentences.chinese: 工党在2001年选举中以巨大优势获胜。

sentences.english: Elections for the state governorship will be on November 25.
sentences.chinese: 州长选举将于11月25日举行。

detailed_translations.english: when people vote to choose someone for an official position

name: electric
trans: 电动, 电, 电气, 电力 (adj.); 电器, 电机 (noun.)

sentences.english: an electric blanket
sentences.chinese: 电热毯

detailed_translations.english: needing electricity to work, produced by electricity, or used for carrying electricity

name: electrical
trans: 电气, 电, 电器, 电工 (adj.)

sentences.english: The fire was caused by an electrical fault.
sentences.chinese: 大火是电力故障引起的。

sentences.english: an electrical engineer
sentences.chinese: 电力[电气]工程师

detailed_translations.english: relating to electricity

name: electricity
trans: 电力, 电, 用电, 电能 (noun.)

sentences.english: The farm was very isolated, but it had electricity.
sentences.chinese: 那个农场非常偏远，但有电力供应。

detailed_translations.english: the power that is carried by wires, cables etc, and is used to provide light or heat, to make machines work etc

name: electronic
trans: 电子, 电 (adj.)

sentences.english: electronic games
sentences.chinese: 电子游戏

sentences.english: an electronic organizer (= a small piece of electronic equipment that you can use to record addresses, phone numbers etc )
sentences.chinese: 电子记事本

detailed_translations.english: electronic equipment, such as computers and televisions, uses electricity that has passed through computer chips, transistors etc

name: element
trans: 元素, 元, 元件, 单元 (noun.)

sentences.english: Business and management elements are built into the course.
sentences.chinese: 本课程加入了商务和管理方面的内容。

sentences.english: Hydrogen is a one-valence element.
sentences.chinese: 氢是一价的元素。

detailed_translations.english: one part or feature of a whole system, plan, piece of work etc, especially one that is basic or important

name: elevator
trans: 电梯, 升降机, 梯, 升降 (noun.)

sentences.english: We’ll have to take the elevator.
sentences.chinese: 我们只好坐电梯了。

detailed_translations.english: a machine that takes people and goods from one level to another in a building

name: else
trans: 别的, 其他, 还, 否则 (adv.)

sentences.english: There’s something else I’d like to talk about as well.
sentences.chinese: 我还有其他事情要谈一谈。

sentences.english: I’d like you to come, and anyone else who’s free.
sentences.chinese: 我想请你过来，其他人有空也可以来。

sentences.english: He was awake now, as was everyone else.
sentences.chinese: 他现在已经醒了，其他人也都醒了。

sentences.english: Who else was at the party?
sentences.chinese: 还有谁参加了聚会？

sentences.english: ‘Two coffees, please.’ ‘Anything else?’ ‘No, thanks.’
sentences.chinese: “请来两杯咖啡。”“还要别的吗？”“不要了，谢谢。

sentences.english: (= more than any other things ) she was seeking love.
sentences.chinese: 她追求爱情胜过一切。

sentences.english: If I can't make a living at painting, at least I can teach someone else to paint.
sentences.chinese: 如果我不能以画画谋生的话，至少我能教别人画画。

sentences.chinese: 在那些漫长的旅途中我们别无他事可做。

detailed_translations.english: besides or in addition to someone or something
You use else after words such as "anywhere," "someone," and "what" to refer in a vague way to another person, place, or thing

name: elsewhere
trans: 别处, 他处, 外地 (adv.)

sentences.english: She is becoming famous in Australia and elsewhere.
sentences.chinese: 她在澳大利亚和其他地方渐渐出名了。

sentences.english: Kerala has less crime and alcoholism than elsewhere in India.

detailed_translations.english: in, at, or to another place

name: email
trans: 电子邮件, 电邮, 邮件, 封电子邮件 (noun.)

sentences.english: It’s usually best to contact him by email.
sentences.chinese: 一般最好是用电子邮件和他联络。

name: embarrassed

sentences.english: Lori gets embarrassed if we ask her to sing.
sentences.chinese: 我们要是请洛丽唱歌，她就会难为情。

sentences.chinese: 我问他去了哪里，他显得很窘迫。

detailed_translations.english: feeling uncomfortable or nervous and worrying about what people think of you, for example because you have made a silly mistake, or because you have to talk or sing in public

name: emerge

sentences.chinese: 经过选举，反对派开始露头。

trans: 紧急, 应急, 急诊, 急救 (noun.)

trans: 情感, 情绪, 感情, 感慨 (noun.)

sentences.chinese: 那次葬礼对我们大家来说都是一次无比伤感的经历。

detailed_translations.chinese: 情绪(上)的，情感(上)的；激起感情的； 敏感的；情绪激动的〔尤指哭泣〕
detailed_translations.english: relating to your feelings or how you control them

name: emphasis
trans: 重点, 强调, 重视, 侧重点 (noun.)

detailed_translations.chinese: 强调； 重视； 重要性

trans: 强调, 注重, 着重 (verb.)

detailed_translations.english: a group of countries that are all controlled by one ruler or government

trans: 雇用, 聘请, 聘用, 雇佣 (verb.)

sentences.chinese: 这家工厂雇用了2,000多名员工。

trans: 员工, 雇员, 职工, 职员 (noun.)

trans: 雇主, 用人单位, 老板, 业主 (noun.)

sentences.chinese: 这家制鞋厂是本地区最大的雇主。

trans: 就业, 雇佣, 就业率, 就业人数 (noun.)

sentences.chinese: 她获聘在销售部工作。

sentences.english: the needs of women who combine paid employment and care for their families

detailed_translations.english: the condition of having a paid job

name: empty
trans: 空, 空虚, 空荡荡, 空洞 (adj.); 清空 (verb.)

sentences.chinese: 空盒子

sentences.english: an empty bottle

sentences.chinese: 书桌后面的空位

trans: 遇到, 碰到, 遇, 遭到 (verb.); 遭遇, 邂逅, 相遇 (noun.)

name: encourage
trans: 鼓励, 激励, 助长, 鼓舞 (verb.)

name: encouraging
trans: 鼓励 (verb.); 令人鼓舞, 鼓舞人心, 激励, 鼓舞 (adj.)

name: end
trans: 结束, 端, 终结, 尽头 (noun.)

sentences.chinese: 他的眼镜架在鼻尖上。

sentences.chinese: 乔排到了队尾。

sentences.english: She’ll do anything to achieve her own ends.

name: enemy

name: engineer

sentences.chinese: 他接受过土木工程师培训。

trans: 工程, 工程学, 工科, 工程设计 (noun.)

sentences.chinese: 这座桥是现代工程的一大成就。

trans: 巨大, 庞大, 极大, 巨额 (adj.)

trans: 确保, 保证, 保障 (verb.)

trans: 进入, 输入, 进, 进军 (verb.)

sentences.chinese: 进来前先敲门。

sentences.chinese: 叛乱分子愿意参加谈判。

sentences.english: The dolphins give good entertainment value (= a lot of amusement and interest ).

sentences.chinese: 吉利恩和达伦非常热情地接待了演讲者。

trans: 热情, 热心, 热烈, 热情洋溢 (adj.)

sentences.chinese: 改革的热心支持者

trans: 整个, 全缘, 整, 全 (adj.)

trans: 完全, 全部, 全, 全然 (adv.)

sentences.chinese: 我们的处境完全不同。

sentences.english: The ridge consists entirely of volcanic rock.
sentences.chinese: 这处山脊完全由火山岩构成。

sentences.chinese: 布里奇特动作夸张地进了房间。

sentences.chinese: 你可以把伞放在入口处。

sentences.english: More keyboarding staff are required for data entry.
sentences.chinese: 需要更多的键盘录入人员来录入这些资料。

sentences.english: There was no sign of a forced entry.
sentences.chinese: 没有强行闯入的迹象。

sentences.english: How did the thieves gain entry (= get in )?
sentences.chinese: 窃贼是怎样进入的？

name: envelope
trans: 信封, 包络, 围护结构, 包络线 (noun.)

sentences.english: envelopes and stamps
sentences.chinese: 信封和邮票

sentences.english: She tore open the envelope and frantically read the letter.
sentences.chinese: 她撕开信封慌忙看信。

sentences.english: He got a job stuffing envelopes (= filling them with letters ) at the campaign headquarters.
sentences.chinese: 他找了一份在竞选总部装信封的工作。

name: environment
trans: 环境, 环保 (noun.)

sentences.chinese: 这些化学品中有些对环境非常有害。

sentences.english: legislation to protect the environment
sentences.chinese: 保护环境的法规

sentences.english: the effects of acid rain on the environment
sentences.chinese: 酸雨对环境的影响

sentences.english: the government minister for the environment
sentences.chinese: 负责环境事务的政府部长

detailed_translations.english: the air, water, and land on Earth, which is affected by man’s activities

name: environmental
trans: 环境, 环保, 环境保护 (adj.)

sentences.english: the environmental damage caused by the chemical industry
sentences.chinese: 化学工业对环境造成的破坏

sentences.english: an international meeting to discuss environmental issues
sentences.chinese: 探讨环境问题的国际会议

sentences.english: the environmental impact of pollution from cars
sentences.chinese: 汽车造成的污染对环境的影响

sentences.english: an environmental group
sentences.chinese: 环境保护组织

detailed_translations.english: concerning or affecting the air, land, or water on Earth

name: equal
trans: 平等, 相等, 同等, 等于 (adj.)

sentences.english: Both candidates received an equal number of votes.
sentences.chinese: 两位候选人的得票数相等。

sentences.english: I’m not sure he’s equal to the task.
sentences.chinese: 我不确定他是否能胜任这项任务。

sentences.english: He treats all his staff as equals.
sentences.chinese: 他对所有员工都一视同仁。

sentences.english: Two plus two equals four.
sentences.chinese: 二加二等于四。

detailed_translations.english: the same in size, number, amount, value etc as something else
someone who is as important, intelligent etc as you are, or who has the same rights and opportunities as you do
to be exactly the same in size, number, or amount as something else

name: equally
trans: 同样, 同等, 平等, 相等 (adv.)

sentences.english: You must have a good education, but practical training is equally important.
sentences.chinese: 你必须接受良好的教育，不过实际培训也同样重要。

detailed_translations.chinese: 同样地；相等地，平等地；公平地
detailed_translations.english: to the same degree or amount

name: equipment
trans: 设备, 装备, 器材, 装置 (noun.)

sentences.english: a shop selling camping equipment
sentences.chinese: 出售露营装备的商店

sentences.english: some brand new computer equipment
sentences.chinese: 一些全新的计算机设备

sentences.english: a very useful piece of equipment
sentences.chinese: 一件非常有用的设备

sentences.english: A lot of money was spent on the equipment of the new hospital.
sentences.chinese: 新医院的装备花费巨大。

detailed_translations.english: the tools, machines etc that you need to do a particular job or activity

name: equivalent
trans: 等效, 相当于, 等价, 当量 (adj.)

sentences.chinese: 我没有美金，但给了他等值的英镑。

name: era
trans: 时代, 年代, 纪元, 时期 (noun.)

sentences.english: His death marked the end of an era.
sentences.chinese: 他的去世标志着一个时代的终结。

sentences.english: the Victorian era
sentences.chinese: 维多利亚时代

detailed_translations.english: a period of time in history that is known for a particular event, or for particular qualities

name: error
trans: 误差, 错误, 差错, 出错 (noun.)

sentences.english: There must be an error in our calculations.
sentences.chinese: 我们的计算肯定有错。

detailed_translations.english: a mistake

name: escape
trans: 逃脱, 逃避, 逃跑, 逃走 (verb.); 逃生, 逃逸, 越狱 (noun.)

sentences.english: He broke down the locked door and escaped.
sentences.chinese: 他砸开上锁的门，逃走了。

sentences.english: Vents allow any steam to escape if the system overheats.
sentences.chinese: 如果系统过热，排放口可使蒸汽逸出。

sentences.english: The girl had no chance of escape.
sentences.chinese: 那女孩没有机会逃跑。

detailed_translations.english: to leave a place when someone is trying to catch you or stop you, or when there is a dangerous situation
the act of getting away from a place, or a dangerous or bad situation

name: especially
trans: 特别是, 尤其是, 尤其, 特别 (adv.)

sentences.english: I never liked long walks, especially in winter.
sentences.chinese: 我向来不喜欢长距离散步，尤其在冬天。

sentences.english: Art books are expensive to produce, especially if they contain colour illustrations.
sentences.chinese: 美术类书籍制作成本很高，尤其是那些带彩色插图的。

sentences.english: I was especially fond of chocolate biscuits.
sentences.chinese: 我特别爱吃巧克力饼干。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that something is more important or happens more with one particular thing than with others

name: essay
trans: 短文, 随笔, 篇文章, 作文 (noun.)

sentences.english: an essay on Bernard Shaw
sentences.chinese: 关于萧伯纳的文章

sentences.english: We asked Jason to write an essay about his hometown.
sentences.chinese: 我们让杰森写一篇关于他家乡的短文。

detailed_translations.english: a short piece of writing about a particular subject by a student as part of a course of study

name: essential
trans: 必不可少, 本质, 必要, 基本 (adj.)

sentences.english: Window locks are fairly cheap and absolutely essential.
sentences.chinese: 窗锁相当便宜，绝对有必要安装。

sentences.english: Even in small companies, computers are an essential tool.
sentences.chinese: 即使在小公司里，计算机也是不可或缺的工具。

detailed_translations.english: extremely important and necessary
something that is necessary to do something or in a particular situation

name: essentially
trans: 本质上, 基本上, 实质上, 从本质上讲 (adv.)

sentences.english: Ballet is essentially a middle-class interest.
sentences.chinese: 芭蕾舞基本上是中产阶级感兴趣的东西。

sentences.english: Suicide rates have remained essentially unchanged.
sentences.chinese: 自杀率基本上保持不变。

sentences.english: Essentially, we are talking about the cold war period.
sentences.chinese: 我们基本上是在谈论冷战时期。

detailed_translations.english: used when stating the most basic facts about something

name: establish
trans: 建立, 树立, 确立, 设立 (verb.)

sentences.english: He’d already begun to establish quite a reputation as a journalist.
sentences.chinese: 身为记者，他已经声名鹊起。

sentences.english: He had three years in which to establish himself as Prime Minister.
sentences.chinese: 他有三年时间来确立自己首相的地位。

detailed_translations.english: to make people accept that you can do something, or that you have a particular quality

name: establishment
trans: 建立, 成立, 确立, 设立 (noun.)

sentences.english: the establishment of NATO in 1949
sentences.chinese: 1949年北约组织的建立

detailed_translations.english: the act of starting an organization, relationship, or system

name: estate
trans: 恏, 地产, 遗产, 房地产 (noun.)

sentences.english: a country estate
sentences.chinese: 乡村的庄园

detailed_translations.chinese: 土地， 住宅区， 地产； 财产， 遗产； 庄园， 种植园
detailed_translations.english: a large area of land in the country, usually with one large house on it and one owner

name: estimate
trans: 估计, 估算, 评估, 预估 (noun.)

sentences.english: Try to estimate how many steps it will take to get to a close object.
sentences.chinese: 估计一下需要多少步才能到达一个近距目标。

detailed_translations.english: to try to judge the value, size, speed, cost etc of something, without calculating it exactly

detailed_translations.chinese: 估计； 评价； 看法
detailed_translations.english: a calculation of the value, size, amount etc of something made using the information that you have, which may not be complete

name: ethnic
trans: 民族, 种族, 少数民族, 族群 (adj.)

sentences.english: The school teaches pupils from different ethnic groups.
sentences.chinese: 该校教授不同种族的小学生。

sentences.english: ethnic Russians in Estonia
sentences.chinese: 居住在爱沙尼亚的俄罗斯人

sentences.english: plans to partition the republic along ethnic lines
sentences.chinese: 按种族分割该共和国的计划

detailed_translations.english: relating to a particular race, nation, or tribe and their customs and traditions

name: even
trans: 甚至, 即使, 即便, 连 (adv.)

sentences.english: Most companies have suffered a drop in their profits, even very large companies.
sentences.chinese: 大多数公司的利润都出现下滑，甚至连很大的公司也不例外。

sentences.english: It was quite difficult to see, even with the light on.
sentences.chinese: 这很难看得见，即使开着灯也没有用。

sentences.english: He became quite successful and even appeared on a television show once.
sentences.chinese: 他相当成功，甚至还上了一次电视节目。

sentences.english: She did not even bother to phone us.
sentences.chinese: 她甚至连电话都没打给我们。

sentences.english: He never even acknowledged my letter.
sentences.chinese: 他收到我的信甚至从不会告知一声。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize something that is unexpected or surprising in what you are saying

name: evening
trans: 晚上, 傍晚, 晚间, 夜晚 (noun.)

sentences.english: I do most of my studying in the evening.
sentences.chinese: 我学习大都在晚上。

sentences.english: I’m usually out on Friday evenings.
sentences.chinese: 周五晚上我通常都不在家。

sentences.english: What are you doing tomorrow evening?
sentences.chinese: 明天晚上你打算做什么？

sentences.english: Peter left yesterday evening.
sentences.chinese: 彼得昨天晚上走了。

sentences.english: I’ll see you this evening.
sentences.chinese: 我今晚和你见面。

sentences.english: It was early evening by the time we got home.
sentences.chinese: 我们到家时已经是傍晚了。

sentences.english: We had just finished our evening meal when the doorbell rang.
sentences.chinese: 我们刚吃完晚饭门铃就响了。

sentences.english: a broadcast on the evening news
sentences.chinese: 晚间新闻广播

detailed_translations.english: the early part of the night between the end of the day and the time you go to bed

name: event
trans: 事件, 活动, 盛会, 赛事 (noun.)

sentences.english: one of the most important events in the history of mankind
sentences.chinese: 人类历史上最重大的事件之一

detailed_translations.english: something that happens, especially something important, interesting or unusual

name: eventually
trans: 最终, 最后, 终究, 终于 (adv.)

sentences.english: He eventually escaped and made his way back to England.
sentences.chinese: 他终于逃脱并返回英格兰。

sentences.english: Eventually, she got a job and moved to London.
sentences.chinese: 最终，她找到了工作并移居伦敦。

detailed_translations.english: after a long time, or after a lot of things have happened

name: ever
trans: 以往任何时候都, 曾经, 过, 永远 (adv.)

sentences.english: Nothing ever seems to upset him.
sentences.chinese: 似乎从来没有什么事情会使他烦恼。

sentences.english: Have you ever been to Paris?
sentences.chinese: 你去过巴黎吗？

sentences.english: I don’t think I’ve ever been here before.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得我以前从未到过这里。

sentences.english: It was raining harder than ever.
sentences.chinese: 当时下着前所未有的大雨。

detailed_translations.english: used in negative sentences and questions, or sentences with if to mean ‘at any time’

name: every
trans: 每, 每个, 每一 (det.)

sentences.english: His every utterance will be scrutinized.
sentences.chinese: 他说的每句话都会被细查。

sentences.english: She knows every student in the school.
sentences.chinese: 她认识学校里的每一个学生。

sentences.english: The buses go every 10 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 公共汽车每隔10分钟发一班车。

detailed_translations.english: used with singular nouns to refer to all the members of a group of things or people

name: everybody
trans: 每个人都, 大家, 每个人, 人人都 (noun.)

sentences.english: Everybody knows Tom.
sentences.chinese: 人人都认识汤姆。

detailed_translations.english: everyone

name: everyone
trans: 每个人都, 每个人, 大家, 人人都 (noun.)

sentences.english: If everyone is ready, I’ll begin.
sentences.chinese: 如果大家都准备好了，我就开始。

sentences.english: Send my best wishes to everyone in the family.
sentences.chinese: 请向全家人致以最美好的祝愿。

sentences.english: Of course everyone else thought it was hilarious!
sentences.chinese: 当然其他所有人都觉得好笑极了！

sentences.english: Not everyone enjoys sport.
sentences.chinese: 并不是谁都喜欢体育运动的。

detailed_translations.english: every person

name: everything
trans: 一切, 每件事, 所有, 万物 (noun.)

sentences.english: Everything was covered in a thick layer of dust.
sentences.chinese: 所有东西上面都蒙着厚厚一层灰。

sentences.english: I decided to tell her everything.
sentences.chinese: 我决定把一切都告诉她。

sentences.english: Apart from the bus arriving late, everything else seemed to be going according to plan.
sentences.chinese: 除了公共汽车晚点之外，其他一切似乎都在按计划进行。

detailed_translations.english: each thing or all things

name: everywhere
trans: 到处, 无处不在, 处处, 随处可见 (adv.)

sentences.english: I’ve looked everywhere but I can’t find the map.
sentences.chinese: 我到处都找过了，但就是找不到地图。

sentences.english: He’s travelled everywhere in Europe.
sentences.chinese: 他走遍了欧洲各地。

sentences.english: The south should remain dry, but everywhere else will have heavy rain.
sentences.chinese: 南部持续干旱，但其他地区会下暴雨。

detailed_translations.english: in or to every place

name: evidence
trans: 证据, 证物, 证据证明, 证供 (noun.)

sentences.english: We found further scientific evidence for this theory.
sentences.chinese: 我们找到了进一步证实这种理论的科学根据。

sentences.english: I was asked to give evidence (= to say what I knew, describe what I had seen, etc.)
sentences.chinese: 我被要求出庭作证。

detailed_translations.english: facts or signs that show clearly that something exists or is true

name: evil
trans: 邪恶, 恶, 邪, 恶魔 (adj.); 罪恶, 善恶, 坏事 (noun.)

sentences.english: She wanted to protect her children from the evils of the outside world.
sentences.chinese: 她想保护她的孩子不受外界的不良影响。

sentences.english: Poverty is one of the greatest social evils of our time.
sentences.chinese: 贫困是当代最大的社会弊端之一。

sentences.english: the evils of capitalism
sentences.chinese: 资本主义的种种祸害

sentences.english: There is too much evil in the world.
sentences.chinese: 世上的罪恶太多。

sentences.english: an evil dictator responsible for the deaths of millions
sentences.chinese: 对数百万人之死负责的邪恶独裁者

detailed_translations.english: something that is very bad or harmful
someone who is evil deliberately does very cruel things to harm other people

name: exact
trans: 确切, 精确, 准确, 具体 (adj.)

sentences.english: Police are still investigating the exact cause of the accident.
sentences.chinese: 警方还在调查这起事故的确切原因。

sentences.english: What were his exact words?
sentences.chinese: 他的原话是什么？

sentences.english: The timing had to be exact.
sentences.chinese: 对时机的把握必须精确。

sentences.english: Some concepts in Chinese medicine have no exact equivalent in Western medicine.
sentences.chinese: 中医的一些概念在西医中没有完全一样的对应观念。

detailed_translations.english: completely correct in every detail
to demand and get something from someone by using threats, force etc

name: exactly
trans: 完全, 到底, 确切, 究竟 (adv.)

sentences.english: It’s exactly half past five.
sentences.chinese: 一分不差，正好5点半。

sentences.english: The figures may not be exactly right, but they’re close enough.
sentences.chinese: 那些数字可能不是非常精确，但也相当接近。

sentences.english: That’s exactly what we’ve been trying to tell you.
sentences.chinese: 那正是我们一直想告诉你的。

detailed_translations.english: used when emphasizing that something is no more and no less than a number or amount, or is completely correct in every detail

name: exam
trans: 考试, 及格, 考, 考试及格 (noun.)

sentences.english: At the end of each level, there’s an exam.
sentences.chinese: 在每一级别结束时都有一次考试。

sentences.english: How did you do in your exams?
sentences.chinese: 你考试考得怎么样？

sentences.english: an eye exam
sentences.chinese: 眼睛检查

detailed_translations.english: a spoken or written test of knowledge, especially an important one

name: examination
trans: 考试, 检查, 检验, 考核 (noun.)

sentences.english: The examination results will be announced in September.
sentences.chinese: 考试成绩将于9月公布。

sentences.english: He’s already taken the entrance examination.
sentences.chinese: 他已经参加了入学考试。

sentences.english: The proposals are still under examination.
sentences.chinese: 那些提案还在审查之中。

detailed_translations.english: a spoken or written test of knowledge, especially an important one

name: examine
trans: 检查, 审视, 审查, 检验 (verb.)

sentences.english: A team of divers was sent down to examine the wreck.
sentences.chinese: 一组潜水员被送到水下检查沉船。

sentences.english: Hegel’s philosophy will be examined in detail in Chapter 4.
sentences.chinese: 黑格尔的哲学将在第4章作详细探讨。

detailed_translations.english: to look at something carefully and thoroughly because you want to find out more about it

name: example
trans: 例子, 示例, 例, 榜样 (noun.)

sentences.english: Many countries, for example Mexico and Japan, have a lot of earthquakes.
sentences.chinese: 许多国家，例如墨西哥和日本，经常发生地震。

sentences.english: Her courage is an example to us all.
sentences.chinese: 她的勇气是我们大家的榜样。

detailed_translations.english: something such as an object, a fact or a situation that shows, explains or supports what you say

name: excellent
trans: 优秀, 优良, 优异, 出色 (adj.)

sentences.english: an excellent suggestion
sentences.chinese: 极好的建议

sentences.english: His car is in excellent condition.
sentences.chinese: 他的汽车状况极佳。

sentences.english: Second-hand computers can be excellent value.
sentences.chinese: 二手计算机买得好会非常合算。

detailed_translations.english: extremely good or of very high quality

name: except
trans: 除了, 除, 除外 (prep.)

sentences.english: They were all there except me.
sentences.chinese: 除了我以外他们都在那里。

sentences.english: We all went except him.
sentences.chinese: 除他以外， 我们都去了。

sentences.english: They all howled with laughter except me.
sentences.chinese: 除了我以外，他们全都哈哈大笑起来。

name: exception
trans: 例外, 异常, 除外, 除了 (noun.)

sentences.english: It’s been cold, but today’s an exception.
sentences.chinese: 天气一直寒冷，但今天是个例外。

sentences.english: The law applies to all EU countries; Britain is no exception.
sentences.chinese: 这项法律适用于所有欧盟国家，英国也不例外。

sentences.english: We don’t usually accept checks, but for you we’ll make an exception (= not include you in this rule ).
sentences.chinese: 我们一般不接受支票，但对你我们就破个例。

sentences.english: The spelling of this word is an interesting exception to the rule.
sentences.chinese: 这个单词的拼法是该规则一个有趣的例外。

sentences.english: Successful two-career couples are still the exception, not the rule (= used to emphasize that something is unusual ).
sentences.chinese: 夫妇俩都事业有成的仍不常见。

detailed_translations.english: something or someone that is not included in a general statement or does not follow a rule or pattern

name: exchange
trans: 交换, 交易所, 交流, 外汇 (noun.)

sentences.english: We exchange gifts at Christmas.
sentences.chinese: 我们在圣诞节时交换礼物。

sentences.english: It’s a place where people can chat and exchange ideas.
sentences.chinese: 在这个地方人们可以聊天和交流想法。

sentences.english: Four of my cassettes for your Madonna CD is a fair exchange.
sentences.chinese: 我用四盒磁带换你的麦当娜激光唱片很公平。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone something and receive the same kind of thing from them at the same time
the act of giving someone something and receiving something else from them

name: excitement
trans: 兴奋, 激动, 刺激, 兴奋之情 (noun.)

sentences.english: We were both new to the excitements of life in the big city.
sentences.chinese: 我们俩都是初次感受大城市多姿多彩的生活。

detailed_translations.chinese: 刺激， 激动， 兴奋； 令人兴奋的事， 刺激的因素
detailed_translations.english: the feeling of being excited

name: exciting
trans: 令人兴奋, 激动人心, 令人激动, 令人振奋 (adj.)

sentences.english: an exciting discovery
sentences.chinese: 激动人心的发现

sentences.english: ‘Julia and Paul are getting married!’ ‘Oh, how exciting!’
sentences.chinese: “朱莉娅和保罗要结婚了！”“啊，太让人兴奋了！”

sentences.english: I’ve got some very exciting news for you.
sentences.chinese: 我给你带来了一些很激动人心的消息。

sentences.english: Let’s do something exciting.
sentences.chinese: 我们来做些让人振奋的事情吧。

sentences.english: Melanie finds her work exciting and rewarding.
sentences.chinese: 梅拉妮觉得自己的工作既刺激又有意义。

detailed_translations.english: making you feel excited

name: exclude
trans: 排除, 排斥, 排除在外 (verb.)

sentences.english: a special diet that excludes dairy products
sentences.chinese: 不包含奶制品的特别食谱

sentences.english: The judges decided to exclude evidence which had been unfairly attained.
sentences.chinese: 法官裁决不接纳以不正当手段获取的证据。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately not include something

name: excuse
trans: 借口, 藉口, 辩解, 理由 (noun.); 原谅, 请原谅 (verb.)

sentences.english: I’ll excuse you this time, but don’t be late again.
sentences.chinese: 这次我原谅你，但别再迟到了。

sentences.english: Please excuse my bad handwriting.
sentences.chinese: 请原谅，我的字写得不好。

sentences.english: Can I be excused from swimming today? I have a cold.
sentences.chinese: 我今天能不游泳吗？我感冒了。

detailed_translations.english: to forgive someone for doing something that is not seriously wrong, such as being rude or careless
a reason that you invent to explain an action and to hide your real intentions

name: executive
trans: 行政, 执行, 高管, 常务 (noun.)

sentences.english: a commission with executive powers
sentences.chinese: 有执行权的委员会

detailed_translations.english: relating to the job of managing a business or organization and making decisions
a group of people who are in charge of an organization and make the rules

name: exercise
trans: 锻炼, 运动, 行使, 练习 (noun.)

sentences.english: Try to fit some regular exercise into your daily routine.
sentences.chinese: 尽量在日常生活中安排一些经常性的锻炼。

sentences.english: Working in an office, I don’t get much exercise.
sentences.chinese: 由于在办公室工作，我很少运动。

sentences.english: role-play exercises
sentences.chinese: 角色扮演练习

sentences.english: Horses need to be exercised regularly.
sentences.chinese: 马需要有规律的训练。

detailed_translations.english: physical activities that you do in order to stay healthy and become stronger
to do sports or other physical activities in order to stay healthy or become stronger; to make an animal do this

name: exhibition
trans: 展览, 展览会, 展, 会展 (noun.)

sentences.english: All visitors to the exhibition must report to the main service desk.
sentences.chinese: 到展览会参观的人都必须先到总服务台报到。

sentences.english: Our country will tie up with another country to host this exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 我国将和另外一个国家联合主办这次展览会。

sentences.english: You go to the exhibition centre, I must hie myself to tell the new matters.
sentences.chinese: 你去展览中心吧，我得赶紧汇报一下这个新情况。

detailed_translations.english: a show of paintings, photographs, or other objects that people can go to see

name: exist
trans: 存在, 生存, 存活 (verb.)

sentences.english: The custom of arranged marriages still exists in many countries.
sentences.chinese: 许多国家仍存在包办婚姻的习俗。

sentences.english: Opportunities exist for students to gain sponsorship.
sentences.chinese: 学生有机会获得资助。

sentences.english: Stop pretending that the problem doesn’t exist.
sentences.chinese: 别再假装这个问题不存在了。

sentences.english: We existed on a diet of rice.
sentences.chinese: 我们靠吃大米过活。

detailed_translations.english: to be present in a place or situation

name: existence
trans: 存在, 生存 (noun.)

sentences.english: Scientists have many theories about how the universe first came into existence (= started to exist ).
sentences.chinese: 关于宇宙的起源，科学家有多种理论。

sentences.english: Pablo led a miserable existence when he first moved to San Juan.
sentences.chinese: 巴勃罗刚搬到圣胡安时，生活很悲惨。

detailed_translations.english: the state of existing

name: existing
trans: 现有, 现行, 存在, 现存 (verb.)

name: exit
trans: 退出, 出口, 出境, 出入境 (noun.)

sentences.english: We made for the nearest exit.
sentences.chinese: 我们走向最近的出口。

sentences.english: an exit door
sentences.chinese: 出口门

sentences.english: Two men were blocking her exit.
sentences.chinese: 两个男人挡住了她出去的路。

detailed_translations.english: a door or space through which you can leave a public room, building etc
to leave a place

name: expand
trans: 扩大, 拓展, 扩展, 扩张 (verb.)

sentences.english: Water expands as it freezes.
sentences.chinese: 水结冰时会膨胀。

sentences.english: Sydney’s population expanded rapidly in the 1960s.
sentences.chinese: 20世纪60年代，悉尼的人口迅速增加。

sentences.english: exercises that expand the chest muscles
sentences.chinese: 扩展胸肌的运动

sentences.english: his expanding waistline
sentences.chinese: 他那逐渐增大的腰围

detailed_translations.english: to become larger in size, number, or amount, or to make something become larger

name: expansion
trans: 扩张, 膨胀, 扩展, 扩建 (noun.)

sentences.english: The industry underwent a period of rapid expansion.
sentences.chinese: 该产业经历了一轮快速扩张。

detailed_translations.english: when something increases in size, range, amount etc

name: expect
trans: 期望, 指望, 期待, 预计 (verb.)

sentences.english: He will be hard to beat. I fully expect (= am completely sure about ) that and I’m ready.
sentences.chinese: 他很难击败。我确信这一点，不过我准备好了。

sentences.english: ‘Who are you?’ he murmured, only half expecting (= thinking it was possible, but not likely ) her to answer.
sentences.chinese: “你是谁？”他低声问道，预计她可能不会回答。

sentences.english: to expect a visit/call/letter from sb
sentences.chinese: 等待某人的来访 / 电话 / 来信

detailed_translations.english: to think that something will happen because it seems likely or has been planned

name: expectation
trans: 期望, 期待, 展望, 预期 (noun.)

sentences.english: Having raised expectations (= made people more hopeful ), he went on to help only a few people.
sentences.chinese: 他唤起了大家的希望，但接着只是帮助了几个人。

sentences.english: The show exceeded all expectations (= was much better than expected ).
sentences.chinese: 这场演出比人们预期的要好得多。

sentences.english: The number of people who attended fell short of expectations (= was lower than expected ).
sentences.chinese: 出席的人数比预期的要少。

detailed_translations.english: what you think or hope will happen

name: expenditure
trans: 开支, 支出, 费用, 经费 (noun.)

sentences.english: huge cuts in public expenditure
sentences.chinese: 大幅度削减公共开支

sentences.english: government expenditure on education
sentences.chinese: 政府的教育开支

sentences.english: {"GLOSS":["spending by a company on buildings, machinery, equipment etc"],"COLLOINEXA":["capital expenditure"]}
sentences.chinese: 〔公司的〕资本开支

detailed_translations.chinese: 经费， 支出额； 花费， 支出， 消耗
detailed_translations.english: the total amount of money that a government, organization, or person spends during a particular period of time

name: expense
trans: 费用, 牺牲, 支出, 开支 (noun.)

sentences.english: He borrowed £150,000 and used the money for legal expenses.
sentences.chinese: 他借了15万英镑用于支付律师费。

sentences.english: Conference rooms were equipped at great expense.
sentences.chinese: 装备会议室花费巨大。

detailed_translations.chinese: 花费， 消费， 费用； 开支， 业务费用
detailed_translations.english: the amount of money that you spend on something

name: expensive
trans: 昂贵, 贵, 贵重, 便宜 (adj.)

sentences.english: the most expensive restaurant in town
sentences.chinese: 城里最贵的餐馆

sentences.english: Petrol is becoming more and more expensive.
sentences.chinese: 汽油越来越贵了。

sentences.english: Photography is an expensive hobby.
sentences.chinese: 摄影是一项很花钱的业余爱好。

sentences.english: For low-income families, children’s safety equipment can be prohibitively expensive (= so expensive that most people cannot afford it ).
sentences.chinese: 对于低收入家庭来说，儿童的安全设备贵得让人望而却步。

sentences.english: Employing the wrong builder can be a horribly expensive mistake.
sentences.chinese: 用错建筑工人有时会是代价高昂的错误。

sentences.english: Her husband had expensive tastes (= liked expensive things ).
sentences.chinese: 她丈夫喜欢的东西都很贵。

detailed_translations.english: costing a lot of money

name: experience
trans: 经验, 体验, 经历, 体会 (noun.)

sentences.english: The advice in the booklet reflects the practical experience we have gained (= experience gained by actually doing something, rather than knowledge from books etc ).
sentences.chinese: 小册子中的建议反映了我们所获得的实践经验。

sentences.english: I had some experience in fashion design.
sentences.chinese: 我有一些时装设计方面的经验。

sentences.english: She was turned down on the grounds of lack of experience.
sentences.chinese: 她因缺乏经验而被拒绝。

sentences.english: The book is based on personal experience .
sentences.chinese: 本书是根据个人经历写成的。

detailed_translations.english: knowledge or skill that you gain from doing a job or activity, or the process of doing this

name: experienced
trans: 经验丰富, 支经验丰富, 资深, 经验 (adj.); 经历, 体验 (verb.)

sentences.english: an experienced pilot
sentences.chinese: 经验丰富的飞行员

sentences.english: an experienced public speaker
sentences.chinese: 老练的公开演讲者

sentences.english: She is experienced and self-assured.
sentences.chinese: 她经验丰富且充满自信。

detailed_translations.chinese: 老练的，熟练的；富有经验的
detailed_translations.english: possessing skills or knowledge because you have done something often or for a long time

name: experiment
trans: 实验, 试验, 尝试 (noun.)
