sentences.english: Is it possible to get tickets for the game?
sentences.chinese: 有没有可能弄到比赛的门票？

sentences.english: It might be possible for the documents to be sent over.
sentences.chinese: 这些文件也许可以发送过去。

sentences.english: Computer technology makes it possible for many people to work from home.
sentences.chinese: 计算机技术让很多人可以在家里工作。

sentences.english: I want to avoid the rush hour traffic if possible .
sentences.chinese: 如有可能我想避开交通高峰时间。

sentences.english: I walk or use public transport whenever possible .
sentences.chinese: 只要有可能我就步行或者乘坐公共交通工具。

sentences.english: We are doing everything possible to track down the killer.
sentences.chinese: 我们正竭尽全力追捕杀人凶手。

sentences.english: Our staff will help you in every way possible .
sentences.chinese: 我们的员工会尽力帮助你。

sentences.english: Even if it were technically possible , we do not have the money to do it.
sentences.chinese: 即使技术上可行，我们也没有钱去做。

sentences.english: She decided to stay as far away from him as was humanly possible .
sentences.chinese: 她决定尽可能离他远点。

detailed_translations.english: if something is possible, it can be done or achieved

name: possibly
trans: 可能 (adv.)

sentences.english: This last task is possibly the most difficult.
sentences.chinese: 这最后一项任务也许是最难的。

sentences.english: It will take three weeks, possibly longer.
sentences.chinese: 要花三个星期，也许更久。

sentences.english: ‘Will you be here tomorrow?’ ‘Possibly.’
sentences.chinese: “你明天到这儿来吗？”“也许吧。”

sentences.english: ‘Was it murder?’ ‘ Quite possibly (= it is very likely ) .’
sentences.chinese: “是谋杀吗？”“很可能是。”

detailed_translations.english: used when saying that something may be true or likely, although you are not completely certain

name: post
trans: 后, 邮政, 岗位, 帖子 (noun.); 张贴, 发布 (verb.)

sentences.english: a fence post
sentences.chinese: 篱笆桩

sentences.english: The exam results were posted on the bulletin board yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 考试成绩昨天在布告板上贴出来了。

detailed_translations.english: a strong upright piece of wood, metal etc that is fixed into the ground, especially to support something
to put up a public notice about something on a wall or notice board

name: post office
trans: 邮局 (noun.)

sentences.english: The hotel is opposite the post office.
sentences.chinese: 邮局的对过是旅馆。

sentences.english: Men in the post office classify mail according to places it is to go.
sentences.chinese: 邮局里的人员将信件按寄送地点分类。

detailed_translations.english: a place where you can buy stamps, send letters and packages etc

name: poster
trans: 海报, 张海报, 招贴, 招贴画 (noun.)

sentences.english: A team of volunteers were putting up posters .
sentences.chinese: 一队志愿者正在张贴海报。

sentences.english: a poster campaign for the election
sentences.chinese: 选举的海报宣传

detailed_translations.english: a large printed notice, picture, or photograph, used to advertise something or as a decoration

name: pot
trans: 锅, 壶, 大麻, 罐 (noun.)

sentences.english: pots and pans
sentences.chinese: 锅碗瓢盆

sentences.english: a pot of jam
sentences.chinese: 一罐果酱

detailed_translations.english: a deep round container used for cooking things in

name: potato
trans: 马铃薯, 土豆, 薯, 山芋 (noun.)

sentences.english: Marie stood at the sink, peeling potatoes (= cutting off the skin ) .
sentences.chinese: 玛丽站在洗涤槽边削土豆皮。

detailed_translations.chinese: [作物] 土豆，[作物] 马铃薯
detailed_translations.english: a round white vegetable with a brown, red, or pale yellow skin, that grows under the ground

name: potential
trans: 潜在, 可能 (adj.); 潜力, 电位, 潜能, 势 (noun.)

sentences.english: The company has identified 60 potential customers.
sentences.chinese: 该公司已确定了60位潜在的客户。

detailed_translations.english: likely to develop into a particular type of person or thing in the future
the possibility that something will develop in a particular way, or have a particular effect

name: pound
trans: 磅, 英镑, 镑, 磅重 (noun.)

sentences.english: They spent over a thousand pounds.
sentences.chinese: 他们花了一千多英镑。

sentences.english: a multi-million pound business
sentences.chinese: 一笔几百万英镑的生意

sentences.english: a five pound note
sentences.chinese: 五英镑的纸币

sentences.english: She pounded the corn kernels.
sentences.chinese: 她捣碎了玉米粒。

detailed_translations.chinese: 英镑；重击，重击声；兽栏；拘留所
detailed_translations.english: the standard unit of money in Britain, which is divided into 100 pence
If you pound something, you crush it into a paste or a powder or into very small pieces

name: pour
trans: 倒, 倒入, 倾吐, 倾泻 (verb.); 倾 (noun.)

sentences.english: She poured coffee for everyone.
sentences.chinese: 她为每个人都倒了咖啡。

detailed_translations.english: to make a liquid or other substance flow out of or into a container by holding it at an angle
if a lot of liquid or smoke pours out, it comes out from somewhere in very large amounts

name: poverty
trans: 贫困, 贫穷, 贫, 贫困人口 (noun.)

sentences.english: Millions of elderly people live in poverty .
sentences.chinese: 数百万老年人生活在贫困之中。

sentences.english: We need an effective strategy to fight poverty .
sentences.chinese: 我们需要制定一个有效的对策来与贫困作斗争。

sentences.english: continued efforts to alleviate poverty and raise living standards
sentences.chinese: 缓解贫困和提高生活水平的不懈努力

sentences.english: scenes of abject poverty
sentences.chinese: 极度贫困的情景

sentences.english: the causes of urban poverty
sentences.chinese: 造成城市贫困的原因

detailed_translations.english: the situation or experience of being poor

name: power
trans: 权力, 功率, 电力, 力量 (noun.)

sentences.english: It is not within my power (= I am unable or not in a position) to help you.
sentences.chinese: 我是爱莫能助啊。

sentences.english: The ship was helpless against the power of the storm.
sentences.chinese: 那艘船只能任凭强大的暴风雨肆虐。

sentences.english: The Secretary of State has the power to approve the proposals.
sentences.chinese: 国务卿有权批准这些提议。

sentences.english: 4 to the power of 3 is 4^3 (= 4 × 4 × 4 = 64).
sentences.chinese: 4的3次方是4^3。

detailed_translations.english: the ability or right to control people or events

name: powerful
trans: 强大, 有力, 强有力, 强力 (adj.)

sentences.english: He was one of the most powerful men in Bohemia.
sentences.chinese: 他是波希米亚最有权势的人物之一。

sentences.english: a very influential and powerful family
sentences.chinese: 很有权势的家庭

sentences.english: a powerful speech
sentences.chinese: 有感染力的演讲

detailed_translations.english: a powerful person, organization, group etc is able to control and influence events and other people’s actions

name: practical
trans: 实用, 实际, 实践, 切实可行 (adj.)

sentences.english: Candidates should have training and practical experience in basic electronics.
sentences.chinese: 应征者应该具备基础电子学方面的培训和实践经验。

sentences.english: the practical problems of old age
sentences.chinese: 老年的实际问题

sentences.english: They provide financial and practical help for disabled students.
sentences.chinese: 他们为残障学生提供经济上的援助以及实际的帮助。

sentences.english: a combination of theoretical and practical training
sentences.chinese: 理论培训和实践培训的结合

sentences.english: They haven’t thought about the practical consequences of the new regulations.
sentences.chinese: 他们没有考虑过新法规会产生什么实际后果。

sentences.english: In practical terms, this means spending more time with each student.
sentences.chinese: 具体地说，这意味着花更多的时间和每个学生在一起。

detailed_translations.english: relating to real situations and events rather than ideas, emotions etc

name: practically
trans: 几乎, 实际上, 切实, 差不多 (adv.)

sentences.english: I’ve read practically all of his books.
sentences.chinese: 我差不多读过他所有的书。

sentences.english: She sees him practically every day.
sentences.chinese: 她几乎天天见到他。

sentences.english: It’s practically impossible to predict what will happen.
sentences.chinese: 将会发生什么，几乎不能预料。

sentences.english: The two designs were practically identical.
sentences.chinese: 这两个设计几乎一模一样。

detailed_translations.english: almost

name: practice
trans: 实践, 练习, 做法, 实习 (noun.)

sentences.english: religious beliefs and practices
sentences.chinese: 宗教信仰和习俗

sentences.english: dangerous working practices
sentences.chinese: 危险的工作方法

detailed_translations.english: something that people do often, especially a particular way of doing something or a social or religious custom

name: practise
trans: 练习, 执业, 练 (verb.); 实践, 实习 (noun.)

sentences.english: They moved the furniture back to practise their dance routine.
sentences.chinese: 他们把家具往后挪以便练习舞蹈动作。

sentences.english: It gives students the opportunity to practice their speaking skills.
sentences.chinese: 这给学生提供了锻炼口才的机会。

detailed_translations.english: to do an activity, often regularly, in order to improve your skill or to prepare for a test

name: praise
trans: 赞美, 好评, 赞誉, 赞扬 (noun.)

sentences.english: It’s important to give children plenty of praise and encouragement.
sentences.chinese: 对小孩子多加表扬和鼓励是很重要的。

sentences.english: Her teacher was full of praise for her work.
sentences.chinese: 老师对她的作业赞不绝口。

sentences.english: His first novel received high praise .
sentences.chinese: 他的第一部小说受到了高度赞扬。

sentences.english: Gregory was singled out (= he was chosen in particular ) for special praise .
sentences.chinese: 格雷戈里被单独给予特别表扬。

sentences.english: The film has won praise from audiences and critics alike.
sentences.chinese: 那部电影赢得了观众和评论家的一致赞誉。

sentences.english: Jane was praised by her teacher.
sentences.chinese: 文例句：简受到了老师的表扬。

detailed_translations.english: words that you say or write in order to praise someone or something
to say that you admire and approve of someone or something, especially publicly

name: pray
trans: 祈祷, 祷告, 祈求, 求 (verb.)

sentences.english: They went to the mosque to pray.
sentences.chinese: 他们去清真寺祷告。

detailed_translations.english: to speak to God in order to ask for help or give thanks

name: prayer
trans: 祈祷, 祷告, 祷文, 祷 (noun.)

sentences.english: Our thoughts and prayers are with you at this difficult time.
sentences.chinese: 在这艰难时期我们时刻思念你，为你祈祷。

sentences.english: The children said their prayers and got into bed.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们做完祷告后上床睡觉了。

sentences.english: God has answered your prayer .
sentences.chinese: 上帝应许了你的祷告。

sentences.english: the power of prayer
sentences.chinese: 祈祷的力量

detailed_translations.english: words that you say when praying to God or gods

name: precise
trans: 精确, 精密, 准确, 确切 (adj.)

sentences.english: precise sales figures
sentences.chinese: 准确的销售数据

sentences.english: It was difficult to get precise information.
sentences.chinese: 很难得到确切的消息。

sentences.english: ‘She’s a lot older than you, isn’t she?’ ‘Fifteen years, to be precise .’
sentences.chinese: “她比你大很多，是不是？”“准确地说，大了15岁。”

detailed_translations.chinese: 精确的， 准确的； 严谨的
detailed_translations.english: precise information, details etc are exact, clear, and correct

name: precisely
trans: 恰恰, 精确, 正是, 准确 (adv.)

sentences.english: Women in these jobs are paid less precisely because most of the jobs are held by women rather than men.
sentences.chinese: 从事这些工作的女性报酬之所以较低正是因为做这些工作的人大部分是女性而不是男性。

sentences.english: She’s precisely the kind of person we’re looking for.
sentences.chinese: 她正是我们要找的那种人。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that a particular thing is completely true or correct

name: predict
trans: 预测, 预知, 预言, 预计 (verb.)

sentences.english: Sales were five percent lower than predicted.
sentences.chinese: 销售额比预期低5%。

sentences.english: As Liz had predicted , the rumours were soon forgotten.
sentences.chinese: 正如利兹所预料的，流言很快就被淡忘了。

detailed_translations.english: to say that something will happen, before it happens

name: prefer
trans: 宁愿, 喜欢, 偏爱, 宁可 (verb.)

sentences.english: She prefers her coffee black.
sentences.chinese: 她更喜欢喝黑咖啡。

detailed_translations.english: to like someone or something more than someone or something else, so that you would choose it if you could

name: preference
trans: 偏好, 偏爱, 首选项, 喜好 (noun.)

sentences.english: Do you have a colour preference ?
sentences.chinese: 你有什么颜色上的偏好吗？

sentences.english: Parents may be able to express a preference as to the school their child will attend.
sentences.chinese: 家长也许可以表明愿意让孩子就读哪所学校。

sentences.english: The amount of sugar you add will depend on personal preference .
sentences.chinese: 加多少糖取决于个人的喜好。

sentences.english: Many elderly people expressed a strong preference to live in their own homes.
sentences.chinese: 许多老年人强烈表示喜欢住在自己的家里。

sentences.english: In allocating housing, preference is given to families with young children.
sentences.chinese: 房屋优先分配给有年幼孩子的家庭。

detailed_translations.english: if you have a preference for something, you like it more than another thing and will choose it if you can

name: pregnant
trans: 怀孕, 孕, 身孕, 孕妇 (adj.)

sentences.english: care for pregnant women
sentences.chinese: 孕妇保健

sentences.english: I knew right away that I was pregnant.
sentences.chinese: 我立即明白我怀孕了。

sentences.english: I thought I was too old to get pregnant .
sentences.chinese: 我觉得自己年龄太大，已经不能怀孕了。

sentences.english: I didn’t mean to get her pregnant (= make her pregnant ) .
sentences.chinese: 我没想让她怀孕。

sentences.english: His wife was heavily pregnant (= almost ready to give birth ) .
sentences.chinese: 他的妻子即将临产。

detailed_translations.english: if a woman or female animal is pregnant, she has an unborn baby growing inside her body

name: premise
trans: 前提, 前提下, 大前提下, 大前提 (noun.)

sentences.english: Schools may earn extra money by renting out their premises.
sentences.chinese: 学校通过出租房屋场地可以获取额外收入。

sentences.english: business premises
sentences.chinese: 企业经营场所

detailed_translations.chinese: 房屋和地基， 经营场址； 前提， 假设
detailed_translations.english: the buildings and land that a shop, restaurant, company etc uses

name: preparation
trans: 制备, 准备, 制剂, 研制 (noun.)

sentences.english: This dish is good for dinner parties because much of the preparation can be done ahead of time.
sentences.chinese: 这道菜适合宴会，因为很多准备工作可以事先做好。

sentences.english: Plans for the new school are now in preparation .
sentences.chinese: 新学校的设计图正在绘制中。

sentences.english: a course in food service and food preparation
sentences.chinese: 餐饮服务和备菜课程

detailed_translations.english: the process of preparing something or preparing for something

name: prepare
trans: 准备, 预备, 做好准备, 制备 (verb.)

sentences.english: The prosecution wanted more time to prepare their case.
sentences.chinese: 原告想要有更多的时间来准备诉讼。

detailed_translations.english: to make plans or arrangements for something that will happen in the future

name: prepared
trans: 准备, 制备, 拟备, 做好准备 (verb.)

name: presence
trans: 存在, 在场, 面前, 光临 (noun.)

sentences.english: Your presence is requested at the club meeting on Friday.
sentences.chinese: 敬请出席于周五举行的俱乐部会议。

detailed_translations.english: when someone or something is present in a particular place

name: present
trans: 礼物 (noun.); 目前, 当前, 现行, 现在 (adj.); 呈现, 提出 (verb.)

sentences.english: She was presented with an award .
sentences.chinese: 她被授予一个奖项。

detailed_translations.english: to give something to someone, for example at a formal or official occasion

name: presentation
trans: 演示文稿, 演示, 演讲, 陈述 (noun.)

sentences.english: the presentation ceremony
sentences.chinese: 颁奖仪式

sentences.english: Dr Evans thanked him for coming to make the presentations .
sentences.chinese: 埃文斯博士感谢他来颁奖。

detailed_translations.chinese: 提供， 显示； 外观， 图像； 授予， 赠送； 报告， 介绍； 表演
detailed_translations.english: the act of giving someone a prize or present at a formal ceremony

name: preserve
trans: 保存, 保留, 保持, 保护 (verb.); 保护区 (noun.)

sentences.english: We must encourage the planting of new trees and preserve our existing woodlands.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须鼓励栽种新树木，同时也要保护现有的林地。

detailed_translations.english: to save something or someone from being harmed or destroyed

name: president
trans: 总统, 主席, 总裁, 国家主席 (noun.)

sentences.english: President Bush
sentences.chinese: 布什总统

sentences.english: the president of General Motors
sentences.chinese: 通用汽车公司总裁

detailed_translations.chinese: 总统；（某组织的）最高权力人
detailed_translations.english: the official leader of a country that does not have a king or queen

name: press
trans: 按 (verb.); 出版社, 新闻, 新闻界, 媒体 (noun.)

sentences.english: Oxford University Press
sentences.chinese: 牛津大学出版社

sentences.english: We were able to watch the books rolling off the presses.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以看到书本从印刷机上源源不断地印出。

detailed_translations.english: a business that prints and publishes books

name: pressure
trans: 压力, 压, 气压, 压强 (noun.)

sentences.english: They are putting pressure on people to vote yes.
sentences.chinese: 他们正在向民众施加压力，要求他们投赞成票。

sentences.english: You must never give in to pressure .
sentences.chinese: 你绝不能屈从压力。

detailed_translations.english: an attempt to persuade someone by using influence, arguments, or threats

detailed_translations.chinese: 对…施加压力， 迫使， 说服
detailed_translations.english: to try to make someone do something by making them feel it is their duty to do it

name: presumably
trans: 想必, 据推测, 大概, 推测 (adv.)

sentences.english: It’s raining, which presumably means that your football match will be cancelled.
sentences.chinese: 下雨了，这可能意味着你们的足球比赛要取消。

detailed_translations.chinese: 大概， 可能， 据推测
detailed_translations.english: used to say that you think something is probably true

name: presume
trans: 推定, 冒昧, 相信, 推测 (verb.)

sentences.english: They're resentful that outsiders presume to meddle in their affairs.
sentences.chinese: 他们对外人擅自干预他们的事务怨恨不已。

sentences.english: I presume you're here on business.
sentences.chinese: 我想你是来这儿出差的吧。

sentences.english: "Had he been home all week?"—"I presume so."
sentences.chinese: “他整个星期都在家吗？”—“我想是。”

detailed_translations.english: If you say that someone presumes to do something, you mean that they do it even though they have no right to do it

detailed_translations.chinese: 推测，假定，相信；冒昧，擅自；认定，推定
detailed_translations.english: If you presume that something is the case, you think that it is the case, although you are not certain

name: pretend
trans: 假装, 装作, 装, 伪装 (verb.); 假扮 (adj.)

sentences.english: Let’s pretend we’re on the moon.
sentences.chinese: 我们假装自己是在月球上吧。

sentences.english: He’s not asleep – he’s just pretending.
sentences.chinese: 他并没睡着，不过是装睡而已。

sentences.english: To pretend ignorance of the situation would be irresponsible.
sentences.chinese: 装作不知情是不负责任的做法。

sentences.english: I can’t marry her and to pretend otherwise would be wrong.
sentences.chinese: 我不可以娶她，装作娶她无妨是不对的。

detailed_translations.english: to behave as if something is true when in fact you know it is not, in order to deceive people or for fun
imaginary or not real - used especially by children

name: pretty
trans: 漂亮, 相当, 很, 非常 (adv.)

sentences.english: a pretty little girl
sentences.chinese: 漂亮的小姑娘

sentences.english: Maria looks much prettier with her hair cut short.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽亚把头发剪短好看多了。

detailed_translations.english: a woman or child who is pretty has a nice attractive face

name: prevent
trans: 防止, 预防, 阻止, 避免 (verb.)

sentences.english: The rules are intended to prevent accidents.
sentences.chinese: 这些规定旨在预防事故。

sentences.english: We were prevented from entering the site.
sentences.chinese: 我们被阻止进入现场。

sentences.english: Wrap small ornaments in paper to prevent them being damaged.
sentences.chinese: 把小饰品用纸包上以免损坏。

detailed_translations.english: to stop something from happening, or stop someone from doing something

name: previous
trans: 先前, 以前, 以往, 前面 (adj.)

sentences.english: She has a teenage daughter from a previous marriage.
sentences.chinese: 她有个出自前一次婚姻的十几岁的女儿。

detailed_translations.english: A previous event or thing is one that happened or existed before the one that you are talking about

name: previously
trans: 先前, 以前, 此前, 之前 (adv.)

sentences.english: Guyana's railways were previously owned by private companies.
sentences.chinese: 圭亚那的铁路先前为私营公司所拥有。

sentences.english: The contract was awarded to a previously unknown company.
sentences.chinese: 该合同给了一家先前不知名的公司。

detailed_translations.english: Previously means at some time before the period that you are talking about

name: price
trans: 价格, 价, 代价, 价钱 (noun.)

sentences.english: The price of fuel keeps going up.
sentences.chinese: 燃料价格持续上涨。

sentences.english: They may pay a high price for their few years of glory.
sentences.chinese: 为了短短几年的辉煌，他们也许要付出高昂的代价。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of money you have to pay for something

name: pride
trans: 骄傲, 自豪感, 自豪, 自尊心 (noun.)

sentences.english: He wore his medals with pride.
sentences.chinese: 他自豪地戴着奖章。

sentences.english: The people have a sense of pride in their community.
sentences.chinese: 人们对自己的社区有一种自豪感。

sentences.english: His heart swelled with pride when his daughter came in.
sentences.chinese: 女儿进来时他的内心充满了自豪感。

sentences.english: She felt a glow of pride when her name was announced for the prize.
sentences.chinese: 宣布她获奖时她感到非常自豪。

sentences.english: Success in sport is a source of national pride .
sentences.chinese: 体育方面的成就可以激发民族自豪感。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling that you are proud of something that you or someone connected with you has achieved
to be especially proud of something that you do well, or of a good quality that you have

name: priest
trans: 牧师, 神父, 祭司, 教士 (noun.)

sentences.english: He had trained to be a Catholic priest.
sentences.chinese: 他接受培训成了一名天主教神父。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is specially trained to perform religious duties and ceremonies in the Christian church

detailed_translations.chinese: 使成为神职人员；任命…为祭司

name: primarily
trans: 主要, 为主, 初步, 基本上 (adv.)

sentences.english: The advertisement is aimed primarily at children.
sentences.chinese: 这则广告的对象主要是儿童。

detailed_translations.english: mainly

name: primary
trans: 原发性, 初级, 主要, 首要 (adj.)

sentences.english: Our primary concern is to provide the refugees with food and health care.
sentences.chinese: 我们的头等大事是向难民提供食品和医疗。

sentences.english: Many of the villagers rely on fishing as their primary source of income.
sentences.chinese: 很多村民以打鱼作为他们的主要收入来源。

sentences.english: Personal safety is of primary importance .
sentences.chinese: 人身安全至关重要。

detailed_translations.chinese: 首要的， 主要的； 基本的； 最初的， 初级的
detailed_translations.english: most important

name: prince
trans: 王子, 亲王, 太子, 普林斯 (noun.)

sentences.english: Prince William
sentences.chinese: 威廉王子

sentences.english: Prince Rainier of Monaco
sentences.chinese: 摩纳哥的兰尼埃亲王

detailed_translations.english: the son of a king, queen, or prince

name: princess
trans: 公主, 王妃, 妃 (noun.)

sentences.english: Princess Anne
sentences.chinese: 安妮公主

sentences.english: the Princess of Wales
sentences.chinese: 威尔士王妃

detailed_translations.english: a close female relation of a king and queen, especially a daughter

name: principal
trans: 校长, 本金, 委托, 委托人 (noun.); 主, 主要, 主体, 首席 (adj.)

sentences.english: His principal reason for making the journey was to visit his family.
sentences.chinese: 他那次旅程的首要目的是探访家人。

sentences.english: Teaching is her principal source of income.
sentences.chinese: 教书是她主要的收入来源。

sentences.english: the principal character in the book
sentences.chinese: 书里的主人公

detailed_translations.english: most important

detailed_translations.chinese: 负责人， 校长； 资本， 本金； 主要演员， 主角
detailed_translations.english: someone who is in charge of a school

name: principle
trans: 原理, 原则, 原则上, 基本原理 (noun.)

sentences.english: Schools try to teach children a set of principles.
sentences.chinese: 学校设法教给孩子们一套道德准则。

sentences.english: He’s got no principles at all!
sentences.chinese: 他毫无道德准则！

sentences.english: It’s against my principles to accept gifts from clients.
sentences.chinese: 收受客户礼物违背我的原则。

detailed_translations.english: a moral rule or belief about what is right and wrong, that influences how you behave

name: print
trans: 打印, 印刷, 印刷品, 版画 (noun.); 列印, 印, 印制 (verb.)

sentences.english: Over five million copies of the paper are printed every day.
sentences.chinese: 这份报纸每日印量超过五百万。

sentences.english: When the book was first written no publisher would print it.
sentences.chinese: 这本书刚写成时没有出版商愿意出版。

sentences.english: There was no print at all on the backs of the tickets.
sentences.chinese: 门票背面没有印任何文字。

detailed_translations.english: to produce many printed copies of a book, newspaper etc
writing that has been printed, for example in books or newspapers

name: printer
trans: 打印机, 台打印机, 承印, 印刷机 (noun.)

sentences.english: a laser printer
sentences.chinese: 激光打印机

sentences.english: a colour printer
sentences.chinese: 彩色打印机

detailed_translations.chinese: [计] 打印机；印刷工；印花工
detailed_translations.english: a machine which is connected to a computer and can make a printed record of computer information

name: prior
trans: 事先, 先验, 先前, 预先 (adj.); 之前, 前, 在此之前 (adv.)

sentences.english: You do not need any prior knowledge of the subject.
sentences.chinese: 你无需事先具备该方面的知识。

sentences.english: Changes may not be made without the prior approval of the council.
sentences.chinese: 未经委员会事先同意，不得作出改变。

sentences.english: Vegetarian meals are provided by prior agreement.
sentences.chinese: 经事先协商可提供素食。

sentences.english: Some prior experience with the software is needed.
sentences.chinese: 要求事先熟悉这个软件。

detailed_translations.english: existing or arranged before something else or before the present situation

name: priority
trans: 优先, 优先级, 优先权, 优先考虑 (noun.)

sentences.english: The club’s priority is to win the League.
sentences.chinese: 该俱乐部首先考虑的是要赢得联赛。

sentences.english: After several burglaries in the area, security is now a high priority (= very important and needing attention soon ) .
sentences.chinese: 该地区发生了几宗入室盗窃案以后，治安成了当务之急。

sentences.english: With so little money available, repairs must remain a low priority (= not important and not needing attention soon ) .
sentences.chinese: 可用的钱这么少，只好暂时放下维修事宜了。

sentences.english: The customer is high on our list of priorities .
sentences.chinese: 顾客在我们的心目中排在第一位。

sentences.english: List your tasks in order of priority (= most important first ) .
sentences.chinese: 按照轻重缓急列出你的工作。

detailed_translations.english: the thing that you think is most important and that needs attention before anything else

name: prison
trans: 监狱, 狱, 坐牢, 监禁 (noun.)

sentences.english: He visits his dad in prison every week.
sentences.chinese: 他每周都去探望狱中的父亲。

sentences.english: Ricky has been out of prison for three years now.
sentences.chinese: 里基现已出狱三年。

sentences.english: They’ll probably put him in prison for a long time.
sentences.chinese: 他们很可能会让他在监狱里待很长时间。

sentences.english: Helen was sent to prison for attacking a man with a knife.
sentences.chinese: 海伦因持刀袭击一名男子而被送入监狱。

sentences.english: The two men were arrested only a week after they were released from prison .
sentences.chinese: 那两名男子从监狱获释后仅仅一周就被捕了。

sentences.english: Three terrorists escaped from Brixton Prison .
sentences.chinese: 有三名恐怖分子从布里克斯顿监狱越狱了。

sentences.english: an increase in the number of women going to prison
sentences.chinese: 入狱女性人数的增多

sentences.english: Mr Gunn received a ten year prison sentence .
sentences.chinese: 冈恩先生获刑十年。

detailed_translations.english: a building where people are kept as a punishment for a crime, or while they are waiting to go to court for their  trial

name: prisoner
trans: 囚犯, 犯人, 囚徒, 战俘 (noun.)

sentences.english: He was being held prisoner.
sentences.chinese: 他正遭囚禁。

sentences.english: Our pilot was taken prisoner .
sentences.chinese: 我们的飞行员被抓起来了。

sentences.english: The army advanced, taking 200,000 prisoners .
sentences.chinese: 军队向前推进，抓获20万名俘虏。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is taken by force and kept somewhere

name: private
trans: 私人, 私营, 民营, 私有 (adj.)

sentences.english: Morris has a private jet.
sentences.chinese: 莫里斯拥有一架私人喷气式飞机。

sentences.english: He made some notes for his private use.
sentences.chinese: 他记了些笔记供自己所用。

sentences.english: They objected to any form of private property .
sentences.chinese: 他们反对任何形式的私有财产。

detailed_translations.english: for use by one person or group, not for everyone

name: privilege
trans: 特权, 权限, 荣幸, 殊荣 (noun.)

sentences.english: He had no special privileges and was treated just like every other prisoner.
sentences.chinese: 他不享受特权，待遇和任何其他犯人一样。

detailed_translations.english: a special advantage that is given only to one person or group of people

name: prize
trans: 奖, 奖品, 奖金, 奖项 (noun.); 珍视 (verb.)

sentences.english: In this month’s competition you could win a prize worth £3,000.
sentences.chinese: 在本月的竞赛中您可以赢得价值3,000英镑的奖品。

sentences.english: The first prize has gone to Dr John Gentle.
sentences.chinese: 获得一等奖的是约翰·金特尔博士。

sentences.english: The prizes are awarded (= given ) every year to students who have shown original thinking in their work.
sentences.chinese: 这些奖项每年颁发给在学习中表现出创造性思维的学生。

sentences.english: The total prize money was £30,000.
sentences.chinese: 奖金总额为3万英镑。

detailed_translations.english: something that is given to someone who is successful in a competition, race, game of chance etc
to think that someone or something is very important or valuable
good enough to win a prize or having won a prize

name: probably
trans: 可能, 大概, 也许, 或许 (adv.)

sentences.english: It'll probably be OK.
sentences.chinese: 这大概没有问题。

detailed_translations.english: used to say that sth is likely to happen or to be true

name: problem
trans: 问题, 难题, 题, 麻烦 (noun.)

sentences.english: She was older than me, but that wasn’t really a problem.
sentences.chinese: 她比我年长，不过那不算什么问题。

sentences.english: She gave us 20 mathematical problems to solve.
sentences.chinese: 她让我们解20道数学题。

detailed_translations.english: a situation that causes difficulties

name: procedure
trans: 程序, 过程, 议事, 流程 (noun.)

sentences.english: On board, we were given the usual talk on safety procedures (= what to do if an accident happens, or to prevent an accident ) .
sentences.chinese: 在飞机上，我们听了例行的飞行安全讲解。

detailed_translations.english: a way of doing something, especially the correct or usual way

name: proceed
trans: 进行, 继续, 着手 (verb.)

sentences.english: Before proceeding further, we must define our terms.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须先定义术语，然后再往下展开。

detailed_translations.english: to continue to do something that has already been planned or started

name: proceeding
trans: 此案, 跟进, 出发, 进行 (verb.); 诉讼 (noun.)

sentences.english: The proceedings of the inquiry will take place in private.
sentences.chinese: 调查行动将秘密进行。

detailed_translations.english: The proceedings are an organized series of events that take place in a particular place

name: process
trans: 过程, 工艺, 流程, 进程 (noun.)

sentences.english: the Israeli-Egyptian peace process
sentences.chinese: 以－埃和平进程

sentences.english: Recycling is an industrial process.
sentences.chinese: 回收利用是一个工业流程。

sentences.english: All university applications are processed through this system.
sentences.chinese: 所有大学入学申请都是由这个系统处理的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 过程，进程；；工序；工艺流程
detailed_translations.english: a series of actions that are done in order to achieve a particular result
to deal with an official document, request etc in the usual way

name: produce
trans: 产生, 生产, 出示, 生成 (verb.); 农产品 (noun.)

sentences.english: New drugs are producing remarkable results.
sentences.chinese: 新药正在产生显著的效果。

sentences.english: a rise in sea level produced by climatic change
sentences.chinese: 由气候变化引起的海平面升高

sentences.english: As a policy, it did not produce the desired effect.
sentences.chinese: 作为一项政策，它并未产生预期的效果。

sentences.english: a factory that produces microchips
sentences.chinese: 微芯片制造厂

sentences.english: He produced a letter from his pocket.
sentences.chinese: 他从口袋里掏出一封信来。

detailed_translations.english: to cause a particular result or effect

name: producer
trans: 生产者, 制片人, 制作人, 生产国 (noun.)

sentences.english: ...Saudi Arabia, the world's leading oil producer.
sentences.chinese: …沙特阿拉伯，世界上最重要的石油生产国。

sentences.english: Hollywood producers and movie stars
sentences.chinese: 好莱坞的制片人和影星

detailed_translations.english: a person, company, or country that makes or grows goods, foods, or materials

name: product
trans: 产品, 产物, 品, 制品 (noun.)

sentences.english: The London factory assembles the finished product .
sentences.chinese: 伦敦工厂组装成品。

sentences.english: He works in marketing and product development.
sentences.chinese: 他从事营销和产品开发。

sentences.english: Paula was the product of a sheltered middle-class home.
sentences.chinese: 葆拉是备受呵护的中产阶级家庭的产物。

sentences.english: The product of 21 and 16 is 336.

detailed_translations.english: something that is grown or made in a factory in large quantities, usually in order to be sold

name: production
trans: 生产, 制作, 产量, 产 (noun.)

sentences.english: That model won't go into production before late 2007.
sentences.chinese: 那种型号要到2007年底才会投入生产。

sentences.english: a drop in oil and gas production
sentences.chinese: 石油和天然气产量的下降

detailed_translations.english: the process of making or growing things to be sold, especially in large quantities

name: profession
trans: 职业, 行业, 专业, 界 (noun.)

sentences.english: people who work in the professions
sentences.chinese: 从事专业性工作的人

sentences.english: nurses, social workers, and other people in the caring professions
sentences.chinese: 护士、社工和其他从事护理行业的人

detailed_translations.english: a job that needs a high level of education and training

name: professional
trans: 专业, 职业, 专业化, 专业人士 (adj.)

sentences.english: What professional qualifications does he have?
sentences.chinese: 他有哪些专业资格？

sentences.english: You may need to seek professional help.
sentences.chinese: 你可能需要寻求专业帮助。

sentences.english: the terms that doctors and other health professionals use
sentences.chinese: 医师和其他保健专业人员使用的术语

detailed_translations.english: relating to a job that needs special education and training
someone who works in a job that needs special education and training, such as a doctor, lawyer, or architect

name: professor
trans: 教授 (noun.)

sentences.english: The professor improvised a poem in the class.
sentences.chinese: 教授在课堂上即兴创作了一首诗。

sentences.english: The professor lambasted me for my careless mistake.
sentences.chinese: 教授严厉批评了我的粗心错误。

sentences.english: We were laughing about that absent-minded professor.
sentences.chinese: 我们都在笑那个心不在焉的教授。

name: profile
trans: 配置文件, 剖面, 概要文件, 轮廓 (noun.)

sentences.english: Dani has a lovely profile.
sentences.chinese: 达尼的侧面轮廓很好看。

detailed_translations.chinese: 侧面；人物简介；轮廓，形象；姿态，引人注目的状态
detailed_translations.english: a side view of someone’s head
to write or give a short description of someone or something

name: profit
trans: 利润, 营利, 盈利, 营利性 (noun.)

sentences.english: The shop’s daily profit is usually around $500.
sentences.chinese: 这家商店每天的利润一般在500美元左右。

sentences.english: She sold the business and bought a farm with the profits.
sentences.chinese: 她卖了公司，用所得利润买下了一座农场。

sentences.english: They sold their house at a healthy profit.
sentences.chinese: 他们卖掉房子，赚了一大笔钱。

sentences.english: There’s no profit in letting meetings drag on.
sentences.chinese: 会议拖拖拉拉没什么好处。

detailed_translations.english: money that you gain by selling things or doing business, after your costs have been paid
to get money from doing something

name: program
trans: 程序, 节目, 计划, 方案 (noun.)

sentences.english: Any large high-speed computer can be programmed to learn.
sentences.chinese: 任何大型高速计算机都可以通过编程获得学习能力。

detailed_translations.english: to give a computer a set of instructions that it can use to perform a particular operation

name: programme
trans: 计划, 方案, 节目, 纲领 (noun.)

sentences.english: the US space program
sentences.chinese: 美国太空计划

detailed_translations.english: a series of actions which are designed to achieve something important

name: progress
trans: 进展, 进步, 进度, 进程 (noun.)

sentences.english: The police are disappointed by the slow pro-gress of the investigation.
sentences.chinese: 警方对调查进度缓慢感到失望。

sentences.english: We made good progress despite the snow.
sentences.chinese: 尽管下雪，我们的行程还是很顺利。

sentences.english: I asked the nurse how my son was progressing.
sentences.chinese: 我询问护士我儿子身体恢复得如何。

detailed_translations.english: the process of getting better at doing something, or getting closer to finishing or achieving something
to improve, develop, or achieve things so that you are then at a more advanced stage

name: project
trans: 项目, 工程, 工程项目, 专案 (noun.)

sentences.english: The project aims to provide an analysis of children’s emotions.
sentences.chinese: 该计划旨在对儿童情绪作出分析。

sentences.english: a three-year research project
sentences.chinese: 一项为期三年的研究计划

sentences.english: The scheme will now be extended after a successful pilot project (= a small trial to test if an idea will be successful ) .
sentences.chinese: 试行成功后，该方案现在将得到推广。

sentences.english: The project is funded by Wellcome plc.
sentences.chinese: 这个项目由威康公司资助。

sentences.english: a project manager
sentences.chinese: 项目经理

sentences.english: a geography project
sentences.chinese: 一个地理课题

detailed_translations.english: a carefully planned piece of work to get information about something, to build something, to improve something etc

name: promise
trans: 承诺, 诺言, 许诺, 应许 (noun.); 答应, 保证, 发誓 (verb.)

sentences.english: If you make a promise, you should keep it.
sentences.chinese: 如果你许下一个诺言，你就应该遵守它。

sentences.english: Last night the headmaster promised a full investigation.
sentences.chinese: 校长昨晚允诺进行全面调查。

detailed_translations.english: a statement that you will definitely do or provide something or that something will definitely happen
to tell someone that you will definitely do or provide something or that something will happen

name: promote
trans: 促进, 推动, 推广, 推进 (verb.)

sentences.english: You don't have to sacrifice environmental protection to promote economic growth.
sentences.chinese: 你们没有必要牺牲环保来促进经济增长。

detailed_translations.english: If people promote something, they help or encourage it to happen, increase, or spread

name: promotion
trans: 推广, 晋升, 促进, 促销 (noun.)

sentences.english: a society for the promotion of religious tolerance
sentences.chinese: 一个促进宗教包容的团体

sentences.english: I want a job with good prospects for promotion.
sentences.chinese: 我想要一份有良好晋升机会的工作。

detailed_translations.english: the activity of helping something to develop or increase

name: prompt
trans: 提示, 提示符, 提示符下, 及时 (adj.); 促使 (verb.)

sentences.english: Prompt action must be taken.
sentences.chinese: 必须立即采取行动。

sentences.english: Prompt payment is requested.
sentences.chinese: 请立即付款。

sentences.english: a prompt response
sentences.chinese: 迅速的答复

sentences.english: What prompted you to buy that suit?
sentences.chinese: 什么原因让你买下了那套西装？

detailed_translations.english: done quickly, immediately, or at the right time
to make someone decide to do something

name: proof
trans: 证明, 证据, 举证, 论证 (noun.)

sentences.english: Their defences are proof against most weapons.
sentences.chinese: 他们的防卫工事可以抵挡大多数武器的攻击。

detailed_translations.english: facts, information, documents etc that prove something is true

name: proper
trans: 适当, 正确, 恰当, 合适 (adj.)

sentences.english: It is right and proper that parents take responsibility for their children's attendance at school.
sentences.chinese: 父母负责督促子女上学上课，这是天经地义的事。

sentences.english: He is always perfectly proper in his behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 他的行为举止向来是无可挑剔的。

detailed_translations.english: socially and morally acceptable

name: properly
trans: 妥善, 正确, 适当, 得当 (adv.)

sentences.english: The brakes don’t seem to be working properly.
sentences.chinese: 刹车似乎不正常。

sentences.english: Then he’s not doing his job properly.
sentences.chinese: 那么他没把分内事做好。

sentences.english: Parents should teach their children to behave properly in public.
sentences.chinese: 家长应该教导子女在公共场合要有规有矩。

sentences.english: properly trained staff
sentences.chinese: 训练有素的员工

detailed_translations.english: correctly, or in a way that is considered right

name: property
trans: 财产, 属性, 物业, 性能 (noun.)

sentences.english: The hotel is not responsible for any loss or damage to guests’ personal property .
sentences.chinese: 宾馆对住客个人财物的丢失和损坏概不负责。

sentences.english: Some of the stolen property was found in Mason’s house.
sentences.chinese: 在梅森家里找到了部分被盗财物。

detailed_translations.english: the thing or things that someone owns

name: proportion
trans: 比例, 比重, 所占比例, 配比 (noun.)

sentences.english: A large proportion of the dolphins in that area will eventually die.
sentences.chinese: 那个地区的很大一部分海豚最终都会死去。

sentences.english: What’s the proportion of boys to girls in your class?
sentences.chinese: 你们班里男女生的比例是多少？

detailed_translations.english: a part of a number or an amount, considered in relation to the whole

name: proposal
trans: 建议, 提案, 提议, 方案 (noun.)

sentences.english: The president is to put forward new proposals for resolving the country's constitutional crisis.
sentences.chinese: 总统将提出解决国家宪法危机的新议案。

sentences.english: She politely declined his proposal of marriage.
sentences.chinese: 她礼貌地拒绝了他的求婚。

detailed_translations.english: a plan or suggestion which is made formally to an official person or group, or the act of making it

name: propose
trans: 提出, 求婚, 建议, 提议 (verb.)

sentences.english: the changes currently proposed by the local planning authorities
sentences.chinese: 目前由地方规划局提议的改革

sentences.english: the proposed budget cuts
sentences.chinese: 所提出的预算削减

detailed_translations.english: to suggest something as a plan or course of action

name: proposed
trans: 提出, 拟议, 建议, 提议 (verb.)

name: prosecution
trans: 检控, 起诉, 检察机关, 提出检控 (noun.)

sentences.english: a criminal prosecution
sentences.chinese: 刑事诉讼

sentences.english: The evidence is not sufficient to bring a prosecution against him.
sentences.chinese: 现有证据不足以对他提出起诉。

detailed_translations.english: when a charge is made against someone for a crime, or when someone is judged for a crime in a court of law

name: prospect
trans: 前景, 展望, 前景展望, 前瞻 (noun.)

sentences.english: The prospect of marriage terrified Alice.
sentences.chinese: 想到要结婚，艾丽斯害怕极了。

sentences.english: I had no job, no education, and no prospects .
sentences.chinese: 我没有工作，没受过什么教育，前途渺茫。

detailed_translations.english: a particular event which will probably or definitely happen in the future – used especially when you want to talk about how you feel about it

name: protect
trans: 保护, 保障, 保卫, 守护 (verb.)

sentences.english: Are we doing enough to protect the environment?
sentences.chinese: 我们在保护环境方面做得够吗？

detailed_translations.english: to keep someone or something safe from harm, damage, or illness

name: protection
trans: 保护, 防护, 保障 (noun.)

sentences.english: the protection of the environment
sentences.chinese: 环境保护

detailed_translations.english: when someone or something is protected

name: protest
trans: 抗议, 抗议活动, 抗诉, 示威 (noun.)

sentences.english: ‘I don’t see why I should take the blame for this!’ she protested.
sentences.chinese: “我不明白为什么我要对此承担责任！”她抗议道。

detailed_translations.english: to come together to publicly express disapproval or opposition to something
something that you do to show publicly that you think that something is wrong and unfair, for example taking part in big public meetings, refusing to work, or refusing to buy a company’s products

name: proud
trans: 自豪, 骄傲, 引以为傲, 值得骄傲 (adj.)

sentences.english: a proud man who would not admit his mistakes
sentences.chinese: 自以为是、不愿认错的男子

sentences.english: Seth was the proud owner of a new sports car.
sentences.chinese: 赛思因为有了新跑车而扬扬得意。

detailed_translations.chinese: 骄傲的；自负的〔含贬义〕；自豪的
detailed_translations.english: thinking that you are more important, skilful etc than you really are – used to show disapproval

name: prove
trans: 证明, 证实, 验证, 论证 (verb.)

sentences.english: You’re wrong, and I can prove it.
sentences.chinese: 你错了，我可以证明。

sentences.english: To prove his point (= show that he was right ) , he mentioned several other experiments which had produced similar results.
sentences.chinese: 为了证明自己的观点，他提到了另外几个结果相似的实验。

detailed_translations.english: to show that something is true by providing facts, information etc

name: provide
trans: 提供, 为 (verb.)

sentences.english: Tea and biscuits will be provided.
sentences.chinese: 有茶水和饼干供应。

detailed_translations.english: to give something to someone or make it available to them, because they need it or want it

name: provided
trans: 提供, 规定, 只要, 设置 (verb.)

sentences.english: He can come with us, provided he pays for his own meals.
sentences.chinese: 只要他付自己的饭钱，就可以跟我们一起来。

name: providing
trans: 提供 (verb.)

name: provision
trans: 条文, 提供, 规定, 条款 (noun.)

sentences.english: The agreement includes a provision for each side to check the other side’s weapons.
sentences.chinese: 协议有项规定，允许双方互查武器。

sentences.english: Under the provisions of the Act, employers must supply safety equipment.
sentences.chinese: 该法令规定，雇主必须提供安全设备。

detailed_translations.english: a condition in an agreement or law

name: psychological
trans: 心理, 心理学 (adj.)

sentences.english: Sleep disorders are a serious psychological problem .
sentences.chinese: 睡眠障碍是严重的心理疾病。

sentences.english: Freud’s psychological theories
sentences.chinese: 弗洛伊德的心理学理论

sentences.english: What was the patient’s psychological state ?
sentences.chinese: 病人的心理状态如何？

detailed_translations.english: relating to the way that your mind works and the way that this affects your behaviour

name: psychology
trans: 心理学, 心理, 心态 (noun.)

sentences.english: I understood the psychology of this, but it still hurt.
sentences.chinese: 我理解这种心理，但这仍然让我感到伤心。

sentences.english: It was not until the mid-twentieth century that psychology really came into its own.
sentences.chinese: 直到20世纪中叶心理学才得到应有的重视。

sentences.english: His speciality was psychology -- one important branch on the great tree of knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 他的专业是心理学，这是知识之树上的一个重要分枝。

name: pub
trans: 酒吧, 酒馆, 小酒馆, 客栈 (noun.)

sentences.english: Do you fancy going to the pub?
sentences.chinese: 你想去酒吧吗？

sentences.english: a pub lunch
sentences.chinese: 酒吧午餐

sentences.english: the pub landlord
sentences.chinese: 酒吧老板

detailed_translations.english: a building in Britain where alcohol can be bought and drunk, and where meals are often served

name: public
trans: 公共, 公众, 公开, 公营 (adj.); 市民, 大众, 民众 (noun.)

sentences.english: We have to show that publishing this story is in the public interest (= helpful or useful to ordinary people ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们必须证明刊登这篇报道有利于公众。

sentences.english: full public access to information
sentences.chinese: 公众对信息的充分知情权

sentences.english: Public opinion is gradually shifting in favor of the imprisoned men.
sentences.chinese: 舆论渐渐倾向于同情入狱的男子。

sentences.english: There was a public outcry (= expression of anger by a lot of people ) about the shooting.
sentences.chinese: 公众就枪击事件发出了强烈抗议。

sentences.english: Their activities have been hidden from the public gaze (= people’s eyes or attention ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们的活动一直在避开公众的视线。

sentences.english: He is adored by his public.
sentences.chinese: 他深受支持者喜爱。

detailed_translations.english: relating to all the ordinary people in a country, who are not members of the government or do not have important jobs
ordinary people who do not work for the government or have any special position in society

name: publication
trans: 出版, 出版物, 刊物, 发布 (noun.)

sentences.english: The guide is being translated into several languages for publication near Christmas.
sentences.chinese: 这本指南正被翻译成好几种语言，准备在圣诞节前后出版。

sentences.english: a delay in the publication of the exam results
sentences.chinese: 考试成绩的延期公布

detailed_translations.english: the act of printing a book, a magazine, etc. and making it available to the public; a book, a magazine, etc. that has been published

name: publicity
trans: 宣传, 张扬, 公示, 公开 (noun.)

sentences.english: Much advance publicity was given to the talks.
sentences.chinese: 会谈之前做了大量的宣传。

sentences.english: ...government publicity campaigns.
sentences.chinese: …政府的宣传活动。

detailed_translations.english: Publicity is information or actions that are intended to attract the public's attention to someone or something

name: publish
trans: 发布, 出版, 发表, 公布 (verb.)

sentences.english: The first edition was published in 1765.
sentences.chinese: 第一版于1765年出版。

sentences.english: They are publishing the dictionary on CD-ROM.
sentences.chinese: 那部词典他们将以光盘版的形式推出。

sentences.english: We love reading your letters and we try to publish as many as possible.
sentences.chinese: 我们喜欢阅读大家的来信，并且会尽量刊登出来。

sentences.english: The latest unemployment figures will be published tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 最新的失业数字将于明天公布。

detailed_translations.english: to arrange for a book, magazine etc to be written, printed, and sold

name: publisher
trans: 出版商, 发行商, 出版社, 出版 (noun.)

sentences.english: The publishers planned to produce the journal on a weekly basis.
sentences.chinese: 出版社计划将这份杂志做成周刊。

detailed_translations.english: a person or company whose business is to arrange the writing, production, and sale of books, newspapers etc

name: pudding
trans: 布丁, 糕, 年糕 (noun.)

sentences.english: chocolate pudding
sentences.chinese: 巧克力布丁

detailed_translations.english: a hot sweet dish, made from cake, rice, bread etc with fruit, milk, or other sweet things added

name: pull
trans: 拉, 拔, 拉动, 拉扯 (verb.); 拉力 (noun.)

sentences.english: Mom! Davey’s pulling my hair!
sentences.chinese: 妈妈! 戴维拽我的头发！

sentences.english: He gave her a sharp pull forward.
sentences.chinese: 他猛地把她往前一拉。

detailed_translations.english: to use your hands to make something or someone move towards you or in the direction that your hands are moving
an act of using force to move something towards you or in the same direction that you are moving

name: punch
trans: 冲床, 拳, 凸模, 冲孔 (noun.); 揍 (verb.)

sentences.english: The guard punched my ticket and I got on.
sentences.chinese: 守卫在我的票上打孔后，我就上去了。

sentences.english: a hole punch
sentences.chinese: 打孔器

detailed_translations.english: to make a hole in something, using a metal tool or other sharp object
a metal tool for cutting holes or for pushing something into a small hole

name: punishment
trans: 惩罚, 处罚, 刑, 刑罚 (noun.)

sentences.english: ...a group that campaigns against the physical punishment of children.
sentences.chinese: …一个发起运动反对体罚儿童的组织。

detailed_translations.english: Punishment is the act of punishing someone or of being punished

name: pupil
trans: 瞳孔, 小学生, 瞳, 学生 (noun.)

sentences.english: About 20 pupils study music here.
sentences.chinese: 大约20名小学生在这里学习音乐。

sentences.english: staff and pupils
sentences.chinese: 教职员工和学生

sentences.english: a star pupil
sentences.chinese: 一名优秀的小学生

sentences.english: a third-grade pupil
sentences.chinese: 一名三年级小学生

detailed_translations.english: someone who is being taught, especially a child

name: purchase
trans: 购买, 采购, 购, 购置 (noun.); 买 (verb.)

sentences.english: She paid for her purchases and left.
sentences.chinese: 她付钱买好东西离开了。

sentences.english: I enclose my receipt as proof of purchase .
sentences.chinese: 我附上小票作为购物凭证。

sentences.english: She made two purchases from my stall.
sentences.chinese: 她从我的货摊上买了两样东西。

sentences.english: You can purchase insurance online.
sentences.chinese: 你可以在网上买保险。

detailed_translations.english: something you buy, or the act of buying it
to buy something

name: pure
trans: 纯, 纯净, 纯粹, 纯洁 (adj.)

sentences.english: rings made of pure gold
sentences.chinese: 纯金制成的戒指

sentences.english: Our beef patties are 100% pure.
sentences.chinese: 我们的牛肉饼是100%的纯牛肉。

sentences.english: His motives were pure.
sentences.chinese: 他动机纯正。

detailed_translations.english: not mixed with anything else; with nothing added

name: purely
trans: 纯粹, 纯, 纯属, 单纯 (adv.)

sentences.english: a decision made for purely political reasons
sentences.chinese: 纯粹出于政治原因而作出的决定

sentences.english: The building was closed purely on the grounds of safety.
sentences.chinese: 那座大楼被关闭完全是出于安全考虑。

sentences.english: It happened purely by chance .
sentences.chinese: 那件事纯属偶然。

sentences.english: I do it purely and simply for the money.
sentences.chinese: 我纯粹是为了钱才干的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 纯粹地；仅仅，只不过；完全地；贞淑地；清洁地
detailed_translations.english: completely and only

name: purple
trans: 紫色, 紫, 紫砂, 紫红色 (adj.)

sentences.english: A purple may be made by dyeing a blue over a red.
sentences.chinese: 红色染上蓝色便可成为紫色。

sentences.english: She had a purple dress on with a silver-white necklace.
sentences.chinese: 她穿着一条紫色的连衣裙配着一条银白色的项链。

detailed_translations.english: a dark colour that is a mixture of red and blue
having a dark colour that is a mixture of red and blue

name: purpose
trans: 宗旨, 目的, 用途, 目标 (noun.)

sentences.english: The purpose of this meeting is to elect a new chairman.
sentences.chinese: 这次会议的目的是选出一位新主席。

detailed_translations.english: the purpose of something is what it is intended to achieve

name: purse
trans: 钱包, 皮包, 包, 手提包 (noun.)

sentences.english: I locked the door and dropped the keys in my purse.
sentences.chinese: 我锁上门，然后把钥匙丢进手提包里。

detailed_translations.chinese: (女士)手提袋；(国家、家庭、团体等的) 财力
detailed_translations.english: a bag in which a woman carries her money and personal things
if you purse your lips, you bring them together tightly into a small circle, especially to show disapproval or doubt

name: pursue
trans: 追求, 奉行, 追寻, 追逐 (verb.)

sentences.english: She plans to pursue a career in politics.
sentences.chinese: 她计划从政。

sentences.english: Students should pursue their own interests , as well as do their school work.
sentences.chinese: 除了完成课业之外，学生也应该追求自己的兴趣。

sentences.english: a campaign promise to pursue policies that will help the poor
sentences.chinese: 贯彻扶贫政策的竞选承诺

detailed_translations.english: to continue doing an activity or trying to achieve something over a long period of time

name: push
trans: 推, 推动, 推进, 逼 (verb.)

sentences.english: It didn’t move, so she pushed harder.
sentences.chinese: 它一动不动，因此她加力去推。

sentences.english: I promised to push him on the swings for as long as he wanted.
sentences.chinese: 我答应他想在秋千上荡多久我就推多久。

sentences.english: shoppers pushing their grocery carts
sentences.chinese: 推着购物车的购物者

detailed_translations.english: to make someone or something move by pressing them with your hands, arms etc
to make someone or something move by pressing them with your hands, arms etc

name: put
trans: 把, 放, 穿, 投入 (verb.)

sentences.english: He put the coffee on the table.
sentences.chinese: 他把咖啡放在桌上。

sentences.english: Where did you put the programmes?
sentences.chinese: 你把节目单放在哪里了？

detailed_translations.english: to move something to a particular place or position, especially using your hands

name: qualification
trans: 资格, 资质, 资格证书, 资历 (noun.)

sentences.english: He left school without any qualifications.
sentences.chinese: 他离校时没有拿到任何文凭。

detailed_translations.english: if you have a qualification, you have passed an examination or course to show you have a particular level of skill or knowledge in a subject

name: qualify
trans: 资格, 限定, 晋级, 符合资格 (verb.)

sentences.english: Free school lunches are given to children who qualify.
sentences.chinese: 符合条件的儿童可获得免费的学生午餐。

detailed_translations.english: to have the right to have or do something, or to give someone this right

name: quality
trans: 质量, 品质, 素质, 优质 (noun.)

sentences.english: Much of the land was of poor quality.
sentences.chinese: 很多地的土质很差。

sentences.english: Use only high quality ingredients.
sentences.chinese: 只使用上等的材料。

sentences.english: the drug’s addictive quality
sentences.chinese: 毒品令人上瘾的特性

detailed_translations.english: how good or bad something is

name: quantity
trans: 数量, 量, 水量, 用量 (noun.)

sentences.english: Your work has improved in quantity and quality this term.
sentences.chinese: 这学期你的作业在完成数量和质量上都有提高。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of something that can be counted or measured

name: quarter
trans: 季度, 季, 四分之一, 财季 (noun.)

sentences.english: It’s about a page and a quarter.
sentences.chinese: 大概是一又四分之一页。

sentences.english: Cut the cake into quarters.
sentences.chinese: 把蛋糕切成四等份。

sentences.english: I’ll meet you in a quarter of an hour.
sentences.chinese: 我们一刻钟之后见。

detailed_translations.english: one of four equal parts into which something can be divided

name: queen
trans: 女王, 皇后, 王后, 女皇 (noun.)

sentences.english: Queen Elizabeth
sentences.chinese: 伊丽莎白女王

sentences.english: the future queen
sentences.chinese: 未来的王后

sentences.english: the queen of diamonds
sentences.chinese: 方块Q，方块王后

detailed_translations.english: the female ruler of a country

name: question
trans: 问题, 质询, 项质询, 提问 (noun.); 质疑, 怀疑 (verb.)

sentences.english: Can I ask you a question?
sentences.chinese: 我能问你个问题吗？

sentences.english: I’m afraid I can’t answer that question.
sentences.chinese: 我恐怕无法回答那个问题。

detailed_translations.english: a sentence, phrase or word that asks for information

name: queue
trans: 队列, 排队 (noun.)

sentences.english: You’ll have to join the queue.
sentences.chinese: 你得排队。

sentences.english: Some of the people queuing for tickets had been there since dawn.
sentences.chinese: 购票队伍中有些人天刚亮就来了。

detailed_translations.english: a line of people waiting to enter a building, buy something etc, or a line of vehicles waiting to move
to form or join a line of people or vehicles waiting to do something or go somewhere

name: quick
trans: 快速, 快, 快捷, 迅速 (adj.)

sentences.english: That was quick! I thought you’d be another hour.
sentences.chinese: 很快啊！我以为你还要一个小时呢。

sentences.english: It’s probably quicker by train.
sentences.chinese: 乘火车可能会快一点。

sentences.english: Have we got time for a quick drink?
sentences.chinese: 我们有时间喝口东西吗？

sentences.english: What’s the quickest way to the station?
sentences.chinese: 到车站怎么走最快？

sentences.english: We stopped to have a quick look at the church.
sentences.chinese: 我们停下来迅速地扫了一眼教堂。

sentences.english: Three bombs went off in quick succession (= quickly, one after the other ).
sentences.chinese: 瞬间有三个炸弹连续爆炸。

detailed_translations.english: lasting for or taking only a short time

name: quickly
trans: 迅速, 很快, 快速, 快 (adv.)

sentences.english: We need to get this finished as quickly as possible.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须尽快完成此事。

sentences.english: Kids grow up so quickly these days.
sentences.chinese: 现在的孩子长得真快啊。

detailed_translations.english: fast

name: quid
trans: 镑, 尼·柯德, 英镑 (noun.)

name: quiet
trans: 安静, 宁静, 平静, 文静 (adj.)

sentences.english: We’ll have to be quiet so as not to wake the baby.
sentences.chinese: 我们得安静点，免得吵醒宝宝。

sentences.english: It’s a nice car. The engine’s really quiet.
sentences.chinese: 这车真好，发动机声音很小。

sentences.english: I’ll be as quiet as a mouse (= very quiet ).
sentences.chinese: 我会像老鼠一样悄无声息的。

sentences.english: It was a Sunday, about three o’clock, and the streets were quiet.
sentences.chinese: 那是一个星期天，三点钟左右，街上一片寂静。

detailed_translations.english: not making much noise, or making no noise at all

name: quietly
trans: 悄悄地, 静静地, 悄然, 悄悄 (adv.)

sentences.english: Rosa shut the door quietly.
sentences.chinese: 罗莎悄悄关上门。

sentences.english: ‘I’m sorry,’ she said quietly.
sentences.chinese: “对不起。”她轻声说道。

sentences.english: a quietly-spoken man (= one who always speaks quietly )
sentences.chinese: 说话轻柔的男人

detailed_translations.english: without making much noise

name: quit
trans: 退出, 辞职, 辞掉, 放弃 (verb.)

sentences.english: He quit his job after an argument with a colleague.
sentences.chinese: 他和一个同事争吵后就辞职了。

sentences.english: I quit school at 16.
sentences.chinese: 我十六岁辍学。

sentences.english: She has decided to quit show business.
sentences.chinese: 她已决定退出娱乐圈。

sentences.english: People are now calling on the chairman to quit.
sentences.chinese: 人们现在正要求主席辞职。

sentences.english: I've quit smoking.
sentences.chinese: 我戒了烟。

detailed_translations.english: to leave a job, school etc, especially without finishing it completely

name: quite
trans: 相当, 很, 颇, 非常 (adv.)

sentences.english: I’m sorry. That’s quite impossible.
sentences.chinese: 我很抱歉，那是完全不可能的。

sentences.english: I felt quite bitter about it at the time.
sentences.chinese: 当时我对此感到相当痛苦。

sentences.english: Well, actually it requires quite a bit of work and research.
sentences.chinese: 呃，实际上这需要相当多的工作和研究。

sentences.english: I can see it quite clearly.
sentences.chinese: 我能清清楚楚地看见它。

detailed_translations.english: completely

name: quote
trans: 报价, 引号, 报价单, 名言 (noun.); 引述, 引用, 报 (verb.)

sentences.english: He quoted a short passage from the Bible.
sentences.chinese: 他引用了《圣经》里的一小段。

sentences.english: A military spokesman was quoted as saying that the border area is now safe.
sentences.chinese: 报道引述军方一位发言人的话，说边境地区现在很安全。

sentences.english: They quoted a price of £15,000.
sentences.chinese: 他们报价1.5万英镑。

detailed_translations.english: to repeat exactly what someone else has said or written

name: race
trans: 种族, 比赛, 赛跑, 竞赛 (noun.)

sentences.english: The race is on to develop more environmentally friendly forms of energy.
sentences.chinese: 人们正在竞相开发更环保的能源形式。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which one group of people tries to obtain or achieve something before another group does

name: racing
trans: 赛车, 赛跑, 竞速, 比赛 (noun.); 竞相 (verb.)

sentences.english: watching the racing on television
sentences.chinese: 在电视上看赛马

sentences.english: today’s racing results
sentences.chinese: 今天的赛马结果

detailed_translations.english: the sport of racing horses
designed or bred to go very fast and be used for racing

name: radical
trans: 激进, 根治, 基, 彻底 (adj.)

sentences.english: They are proposing radical changes to the way the company is run.
sentences.chinese: 他们建议对公司经营模式进行重大改革。

sentences.english: a radical reform of the tax system
sentences.chinese: 税收制度的彻底改革

sentences.english: There are radical differences between the two organizations.
sentences.chinese: 这两个组织有着根本差异。

detailed_translations.chinese: 根本的，基本的；激进的，激进派的
detailed_translations.english: a radical change or difference is very big and important
someone who has new and different ideas, especially someone who wants complete social and political change

name: radio
trans: 无线电, 收音机, 电台, 广播 (noun.)

sentences.english: We’ve lost radio contact with the plane.
sentences.chinese: 我们和这架飞机失去了无线电联络。

sentences.english: I sat down and turned on the radio.
sentences.chinese: 我坐下来打开收音机。

detailed_translations.english: when messages are sent or received in this way

name: rail
trans: 轨, 轨道, 钢轨, 铁路 (noun.)

sentences.english: the American rail system
sentences.chinese: 美国铁路系统

sentences.english: a high-speed rail network
sentences.chinese: 一个高速铁路网络

sentences.english: Passengers want a better rail service .
sentences.chinese: 乘客希望有更好的铁路服务。

sentences.english: the Channel Tunnel and its rail links with London
sentences.chinese: 英吉利海峡隧道及其与伦敦之间的铁路连接

sentences.english: I need to buy a rail ticket .
sentences.chinese: 我要买一张火车票。

sentences.english: cheap rail fares
sentences.chinese: 便宜的火车票价

detailed_translations.english: to complain angrily about something, especially something that you think is very unfair

detailed_translations.chinese: 栏杆，横杆；铁轨，轨道；铁路
detailed_translations.english: the railway system

name: railway
trans: 铁路, 铁道, 轨道, 铁 (noun.)

sentences.english: a railway company
sentences.chinese: 铁路公司

detailed_translations.english: a system of tracks along which trains run, or a system of trains

name: rain
trans: 雨, 下雨, 雨水, 降雨 (noun.)

sentences.english: a night of wind and rain
sentences.chinese: 风雨交加的夜晚

sentences.english: There will be heavy rain in most parts of the country.
sentences.chinese: 全国大部分地区将有大雨。

sentences.english: Outside it was still raining.
sentences.chinese: 外面仍在下雨。

detailed_translations.english: water that falls in small drops from clouds in the sky
if it rains, drops of water fall from clouds in the sky

name: raise
trans: 提高, 筹集, 筹, 抚养 (verb.)

sentences.english: He did not raise the subject again.
sentences.chinese: 他再也没有提起这个话题。

sentences.english: I’d like to raise the issue of publicity.
sentences.chinese: 我想提一提宣传问题。

sentences.english: Betty raised the important question of who will be in charge.
sentences.chinese: 贝蒂提出了一个重要问题，就是将由谁来负责。

detailed_translations.english: to begin to talk or write about a subject that you want to be considered or a question that you think should be answered

name: range
trans: 范围, 范围内, 射程, 距离 (noun.)

sentences.english: a temperature range of 72-85˚
sentences.chinese: 72 度到85度之间的温度范围

sentences.english: Even the cheapest property was out of our price range (= too expensive for us ) .
sentences.chinese: 即使是最便宜的房子也超出了我们能承受的价格范围。

sentences.english: There were 120 students whose ages ranged from 10 to 18.
sentences.chinese: 有120名学生，年龄在10至18岁之间。

detailed_translations.english: the limits within which amounts, quantities, ages etc vary
if prices, levels, temperatures etc range from one amount to another, they include both those amounts and anything in between

name: rank
trans: 排名, 秩, 职级, 军衔 (noun.)

sentences.english: There were several pairs of riding boots ranked neatly in the hall.
sentences.chinese: 门厅里整齐地摆放着几双马靴。

detailed_translations.english: to arrange objects in a line or row

detailed_translations.chinese: 军衔，职衔；地位，社会阶层；排，行列
detailed_translations.english: the position or level that someone holds in an organization, especially in the police or the army, navy etc
to have a particular position in a list of people or things that have been put in order of quality or importance

name: rapid
trans: 快速, 迅速, 飞速, 迅猛 (adj.)

sentences.english: The patient made a rapid recovery.
sentences.chinese: 病人迅速康复。

sentences.english: a period of rapid decline
sentences.chinese: 迅速衰退期

sentences.english: He fired three times in rapid succession (= one after another ) .
sentences.chinese: 他接连开了三枪。

detailed_translations.english: happening or done very quickly and in a very short time

name: rapidly
trans: 迅速, 快速, 迅猛, 急速 (adv.)

sentences.english: The disease was spreading more rapidly than expected.
sentences.chinese: 疾病的蔓延比预期的要快。

detailed_translations.english: very quickly and in a very short time

name: rare
trans: 罕见, 稀有, 难得, 少见 (adj.)

sentences.english: This species of plant is becoming increasingly rare.
sentences.chinese: 这种植物越来越罕见。

sentences.english: I only saw Helen on the rare occasions when I went into her shop.
sentences.chinese: 我只有偶尔去海伦店里时才会见到她。

sentences.english: It is very rare for her to miss a day at school.
sentences.chinese: 她很少有哪一天不上学的。

detailed_translations.english: not seen or found very often, or not happening very often

name: rarely
trans: 很少, 极少, 鲜有, 难得 (adv.)

sentences.english: We rarely see someone go after the health area.
sentences.chinese: 我们很少见到有人在健康领域做文章。

sentences.english: He rarely mingles with other students on the campus.
sentences.chinese: 他很少和校园里的其他学生交往。

name: rate
trans: 率, 速率, 速度, 利率 (noun.)

sentences.english: $20 an hour is the going rate (= the usual amount paid ) for private tuition.
sentences.chinese: 每小时20美元是私人授课的一般收费。

sentences.english: The company seems to rate him very highly (= think he is very good) .
sentences.chinese: 公司好像对他的评价很高。

detailed_translations.english: a charge or payment that is set according to a standard scale
to think that someone or something has a particular quality, value, or standard

name: rather
trans: 而, 相当, 更确切地说, 宁可 (adv.)

sentences.english: I grew up in rather unusual circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 我在相当不寻常的环境中长大。

sentences.english: I'm afraid it's a rather long story.
sentences.chinese: 我恐怕这是个相当长的故事。

sentences.english: I’d rather have a quiet night in front of the TV.
sentences.chinese: 我宁愿晚上安安静静地看看电视。

detailed_translations.english: fairly or to some degree

name: ratio
trans: 比率, 比例, 比, 比值 (noun.)

sentences.english: Yeah, , now you know how the sex ratio matters!
sentences.chinese: 是的，现在你知道性别比例的问题了吧！ ！

sentences.english: The ratio could reach one in four within a year.
sentences.chinese: 一年之内这个比例可以达到四分之一。

sentences.english: When using profiling it is typical to consider only the ratio (or percentage) of time spent in certain areas.
sentences.chinese: 当使用分析时，它是典型的考虑时间花费在某些领域的比例（或百分比）。

detailed_translations.english: a relationship between two amounts, represented by a pair of numbers showing how much bigger one amount is than the other

name: raw
trans: 原始, 生, 原料, 生吃 (adj.)

sentences.english: raw meat
sentences.chinese: 生肉

sentences.english: grated raw carrots
sentences.chinese: 磨碎的生胡萝卜

sentences.english: Cabbage can be eaten raw.
sentences.chinese: 洋白菜可以生吃。

sentences.english: raw sugar
sentences.chinese: 原糖

detailed_translations.english: not cooked

name: reach
trans: 达到, 到达, 达成, 达 (verb.)

sentences.english: We reached London late at night.
sentences.chinese: 我们深夜到达伦敦。

sentences.english: She reached into her bag and produced a business card.
sentences.chinese: 她伸手从包里取出一张名片。

sentences.english: Chelsea could reach the final of the European Cup.
sentences.chinese: 切尔西队会进入欧洲杯决赛。

detailed_translations.english: to arrive at a place

name: react
trans: 反应, 作何反应, 回应 (verb.)

sentences.english: He reacted angrily to the suggestion that he had lied.
sentences.chinese: 说他撒谎，他非常生气。

sentences.english: She reacted very badly (= was very upset ) when her parents split up.
sentences.chinese: 父母离婚的时候，她非常难过。

sentences.english: You have to react quickly to circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 你必须对形势迅速作出反应。

detailed_translations.english: to behave in a particular way or show a particular emotion because of something that has happened or been said

name: reaction
trans: 反应, 反作用, 化学反应 (noun.)

sentences.english: What was Jeff’s reaction when you told him about the job?
sentences.chinese: 你告诉杰夫这个工作时，他是什么反应？

detailed_translations.english: something that you feel or do because of something that has happened or been said

name: read
trans: 读, 阅读, 读取, 看 (verb.)

sentences.english: I can’t read your writing.
sentences.chinese: 我看不懂你写的东西。

sentences.english: She picked up the letter and read it.
sentences.chinese: 她拿起信读了起来。

sentences.english: Read the instructions carefully before you start.
sentences.chinese: 开始前要仔细阅读说明。

sentences.english: children who are just learning to read and write
sentences.chinese: 刚刚开始学习读和写的儿童

sentences.english: Her books are quite widely read (= read by a lot of people ) .
sentences.chinese: 她的书读者很多。

sentences.english: When I was young, I read every one of his books from cover to cover (= read all of something because you are very interested ) .
sentences.chinese: 我小时候，他的每一本书我都从头到尾一页不落地看过。

detailed_translations.english: to look at written words and understand what they mean
to look at written words and understand what they mean

name: reader
trans: 读者, 读卡器 (noun.)

sentences.english: The book will appeal to young readers.
sentences.chinese: 这本书会吸引年轻读者。

sentences.english: I’ve always been an avid reader (= someone who reads a lot ) .
sentences.chinese: 我向来是一个嗜书如命的人。

sentences.english: a series of graded English readers
sentences.chinese: 一系列分级英语读物

detailed_translations.english: someone who reads books, or who reads in a particular way

name: readily
trans: 欣然, 容易, 随手, 随时 (adv.)

sentences.english: Boats are readily available to visitors.
sentences.chinese: 游客可以很方便地租到船只。

sentences.english: The information is readily accessible on the Internet.
sentences.chinese: 这些信息在因特网上一查就能找到。

detailed_translations.chinese: 乐意地， 欣然地； 容易地； 很快地， 立即
detailed_translations.english: quickly and easily

name: reading
trans: 阅读, 读, 读书, 读数 (noun.); 看书, 读取, 看 (verb.)

sentences.english: She loves reading.
sentences.chinese: 她喜欢看书。

sentences.english: Reading is taught using a combination of several methods.
sentences.chinese: 综合运用多种方法进行阅读教学。

sentences.english: The book is quite difficult on first reading.
sentences.chinese: 这本书第一次阅读时很难懂。

detailed_translations.english: the activity or skill of understanding written words

name: ready
trans: 准备, 准备就绪, 就绪, 做好准备 (adj.)

sentences.english: Come on. Aren’t you ready yet?
sentences.chinese: 快点，你还没准备好吗？

sentences.english: When the doorbell rang he was ready and waiting .
sentences.chinese: 门铃响的时候，他已经准备好在等着了。

sentences.english: Why does it take you so long to get ready to go out?
sentences.chinese: 你外出怎么要准备那么长时间？

sentences.english: He's always ready to help his friends.
sentences.chinese: 他总是乐意帮助朋友。

detailed_translations.english: fully prepared for what you are going to do

name: real
trans: 真正, 真实, 现实, 真 (adj.)

sentences.english: She had never seen a real live elephant before.
sentences.chinese: 她以前从未见过活生生的大象。

sentences.english: a coat made of real fur
sentences.chinese: 真皮大衣

sentences.english: Things don’t happen quite that easily in real life.
sentences.chinese: 现实生活中不会动不动就有这样的事情发生。

detailed_translations.english: something that is real is actually what it seems to be and not false or artificial

name: realistic
trans: 现实, 逼真, 求实, 写实 (adj.)

sentences.english: It’s just not realistic to expect a promotion so soon.
sentences.chinese: 这么快就想升职根本不现实。

sentences.english: You need to be realistic about the amount you can do in a day.
sentences.chinese: 你对自己一天能完成多少工作量要现实一点。

detailed_translations.english: judging and dealing with situations in a practical way according to what is actually possible rather than what you would like to happen

name: reality
trans: 现实, 实相, 真人, 现实性 (noun.)

sentences.english: the distinction between fantasy and reality
sentences.chinese: 幻想和现实之间的区别

sentences.english: TV is used as an escape from reality .
sentences.chinese: 电视成了逃避现实的一种方式。

sentences.english: I think the government has lost touch with reality (= no longer understands what is real or true ) .
sentences.chinese: 我认为政府已经脱离了现实。

sentences.english: political realities
sentences.chinese: 政治现实

sentences.english: The paperless office may one day become a reality .
sentences.chinese: 无纸化办公室有一天可能会成为现实。

detailed_translations.english: what actually happens or is true, not what is imagined or thought

name: realize
trans: 实现, 意识到, 认识, 体会 (verb.)

sentences.english: It took us a while to realize the extent of the tragedy.
sentences.chinese: 我们过了一段时间才意识到这场悲剧有多严重。

sentences.english: It was only later that I realized my mistake.
sentences.chinese: 我到后来才认识到自己的错误。

sentences.english: She never realized her ambition of winning an Olympic gold medal.
sentences.chinese: 中文例句:她一直未能实现赢取奥运会金牌的抱负。

detailed_translations.english: to know and understand something, or suddenly begin to understand it

name: really
trans: 真, 真正, 确实, 很 (adv.)

sentences.english: Why don’t you tell us what really happened?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么不把真相告诉我们？

sentences.english: Oliver’s not really her brother.
sentences.chinese: 奥利弗其实不是她弟弟。

sentences.english: I never know what he’s really thinking.
sentences.chinese: 我从来都不知道他的真实想法。

sentences.english: She seems unfriendly at first, but she’s really very nice.
sentences.chinese: 一开始她似乎并不友善，但其实她人很好。

detailed_translations.chinese: 真正地， 实际上； 很， 十分， 全然
detailed_translations.english: used when you are talking about what actually happened or is true, rather than what people might wrongly think

name: reason
trans: 原因, 理由, 理性, 缘由 (noun.)

sentences.english: She has reason to feel guilty.
sentences.chinese: 她有理由感到内疚。

sentences.english: the human power of reason
sentences.chinese: 人类的理性

sentences.english: They reasoned that other businesses would soon copy the idea.
sentences.chinese: 他们推断其他企业也会很快仿效这个点子。

detailed_translations.english: why something happens, or why someone does something
to form a particular judgment about a situation after carefully considering the facts

name: reasonable
trans: 合理, 合情合理, 合理性, 公道 (adj.)

sentences.english: a reasonable request
sentences.chinese: 合情合理的要求

sentences.english: Be reasonable — you can’t expect her to do all the work on her own!
sentences.chinese: 要讲道理，你不能指望她一个人干所有的工作！

sentences.english: I thought it was a perfectly reasonable (= completely reasonable ) question.
sentences.chinese: 我认为这个问题问得很有道理。

sentences.english: He had reasonable grounds (= good reasons but no proof ) for believing the law had been broken.
sentences.chinese: 他有合理的根据认为有人违法了。

sentences.english: good food at a reasonable price
sentences.chinese: 价格公道的美食

detailed_translations.english: fair and sensible

name: reasonably
trans: 合理, 相当 (adv.)

sentences.english: He can’t reasonably be expected to have known that.
sentences.chinese: 按理说，他是不可能知道那件事的。

detailed_translations.english: in a way that is right or fair

name: recall
trans: 召回, 回收 (noun.); 记得, 回忆, 回想一下, 回忆起 (verb.)

sentences.english: You don’t happen to recall his name, do you?
sentences.chinese: 你不会恰巧还想得起他的名字吧？

sentences.english: As I recall, it was you who suggested this idea in the first place.
sentences.chinese: 我记得，是你首先提出这个想法的。

sentences.english: Cole was recalled to the squad to replace the injured Quinn.
sentences.chinese: 科尔被召回队里代替受伤的奎因。

sentences.english: The cars had to be recalled due to an engine fault.
sentences.chinese: 由于发动机缺陷，那些汽车必须召回。

detailed_translations.english: to remember a particular fact, event, or situation from the past

name: receipt
trans: 收据, 收到, 张收据, 收条 (noun.)

sentences.english: Keep your receipt in case you want to bring it back.
sentences.chinese: 保留收据以备退货之需。

sentences.english: Can you give me a receipt?
sentences.chinese: 你能给我一个收条吗？

detailed_translations.english: a piece of paper that you are given which shows that you have paid for something

name: receive
trans: 收到, 接收, 接受, 获得 (verb.)

sentences.english: All the children will receive a small gift.
sentences.chinese: 每个孩子都会收到一份小礼物。

sentences.english: Lee received 324 votes (= 324 people voted for him ) .
sentences.chinese: 李得到324票。

sentences.english: If you would like to receive further information , return the attached form.
sentences.chinese: 欲收到详细资料，请交回所附表格。

sentences.english: She isn’t well enough to receive visitors yet.
sentences.chinese: 她身体还不是很好，不能见客。

detailed_translations.english: to be given something

name: recent
trans: 最近, 近期, 近, 近来 (adj.)

sentences.english: Irving’s most recent book
sentences.chinese: 欧文最新的书

sentences.english: recent research into the causes of cancer
sentences.chinese: 近来对致癌原因的研究

sentences.english: the recent past
sentences.chinese: 不久前

detailed_translations.english: having happened or started only a short time ago

name: recently
trans: 最近, 近日, 近来, 近年来 (adv.)

sentences.english: He has recently been promoted to Assistant Manager.
sentences.chinese: 他最近晋升为经理助理。

sentences.english: a recently published biography
sentences.chinese: 一部最近出版的传记

sentences.english: Jerry lived in Cairo until quite recently .
sentences.chinese: 直至不久之前杰里一直住在开罗。

sentences.english: More recently, he’s appeared in a number of British films.
sentences.chinese: 最近，他出演了多部英国电影。

detailed_translations.english: not long ago

name: reception
trans: 接待, 招待会, 接待处, 接收 (noun.)

sentences.english: She was unsure of her reception after everything that had happened.
sentences.chinese: 发生了这些事后，她对自己是否还受欢迎没把握。

sentences.english: The plans received a mixed reception from unions (= some people liked them, others did not ) .
sentences.chinese: 各工会对这些计划反响不一。

detailed_translations.english: a particular type of welcome for someone, or a particular type of reaction to their ideas, work etc

name: recipe
trans: 食谱, 配方, 菜谱, 秘方 (noun.)

sentences.english: a recipe book
sentences.chinese: 一本烹饪书

detailed_translations.english: a set of instructions for cooking a particular type of food

name: reckon
trans: 估计 (verb.)

sentences.english: ‘There’s nothing we can do about it.’ ‘You reckon (= used to express doubt or disagreement ) ?’
sentences.chinese: “这件事我们无能为力。”“是吗？”

detailed_translations.english: spoken to think or suppose something

name: recognition
trans: 识别, 认可, 承认, 认同 (noun.)

sentences.english: He stared at her, but there was no sign of recognition .
sentences.chinese: 他盯着她看，但似乎没认出她来。

detailed_translations.english: the act of knowing someone or something because you have known or learned about them in the past

name: recognize
trans: 认出, 认识, 认得, 承认 (verb.)

sentences.english: I didn’t recognize you in your uniform.
sentences.chinese: 你穿上制服我认不出你了。

sentences.english: It was malaria, but Dr Lee hadn’t recognized the symptoms.
sentences.chinese: 这是疟疾，但李医生没有认出症状。

sentences.english: One must recognise that homesickness is natural.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须承认思乡是正常的。

detailed_translations.english: to know who someone is or what something is, because you have seen, heard, experienced, or learned about them in the past

name: recommend
trans: 推荐, 建议 (verb.)

sentences.english: I recommend the butter chicken - it’s delicious.
sentences.chinese: 我推荐黄油焗鸡，非常好吃。

sentences.english: Can you recommend a good lawyer?
sentences.chinese: 你能介绍一位好律师吗？

detailed_translations.english: to say that something or someone is good, or suggest them for a particular purpose or job

name: recommendation
trans: 推荐, 推荐信, 建议, 推介 (noun.)

sentences.english: Academic staff are appointed on the recommendation of a committee.
sentences.chinese: 教员是委员会推荐任命的。

sentences.english: We will review the case and make a recommendation to the client.
sentences.chinese: 我们将审查此案，然后向当事人提出建议。
