detailed_translations.english: a suggestion to someone that they should choose a particular thing or person that you think is very good

name: record
trans: 记录, 纪录, 创纪录, 唱片 (noun.)

sentences.english: According to official records, five people were killed last year near that road junction.
sentences.chinese: 据官方记录，去年有五人在那个路口附近丧生。

sentences.english: His record reveals a tough streak.
sentences.chinese: 他的经历说明他个性坚强。

sentences.english: Her husband made her record every penny she spent.
sentences.chinese: 她丈夫要她把花的每分钱都记下来。

detailed_translations.english: information about something that is written down or stored on computer, film etc so that it can be looked at in the future
to write information down or store it in a computer or on film so that it can be looked at in the future

name: recording
trans: 录音, 记录, 唱片, 录像 (noun.); 录制, 录 (verb.)

sentences.english: ...a video recording of a police interview.
sentences.chinese: …一盘警察询问的录像带。

detailed_translations.english: the act of storing sound or images on tape or  disc s

name: recover
trans: 恢复, 收回, 复苏, 复原 (verb.)

sentences.english: After a few days of fever, she began to recover.
sentences.chinese: 发烧几天之后，她开始恢复。

sentences.english: Two bodies were recovered from the wreckage.
sentences.chinese: 残骸中找到了两具尸体

detailed_translations.english: to get better after an illness, accident, shock etc

name: recovery
trans: 恢复, 复苏, 回收, 经济复苏 (noun.)

sentences.english: Hopes of economic recovery are fading.
sentences.chinese: 经济复苏的希望越来越渺茫。

detailed_translations.chinese: 恢复， 痊愈； 追回， 寻回， 收复
detailed_translations.english: the process of getting better after an illness, injury etc

name: red
trans: 红色, 红, 赤, 红灯 (adj.); 瑞德 (noun.)

sentences.english: We painted the door bright red .
sentences.chinese: 我们把门漆成鲜红色。

sentences.english: a red balloon
sentences.chinese: 一个红气球

sentences.english: I like the way the artist uses red in this painting.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢画家在这幅作品中对红色的运用。

detailed_translations.english: having the colour of blood
the colour of blood

name: reduce
trans: 减少, 降低, 减轻, 减低 (verb.)

sentences.english: The governor announced a new plan to reduce crime.
sentences.chinese: 州长宣布了一项降低犯罪率的新计划。

sentences.english: The helmet law should reduce injuries in motorcycle accidents.
sentences.chinese: 头盔法的实施应该能减少摩托车事故的受伤率。

sentences.english: Small businesses will need to reduce costs in order to survive.
sentences.chinese: 小企业要想生存必须削减成本。

detailed_translations.english: to make something smaller or less in size, amount, or price

name: reduction
trans: 还原, 约简, 减少, 复位 (noun.)

sentences.english: strategies for noise reduction
sentences.chinese: 减少噪音的对策

sentences.english: The company promised they would make no staff reductions for at least two years.
sentences.chinese: 公司承诺至少两年不裁员。

detailed_translations.english: a decrease in the size, price, or amount of something, or the act of decreasing something

name: refer
trans: 指, 参考, 引用, 请参阅 (verb.)

sentences.english: In his speech, he referred to a recent trip to Canada.
sentences.chinese: 在他的讲话中，他提到了最近的加拿大之行。

detailed_translations.english: If you refer to a particular subject or person, you talk about them or mention them

name: reference
trans: 参考, 引用, 参考咨询, 参照 (noun.)

sentences.english: Keep their price list on file for future reference (= so that it can be looked at in the future ) ..
sentences.chinese: 将他们的价目表存档，以供日后参考。

sentences.english: There is no direct reference to her own childhood in the novel.
sentences.chinese: 小说里没有直接提及她自己的童年。

detailed_translations.english: the act of looking at sth for information

name: reflect
trans: 反映, 反映出, 体现, 反射 (verb.)

sentences.english: The drop in consumer spending reflects concern about the economy.
sentences.chinese: 消费支出的下降反映出人们对经济的担忧。

detailed_translations.english: if a person or a thing is reflected in a mirror, glass, or water, you can see an image of the person or thing on the surface of the mirror, glass, or water

name: reflection
trans: 反射, 反思, 反映, 倒影 (noun.)

sentences.english: Can you see your reflection in the glass?
sentences.chinese: 你能看到玻璃里你的影像吗？

sentences.english: ...the reflection of a beam of light off a mirror.
sentences.chinese: …一束光线在镜面上的反射。

sentences.english: Inhibition in adulthood seems to be a reflection of a person's experiences as a child.
sentences.chinese: 成年期的压抑似乎是一个人童年经历的一种反映。

detailed_translations.english: an image that you can see in a mirror, glass, or water

name: reform
trans: 改革, 变革, 体制改革, 改造 (noun.)

sentences.english: plans to radically reform the tax system
sentences.chinese: 彻底改革税收制度的计划

detailed_translations.chinese: 改革， 改良， 改造； 改正， 改过自新
detailed_translations.english: to improve a system, law, organization etc by making a lot of changes to it, so that it operates in a fairer or more effective way

name: refrigerator
trans: 冰箱, 电冰箱, 制冷机, 冰箱里 (noun.)

sentences.english: My refrigerator suddenly started kicking up yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 我的冰箱昨晚突然出了故障。

sentences.english: The minute Tom came home he beelined for the refrigerator.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆一回到家就直奔冰箱而来。

sentences.english: Letters have been pouring into the office complaining about this kind of refrigerator.
sentences.chinese: 办公室连续收到大批信件抱怨这种电冰箱。

detailed_translations.english: a large piece of electrical kitchen equipment, shaped like a cupboard, used for keeping food and drink cool

name: refuse
trans: 拒绝, 拒, 不肯 (verb.); 垃圾 (noun.)

sentences.english: She asked him to leave, but he refused.
sentences.chinese: 她叫他走，但他不肯。

sentences.english: When he offered all that money, I could hardly refuse (= could not refuse ) , could I?
sentences.chinese: 他愿意给那么多钱，我怎么可能拒绝呢？

sentences.english: The town made a weekly collection of refuse.
sentences.chinese: 该镇每周收一次垃圾。

detailed_translations.english: to say firmly that you will not do something that someone has asked you to do
waste material that has been thrown away

name: regard
trans: 方面, 至于 (noun.)

sentences.english: He was regarded as the most successful president of modern times.
sentences.chinese: 他被看成是近代最成功的总统。

detailed_translations.english: to think about someone or something in a particular way

name: regime
trans: 政权, 政体, 制度, 体制 (noun.)

sentences.english: The regime got rid of most of its opponents.
sentences.chinese: 该政权清除了大多数反对者。

sentences.english: Under the new regime, all sheep and cattle will be regularly tested for disease.
sentences.chinese: 根据新制度，所有牛羊都要定期接受疾病检测。

detailed_translations.english: a government, especially one that was not elected fairly or that you disapprove of for some other reason

name: region
trans: 地区, 区域, 区, 地域 (noun.)

sentences.english: efforts to bring peace to the region
sentences.chinese: 给这个地区带来和平的努力

detailed_translations.english: a large area of a country or of the world, usually without exact limits

name: regional
trans: 区域, 区域性, 地区, 地域 (adj.); 区域市政 (noun.)

sentences.english: local and regional government
sentences.chinese: 地方及区域治理

sentences.english: regional variations in farming practice
sentences.chinese: 农耕方式的地区性差异

sentences.english: a slight regional accent
sentences.chinese: 轻微的地方口音

detailed_translations.chinese: 地区的；局部的；整个地区的
detailed_translations.english: relating to a particular region or area

name: register
trans: 注册, 登记, 报名, 挂号 (verb.); 寄存器, 登记册, 注册纪录册, 选民登记册 (noun.)

sentences.english: Have you signed the hotel register ?
sentences.chinese: 你在酒店登记簿上签名了吗？

sentences.english: Police want a national register of DNA samples.
sentences.chinese: 警方想要一个全国范围的DNA样本登记册。

sentences.english: How many students have registered for English classes?
sentences.chinese: 有多少学生注册选修英语课了？

detailed_translations.english: an official list of names of people, companies etc, or a book that has this list
to put someone’s or something’s name on an official list

name: registration
trans: 登记, 注册, 配准, 人事登记 (noun.)

sentences.english: Student registration (= for a course of study ) starts the first week in September.
sentences.chinese: 学生注册在9月份的第一个星期开始。

sentences.english: The registration fee is $75.
sentences.chinese: 注册费是75美元。

detailed_translations.english: the act of recording names and details on an official list

name: regret
trans: 后悔, 感到遗憾, 後悔 (verb.); 遗憾, 悔恨, 懊悔, 悔 (noun.)

sentences.english: We regret any inconvenience caused to our customers.
sentences.chinese: 我们对于给顾客造成的不便表示歉意。

sentences.english: It is with great regret that I must decline your offer.
sentences.chinese: 很遗憾，我不得不谢绝你的好意。

detailed_translations.english: to feel sorry about sth you have done or about sth that you have not been able to do
sadness that you feel about something, especially because you wish it had not happened

name: regular
trans: 定期, 常规, 正规, 普通 (adj.)

sentences.english: The company holds regular meetings with employees.
sentences.chinese: 公司定期召集雇员开会。

sentences.english: His breathing was slow and regular.
sentences.chinese: 他的呼吸缓慢而均匀。

sentences.english: Trains will run at regular intervals from 11 am to 4 pm.
sentences.chinese: 火车从上午11点到下午4点每隔一定时间开行。

sentences.english: We hear from him on a regular basis .
sentences.chinese: 我们定期收到他的来信。

sentences.english: He phones us every Sunday at six, regular as clockwork (= always at the same time ) .
sentences.chinese: 他每逢星期天6点钟打电话给我们，非常准时。

sentences.english: a regular job
sentences.chinese: 固定的工作

detailed_translations.english: happening every hour, every week, every month etc, usually with the same amount of time in between

name: regularly
trans: 定期, 经常, 定时, 规律 (adv.)

sentences.english: We meet regularly, once a month.
sentences.chinese: 我们定期见面，每月一次。

detailed_translations.english: at the same time each day, week, month etc

name: regulation
trans: 调节, 规例, 调控, 监管 (noun.)

sentences.english: There seem to be so many rules and regulations these days.
sentences.chinese: 如今好像条条框框很多。

sentences.english: regulations governing the safety of toys
sentences.chinese: 监控玩具安全的条例

sentences.english: All companies must comply with the regulations .
sentences.chinese: 所有公司都必须遵守规定。

detailed_translations.english: an official rule or order

name: reinforce
trans: 加强, 加固, 强化, 巩固 (verb.)

sentences.english: I hope this will reinforce Indonesian determination to deal with this kind of threat.
sentences.chinese: 我希望这会加强印度尼西亚对付这类威胁的决心。

sentences.english: Both sides have been reinforcing their positions after yesterday's fierce fighting.
sentences.chinese: 在昨天的激战后，双方一直在增援各自的阵地。

detailed_translations.english: to give support to an opinion, idea, or feeling, and make it stronger

name: reject
trans: 拒绝, 拒收, 否决, 排斥 (verb.); 废弃物 (noun.)

sentences.english: Sarah rejected her brother’s offer of help.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉拒绝了她弟弟的帮助。

sentences.english: Dexter flatly rejected (= completely rejected ) calls for his resignation.
sentences.chinese: 德克斯特断然拒绝让他辞职的要求。

sentences.english: His proposal was rejected outright (= completely rejected ) .
sentences.chinese: 他的建议被彻底否决了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 拒绝； 拒纳， 退回， 摈弃
detailed_translations.english: to refuse to accept, believe in, or agree with something

detailed_translations.chinese: 被拒货品， 不合格产品
detailed_translations.english: a product that has been rejected because there is something wrong with it

name: relate
trans: 涉及到, 涉及, 关系到, 与 (verb.)

sentences.english: The report seeks to relate the rise in crime to an increase in unemployment.
sentences.chinese: 报告试图把犯罪率上升和失业增加联系起来。

sentences.english: He later related the whole story to me.
sentences.chinese: 他后来给我讲了整件事的来龙去脉。

detailed_translations.english: if you relate two different things, you show how they are connected

name: related
trans: 相关, 关联 (adj.); 有关, 关系到, 涉及, 关系 (verb.)

name: relation
trans: 关系, 关联, 联系, 而言 (noun.)

sentences.english: diplomatic/international/foreign relations
sentences.chinese: 外交 / 国际 / 对外关系

sentences.english: a close/near/distant relation of mine
sentences.chinese: 我的一位近亲 / 远亲

detailed_translations.english: the way in which two people, groups or countries behave towards each other or deal with each other

name: relationship
trans: 关系, 感情, 恋情, 人际关系 (noun.)

sentences.english: I have quite a good relationship with my parents.
sentences.chinese: 我和父母关系很好。

sentences.english: the relationship between diet and health problems
sentences.chinese: 膳食与健康问题之间的联系

detailed_translations.english: the way in which two people or two groups feel about each other and behave towards each other

name: relative
trans: 相对, 相关, 亲戚, 亲属 (adj.)

sentences.english: The relative merits of both approaches have to be considered.
sentences.chinese: 两种方法的相对优点都得考虑在内。

sentences.english: her opponent’s relative lack of experience
sentences.chinese: 她的对手相对来说缺少经验

sentences.english: You may think you’re poor, but it’s all relative (= you are not poor compared to some people ) .
sentences.chinese: 你可能认为自己很穷，但一切都是相对的。

detailed_translations.english: having a particular quality when compared with something else
a member of your family

name: relatively
trans: 相对, 相对较, 比较, 较为 (adv.)

sentences.english: The system is relatively easy to use.
sentences.chinese: 这个系统使用起来相对容易。

sentences.english: E-commerce is a relatively recent phenomenon.
sentences.chinese: 电子商务相对而言是新兴事物。

detailed_translations.english: something that is relatively small, easy etc is fairly small, easy etc compared to other things

name: relax
trans: 放松, 放松一下, 放轻松, 放宽 (verb.)

sentences.english: Gentle exercise can relax stiff shoulder muscles.
sentences.chinese: 和缓的运动可以使僵硬的肩部肌肉放松。

detailed_translations.english: if you relax a part of your body or it relaxes, it becomes less stiff or less tight
to rest or do something that is enjoyable, especially after you have been working

name: release
trans: 释放, 发布, 释, 放行 (noun.); 公布, 放开, 放, 解除 (verb.)

sentences.english: Police arrested several men, who were later released.
sentences.chinese: 警察逮捕了几个人，后来都释放了。

sentences.english: The bears are eventually released into the wild.
sentences.chinese: 这些熊最后被放回野生环境中。

sentences.english: You need to release the tension in these shoulder muscles.
sentences.chinese: 你需要放松肩部肌肉。

sentences.english: The new trade figures have just been released.
sentences.chinese: 新的贸易数字刚刚公布。

detailed_translations.english: to let someone go free, after having kept them somewhere

name: relevant
trans: 相关, 有关, 相应 (adj.)

sentences.english: Relevant documents were presented in court.
sentences.chinese: 法庭上出示了相关的文件。

sentences.english: We received all the relevant information.
sentences.chinese: 我们收到了所有相关信息。

detailed_translations.english: directly relating to the subject or problem being discussed or considered

name: relief
trans: 救济, 救灾, 浮雕, 救援 (noun.)

sentences.english: Marijuana can provide pain relief for some cancer patients.
sentences.chinese: 大麻可以为一些癌症患者减轻疼痛。

sentences.english: money raised for the relief effort
sentences.chinese: 为赈灾筹集的钱款

detailed_translations.english: when something reduces someone’s pain or unhappy feelings

name: relieve
trans: 缓解, 减轻, 纾缓, 解除 (verb.)

sentences.english: Drugs helped to relieve the pain.
sentences.chinese: 药物有助于舒缓疼痛。

sentences.english: A secretary was hired to relieve her of some of the administrative work.
sentences.chinese: 一个秘书被雇来为她减轻一些行政工作的负担。

detailed_translations.english: to reduce someone’s pain or unpleasant feelings

name: religion
trans: 宗教, 宗教信仰, 信仰 (noun.)

sentences.english: The U.S. Constitution promises freedom of religion.
sentences.chinese: 美国宪法保证宗教信仰自由。

sentences.english: a course on philosophy and religion
sentences.chinese: 关于哲学和宗教的课程

sentences.english: the Islamic religion
sentences.chinese: 伊斯兰教

detailed_translations.english: a belief in one or more gods

name: religious
trans: 宗教, 信教, 宗教信仰, 虔诚 (adj.)

sentences.english: I don’t share her religious beliefs .
sentences.chinese: 她的宗教信仰和我的不同。

sentences.english: a religious school
sentences.chinese: 宗教学校

sentences.english: the dates of major religious observances such as Easter or Christmas
sentences.chinese: 复活节和圣诞节等重要宗教节日的日期

detailed_translations.chinese: 宗教的； 笃信宗教的， 虔诚的
detailed_translations.english: relating to religion in general or to a particular religion

name: rely
trans: 依赖, 依靠, 倚赖 (verb.)

sentences.english: I knew I could rely on David.
sentences.chinese: 我知道我可以信赖戴维。

sentences.english: They relied heavily on the advice of their professional advisers.
sentences.chinese: 他们非常依赖专业顾问的建议。

detailed_translations.english: to depend on something in order to continue to live or exist

name: remain
trans: 保持, 仍然, 留, 仍 (verb.)

sentences.english: The refugees were allowed to remain in the UK.
sentences.chinese: 难民获准留在英国。

sentences.english: They were cleaning up the remains of their picnic.
sentences.chinese: 他们正在打扫野餐的残余物。

detailed_translations.english: to stay in the same place without moving away

detailed_translations.chinese: 残余； 残骸； 遗迹
detailed_translations.english: Theremainsof something are the parts of it that are left after most of it has been taken away or destroyed

name: remaining
trans: 剩余, 其余, 余下, 剩下 (verb.)

sentences.english: The few remaining guests were in the kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 留下没走的几位客人都在厨房里。

sentences.english: Add the remaining ingredients and simmer for 30 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 加入余下的原料，用文火炖30分钟。

sentences.english: The only remaining question is whether we can raise the money.
sentences.chinese: 剩下的唯一问题是我们能否筹到这笔钱。

detailed_translations.english: the remaining people or things are those that are left when the others have gone, been used, or been dealt with

name: remains
trans: 仍是, 仍然, 仍, 依然 (verb.); 遗骸, 遗体 (noun.)

sentences.english: extensive Roman remains (= of ancient buildings ) at Arles
sentences.chinese: 阿尔勒的一大片古罗马遗迹

detailed_translations.english: the parts of something that are left after the rest has been destroyed or has disappeared

name: remark
trans: 备注, 句话, 一句话, 言论 (noun.)

sentences.english: to make a remark
sentences.chinese: 发表评论

sentences.english: Critics remarked that the play was not original.
sentences.chinese: 评论家们指出这部戏剧缺乏创意

detailed_translations.english: something that you say when you express an opinion or say what you have noticed
to say or write a comment about sth/sb

name: remarkable
trans: 显着, 显著, 非凡, 了不起 (adj.)

sentences.english: She has made remarkable progress.
sentences.chinese: 她取得了显著的进步。

sentences.english: a remarkable coincidence
sentences.chinese: 不寻常的巧合

sentences.english: He’s a remarkable man .
sentences.chinese: 他是个了不起的人。

detailed_translations.english: unusual or surprising and therefore deserving attention or praise

name: remember
trans: 记得, 记住, 请记住, 记 (verb.)

sentences.english: Do you remember Rosa Davies?
sentences.chinese: 你记得罗莎·戴维斯吗？

sentences.english: I can’t remember her exact words.
sentences.chinese: 我记不得她的原话了。

sentences.english: I remember it well ; I’d never seen my mother so angry.
sentences.chinese: 这件事我记得很清楚；我从未见过母亲这么生气。

sentences.english: She clearly remembers the excitement as they boarded the train.
sentences.chinese: 她清楚地记得他们登上火车时的激动心情。

sentences.english: I vaguely remember reading something about it in the paper.
sentences.chinese: 我隐约记得在报纸上看到过有关情况。

sentences.english: They had three children, if I remember rightly .
sentences.chinese: 如果我没记错，他们有三个孩子。

sentences.english: You left your keys on the table, remember?
sentences.chinese: 你把钥匙放在桌子上了，想起来了吗？

sentences.english: I hope he remembers the wine.
sentences.chinese: 我希望他记得带酒。

detailed_translations.english: to have a picture or idea in your mind of people, events, places etc from the past

name: remind
trans: 提醒, 想起 (verb.)

sentences.english: Yes, I’ll be there. Thanks for reminding me.
sentences.chinese: 是的，我会去那里的。 谢谢提醒。

sentences.english: He made a few notes to remind himself of what he wanted to say.
sentences.chinese: 他记了几条，提醒自己要说些什么。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone remember something that they must do

name: remote
trans: 远程, 偏远, 偏僻, 遥控 (adj.)

sentences.english: a remote border town
sentences.chinese: 一个偏远的边境小镇

sentences.english: a fire in a remote mountain area
sentences.chinese: 偏远山区的火灾

detailed_translations.chinese: 遥远的， 偏僻的； 关系疏远的； 脱离的； 绝少的； 微乎其微的； 孤高的， 冷淡的
detailed_translations.english: far from towns or other places where people live

name: remove
trans: 删除, 移除, 去除, 消除 (verb.)

sentences.english: a cleaner that will remove wine stains
sentences.chinese: 可去除葡萄酒酒渍的清洁剂

sentences.english: The college removed rules that prevented women from enrolling.
sentences.chinese: 这所大学取消了禁止女性入学的规定。

detailed_translations.english: to get rid of something so that it does not exist any longer

name: rent
trans: 租金, 房租, 寻租, 地租 (noun.); 租, 出租, 租房, 租用 (verb.)

sentences.english: I pay the rent at the beginning of every month.
sentences.chinese: 我每逢月初交付房租。

sentences.english: She rents out two rooms to students.
sentences.chinese: 她把两个房间出租给学生

detailed_translations.english: the money that someone pays regularly to use a room, house etc that belongs to someone else
to let someone live in a house, room etc that you own, or use your land, in return for money

name: repair
trans: 修复, 修理, 维修, 修补 (noun.); 修好 (verb.)

sentences.english: Dad was up the ladder, repairing the roof.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸在梯子上修补屋顶。

sentences.english: Where can I get my shoes repaired ?
sentences.chinese: 哪儿能修补鞋子？

sentences.english: The church tower is in need of repair.
sentences.chinese: 教堂的塔楼需要修缮。

detailed_translations.english: to fix something that is damaged, broken, split, or not working properly
something that you do to fix a thing that is damaged, broken, or not working

name: repeat
trans: 重复, 重复一遍, 再重复一遍, 复述 (verb.); 重演 (noun.)

sentences.english: Can you repeat your question?
sentences.chinese: 你能重复一遍你的问题吗？

sentences.english: Sorry - could you repeat that?
sentences.chinese: 对不起——你能再说一遍吗？

sentences.english: It is not, I repeat not, my fault.
sentences.chinese: 那不是我的错，我再说一遍，不是。

sentences.english: It was a terrible journey - I hope we don’t have a repeat performance (= have the same thing happen again ) on the way home.
sentences.chinese: 这一路上太糟糕了——我希望回程可不要再发生同样的事。

detailed_translations.english: to say or write something again
an event that is very like something that happened before

name: replace
trans: 取代, 替换, 代替, 更换 (verb.)

sentences.english: I’m replacing Sue on the team.
sentences.chinese: 我将接替队里的休。

sentences.english: Lectures have replaced the old tutorial system.
sentences.chinese: 课堂授课取代了旧式的导师制。

detailed_translations.english: to start doing something instead of another person, or start being used instead of another thing

name: replacement
trans: 更换, 置换术, 置换, 替代 (noun.)

sentences.english: Our old car is badly in need of replacement.
sentences.chinese: 我们的旧车急需更换。

sentences.english: replacement windows
sentences.chinese: 新换的窗户

detailed_translations.english: when you get something that is newer or better than the one you had before

name: reply
trans: 答复, 答覆, 回复, 回答 (noun.); 发言答辩, 答辩 (verb.)

sentences.english: I asked Clive where he was going, but he didn’t reply.
sentences.chinese: 我问克莱夫到哪儿去，但他没有回答。

sentences.english: Sorry it took me so long to reply.
sentences.chinese: 抱歉，我过了这么久才回复。

sentences.english: ‘Did you see Simon today?’ ‘Of course,’ Nathalie replied with a smile.
sentences.chinese: “你今天见到西蒙了吗？”“当然啦。”纳萨莉笑着答道。

sentences.english: I tried calling, but there was no reply.
sentences.chinese: 我试着打电话去，但没有人接。

detailed_translations.english: to answer someone by saying or writing something
something that is said, written, or done as a way of replying

name: report
trans: 报告, 报表, 报道, 汇报 (noun.); 举报 (verb.)

sentences.english: This is Gavin Williams, reporting from the United Nations in New York.
sentences.chinese: 我是加文·威廉斯，在纽约联合国总部为您报道。

sentences.english: We aim to report the news as fairly as possible.
sentences.chinese: 我们力求公正地报道这一新闻。

sentences.english: The incident was widely reported in the national press.
sentences.chinese: 这一事件在全国的媒体上被广泛报道。

detailed_translations.english: to give people information about recent events, especially in newspapers and on television and radio

name: reporter
trans: 记者 (noun.)

sentences.english: a news reporter
sentences.chinese: 新闻记者

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to write about news events for a newspaper, or to tell people about them on television or on the radio

name: represent
trans: 代表, 表示, 占 (verb.)

sentences.english: Mr Kobayashi was chosen to represent the company at the conference.
sentences.chinese: 小林先生被选中代表公司出席会议。

detailed_translations.chinese: 作为…的代表， 表示， 象征； 描绘， 表现
detailed_translations.english: to officially speak or take action for another person or group of people

name: representation
trans: 表示, 代表性, 表征, 代表 (noun.)

sentences.english: The clock in the painting is a symbolic representation of the passage of time.
sentences.chinese: 画上的时钟象征着光阴的流逝。

sentences.english: A group of students made representations to the college about the poor standard of the accommodation.
sentences.chinese: 一群学生就恶劣的住宿条件同校方交涉。

sentences.english: Minority groups need more effective parliamentary representation.
sentences.chinese: 少数族群需要办事更为高效的议会代表。

detailed_translations.english: a painting, sign, description etc that shows something

name: representative
trans: 代表, 代表作, 代理人 (noun.); 代表性, 具有代表性, 具代表性, 代议制 (adj.)

sentences.english: The latest incident is representative of a wider trend.
sentences.chinese: 最近发生的事件代表了一个更大的趋势。

sentences.english: an elected representative of the people
sentences.chinese: 民选代表

detailed_translations.english: typical of a particular group or thing
someone who has been chosen to speak, vote, or make decisions for someone else

name: republic
trans: 共和国, 共和, 民国, 共和政体 (noun.)

sentences.english: the former Federal Republic of Germany
sentences.chinese: 前德意志联邦共和国

sentences.english: Nine republics took part in the referendum.
sentences.chinese: 有九个共和国参加了全民公决。

detailed_translations.english: a country governed by elected representatives of the people, and led by a president, not a king or queen

name: reputation
trans: 声誉, 信誉, 名声, 口碑 (noun.)

sentences.english: Alice Munro has a reputation for being a very depressing writer.
sentences.chinese: 艾丽斯•门罗有文风抑郁的名声。

detailed_translations.english: the opinion that people have about someone or something because of what has happened in the past

name: request
trans: 请求, 要求, 申请 (noun.)

sentences.english: They have made an urgent request for international aid.
sentences.chinese: 他们紧急请求国际援助。

sentences.english: To request more information, please call our toll free number.
sentences.chinese: 欲知详情，请拨打我们的免费电话。

detailed_translations.english: a polite or formal demand for something
to ask for something in a polite or formal way

name: require
trans: 需要, 要求, 规定, 需 (verb.)

sentences.english: Campbell’s broken leg will probably require surgery.
sentences.chinese: 坎贝尔的一条腿骨折，可能需要手术。

sentences.english: What’s required is a complete reorganization of the system.
sentences.chinese: 需要做的是彻底整顿整个系统。

sentences.english: Most house plants require regular watering.
sentences.chinese: 大多数室内盆栽植物需要定期浇水。

sentences.english: The bill failed to get the required number of votes.
sentences.chinese: 法案没有得到规定的票数。

detailed_translations.english: to need something

name: requirement
trans: 要求, 需求, 规定, 需 (noun.)

sentences.english: The refugees’ main requirements are food and shelter.
sentences.chinese: 难民的主要需求是食物和住所。

sentences.english: to meet/fulfil/satisfy the requirements
sentences.chinese: 符合 / 满足必备的条件

detailed_translations.english: something that someone needs or asks for

name: rescue
trans: 救援, 营救, 抢救, 拯救 (noun.); 救, 挽救 (verb.)

sentences.english: Survivors of the crash were rescued by helicopter.
sentences.chinese: 空难的生还者被直升机救了出来。

sentences.english: a daring rescue at sea
sentences.chinese: 英勇的海上营救行动

detailed_translations.english: to save someone or something from a situation of danger or harm
when someone or something is rescued from danger

name: research
trans: 研究, 科研, 调研, 研制 (noun.)

sentences.english: It’s a good idea to do some research before you buy a house.
sentences.chinese: 买房子之前作些了解，这想法很对。

sentences.english: Gould was helped in his researches by local naturalists.
sentences.chinese: 古尔德在研究过程中得到了当地博物学家的帮助。

sentences.english: He’s been researching material for a documentary.
sentences.chinese: 他一直在研究材料，准备做一个纪录片。

detailed_translations.english: the activity of finding information about something that you are interested in or need to know about
to study a subject in detail, especially in order to discover new facts or test new ideas

name: reserve
trans: 储备, 后备, 准备金, 预备役 (noun.); 保留, 预订, 预留, 预定 (verb.)

sentences.english: Do you have to reserve tickets in advance?
sentences.chinese: 你必须预先订票吗？

detailed_translations.english: to arrange for a place in a hotel, restaurant, plane etc to be kept for you to use at a particular time in the future

detailed_translations.chinese: 储备； 保留； 拘谨， 矜持； 替补队员， 后备部队； 自然保护区
detailed_translations.english: a supply of something kept to be used if it is needed

name: resident
trans: 居民, 常驻, 驻地, 住院医生 (noun.); 常住, 驻 (adj.)

sentences.english: As one local resident put it in May, "By day there is government.
sentences.chinese: 正如一位当地居民在五月份对它的描述”白天有政府。

sentences.english: A resident said, "I think we should write it down on paper or tell our family members.
sentences.chinese: 一位居民说：“我觉得我们应该把遗嘱写在纸上或者告诉给自己的家人。

sentences.english: Few of her former comrades enjoy this comfort; but, as another resident explained, the authorities like them to live there "to do propaganda and education work".
sentences.chinese: 她以前的同志，很少人能享受能这种舒适生活；不过另一个居民解释说，当局希望他们住在那以“进行宣传教育工作”。

name: residential
trans: 住宅, 居住, 住宿, 住宅区 (adj.)

sentences.english: a quiet residential neighbourhood
sentences.chinese: 安静的住宅区

detailed_translations.chinese: 居住的， 住宅的； 寄宿的， 住在住所的
detailed_translations.english: a residential part of a town consists of private houses, with no offices or factories

name: resign
trans: 辞职, 辞去, 引咎辞职, 下台 (verb.); 辞去职务 (noun.)

sentences.english: A hospital administrator has resigned over claims he lied to get the job.
sentences.chinese: 一位医院主管因为有人声称他的职位是骗来的而辞职了。

detailed_translations.english: to officially announce that you have decided to leave your job or an organization
to officially announce that you have decided to leave your job or an organization

name: resignation
trans: 辞职, 辞职信, 辞呈, 辞职书 (noun.)

sentences.english: She gave a sigh of resignation.
sentences.chinese: 她无奈地叹了一口气。

sentences.english: He accepted her decision with resignation.
sentences.chinese: 他无可奈何地接受了她的决定。

detailed_translations.english: when someone calmly accepts a situation that cannot be changed, even though it is bad

name: resist
trans: 抗拒, 抵制, 抵抗, 抵御 (verb.)

sentences.english: to resist change
sentences.chinese: 抵制变革

sentences.english: He tried to pin me down, but I resisted.
sentences.chinese: 他试图制伏我，但我奋力反抗。

detailed_translations.english: to refuse to accept sth and try to stop it from happening

name: resistance
trans: 电阻, 阻力, 抵抗, 抗 (noun.)

sentences.english: Rebel gunmen have put up strong resistance.
sentences.chinese: 持枪的叛乱分子负隅顽抗。

sentences.english: disease resistance
sentences.chinese: 抗病能力

detailed_translations.english: fighting against someone who is attacking you

name: resolution
trans: 分辨率, 决议, 决议案, 分辨 (noun.)

sentences.english: Then, with sudden resolution, she stood up.
sentences.chinese: 然后，她突然很坚决地站了起来。

sentences.english: She made a resolution to visit her relatives more often.
sentences.chinese: 她决定要多走走亲戚。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being resolute or determined

name: resolve
trans: 解决, 化解, 解析 (verb.); 决心 (noun.)

sentences.english: Barnet was desperate for money to resolve his financial problems.
sentences.chinese: 巴尼特急需钱来解决他的经济问题。

sentences.english: After the divorce she resolved never to marry again.
sentences.chinese: 离婚以后，她决心永不再嫁。

sentences.english: Recent events strengthened her resolve to find out the truth.
sentences.chinese: 最近发生的事件坚定了她找出真相的决心。

detailed_translations.english: to find a satisfactory way of dealing with a problem or difficulty
strong determination to succeed in doing something

name: resort
trans: 度假村, 胜地, 度假胜地, 度假区 (noun.); 诉诸 (verb.)

sentences.english: His punishing work schedule had made him resort to drugs.
sentences.chinese: 他那累人的工作日程已经使他不得不求助于毒品了。

sentences.english: Congress has a responsibility to ensure that all peaceful options are exhausted before resort to war.
sentences.chinese: 国会有责任确保在所有和平的手段用尽之后再诉诸武力。

detailed_translations.english: when you must use or depend on something because nothing better is available
The action of resorting to a course of action in a difficult situation

name: resource
trans: 资源 (noun.)

sentences.english: Canada’s vast mineral resources
sentences.chinese: 加拿大丰富的矿产资源

sentences.english: a country rich in natural resources
sentences.chinese: 自然资源丰富的国家

detailed_translations.chinese: 资源； 财力； 应付办法， 谋略
detailed_translations.english: something such as useful land, or minerals such as oil or coal, that exists in a country and can be used to increase its wealth

name: respect
trans: 尊重, 尊敬, 方面, 敬意 (noun.)

sentences.english: The boys showed a complete lack of respect for authority.
sentences.chinese: 这些男孩子根本无视权威。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of admiring someone or what they do, especially because of their personal qualities, knowledge, or skills
to admire someone because they have high standards and good qualities such as fairness and honesty

name: respectively
trans: 分别, 各自 (adv.)

sentences.english: The cups and saucers cost £5 and £3 respectively.
sentences.chinese: 茶杯和茶碟的价钱分别为5英镑和3英镑。

detailed_translations.english: in the same order as the things you have just mentioned

name: respond
trans: 回应, 响应, 作出回应, 作出响应 (verb.)

sentences.english: They are likely to respond positively to the president's request for aid.
sentences.chinese: 他们有可能积极地回应该总统的援助请求。

detailed_translations.chinese: 回答， 答复； 作出反应， 响应
detailed_translations.english: to do something as a reaction to something that has been said or done

name: response
trans: 响应, 反应, 回应, 应答 (noun.)

sentences.english: His immediate response was one of disbelief.
sentences.chinese: 他的第一反应是不相信。

sentences.english: Carl made no response , and carried on with his meal.
sentences.chinese: 卡尔没有回答，继续吃饭。

detailed_translations.english: something that is done as a reaction to something that has happened or been said

name: responsibility
trans: 责任, 责任感, 职责, 责任心 (noun.)

sentences.english: Kelly’s promotion means more money and more responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 凯利获得提升，这意味着钱多了，责任也更大了。

detailed_translations.english: a duty to be in charge of someone or something, so that you make decisions and can be blamed if something bad happens

name: responsible
trans: 负责任, 负责, 责任心, 责任感 (adj.)

sentences.english: We are determined to bring the people responsible to justice.
sentences.chinese: 我们决意要将肇事者绳之以法。

detailed_translations.english: if someone is responsible for an accident, mistake, crime etc, it is their fault or they can be blamed

name: rest
trans: 休息, 其余, 剩下, 休息一下 (noun.)

sentences.english: If you’re tired, we’ll stop and rest for a while.
sentences.chinese: 如果你累了，我们就停下来歇一会儿。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使休息，使轻松；把…寄托于
detailed_translations.english: to stop working or doing an activity for a time and sit down or lie down to relax

detailed_translations.chinese: 休息，静止；休息时间；剩余部分；支架
detailed_translations.english: a period of time when you are not doing anything tiring and you can relax or sleep

name: restaurant
trans: 餐厅, 餐馆, 饭馆, 饭店 (noun.)

sentences.english: He took her out for a five-course dinner in a fancy restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 他带她到一家豪华餐厅吃了一顿有五道菜的晚餐。

sentences.english: The company runs a chain of restaurants.
sentences.chinese: 公司经营连锁饭店。

sentences.english: A new restaurant has just opened across the road.
sentences.chinese: 马路对面刚开了一家新饭馆。

detailed_translations.english: a place where you can buy and eat a meal

name: restore
trans: 恢复, 还原, 挽回, 重建 (verb.)

sentences.english: She was hoping that the Mediterranean climate would restore her to full health.
sentences.chinese: 她希望地中海的气候能使她的身体完全复原。

sentences.english: The National Guard was called in to restore order (= make people stop fighting and breaking the law ) when riots broke out.
sentences.chinese: 暴乱爆发后，国民警卫队被调来恢复秩序。

sentences.english: initiatives to restore peace in the Middle East
sentences.chinese: 恢复中东和平的倡议

sentences.english: a Victorian fireplace restored to its former glory
sentences.chinese: 恢复了昔日华美的维多利亚时代的壁炉

sentences.english: The treaty restored Okinawa to Japan.
sentences.chinese: 该条约将冲绳归还给了日本。

detailed_translations.english: to make something return to its former state or condition

name: restrict
trans: 限制, 制约, 限定 (verb.)

sentences.english: The new law restricts the sale of hand guns.
sentences.chinese: 新法规限制手枪的销售。

sentences.english: You may need to restrict access to certain files (= limit the number of people who can read them ) .
sentences.chinese: 某些档案可能需要限制查阅。

sentences.english: The agreement will restrict competition.
sentences.chinese: 这个协议将限制竞争。

sentences.english: The cramped living conditions severely restricted the children’s freedom to play.
sentences.chinese: 拥挤的居住条件严重限制了孩子们玩耍的自由。

detailed_translations.english: to limit or control the size, amount, or range of something

name: restriction
trans: 限制, 制约, 约束, 限制性 (noun.)

sentences.english: a 50 mph speed restriction
sentences.chinese: 每小时50英里的限速

detailed_translations.english: a rule or law that limits or controls what people can do

name: result
trans: 结果, 效果, 因此, 成绩 (noun.); 导致, 造成 (verb.)

sentences.english: How would you cope with unemployment and the resulting loss of income?
sentences.chinese: 你会如何应付失业及由此造成的收入损失？

detailed_translations.english: if something results from something else, it is caused by it
something that happens or exists because of something that happened before

name: retain
trans: 保留, 留住, 挽留, 保持 (verb.)

sentences.english: You have the right to retain possession of the goods.
sentences.chinese: 你有权保留这些物品。

sentences.english: The state wants to retain control of food imports.
sentences.chinese: 政府想保留对食品进口的控制权。

detailed_translations.english: to keep something or continue to have something

name: retire
trans: 退休, 退役, 隐退, 退 (verb.)

sentences.english: At the age when most people retire, he is ready to face a new career.
sentences.chinese: 在大多数人退休的年纪，他准备要面对一项新事业。

sentences.english: I retired late that evening.
sentences.chinese: 那天晚上我睡得晚。

detailed_translations.english: to stop working, usually because you have reached a certain age

name: retirement
trans: 退休, 退休金, 退役, 养老 (noun.)

sentences.english: She took early retirement (= retired at an earlier age than usual ) last year.
sentences.chinese: 她去年提前退休了。

sentences.english: Dad’s approaching retirement age .
sentences.chinese: 爸爸快到退休年龄了。

detailed_translations.english: when you stop working, usually because of your age

name: return
trans: 返回, 回来, 归还, 回 (verb.); 回报, 回归, 退货, 归来 (noun.)

sentences.english: It was forty five minutes before she returned.
sentences.chinese: 过了45分钟她才回来。

sentences.english: Alison decided to return home.
sentences.chinese: 艾利森决定回家。

sentences.english: He left his country, never to return.
sentences.chinese: 他离开了祖国，一去不复返。

detailed_translations.english: to go or come back to a place where you were before
the act of returning from somewhere, or your arrival back in a place
used or paid for a journey from one place to another and back again

name: reveal
trans: 揭示, 透露, 揭露, 露出 (verb.)

sentences.english: He may be prosecuted for revealing secrets about the security agency.
sentences.chinese: 他可能因泄露安全部门的机密而被起诉。

sentences.english: a test that can reveal a teacher’s hidden skills
sentences.chinese: 能够展现老师潜在技能的测试

detailed_translations.english: to make known something that was previously secret or unknown

name: revenue
trans: 收入, 收益, 营收, 税收 (noun.)

sentences.english: advertising revenue
sentences.chinese: 广告收入

sentences.english: Strikes have cost £20 million in lost revenues .
sentences.chinese: 罢工造成的收入损失达到2,000万英镑。

detailed_translations.english: money that a business or organization receives over a period of time, especially from selling goods or services

name: reverse
trans: 逆向, 反求 (adj.); 反向, 扭转, 逆转, 反 (verb.); 相反, 倒 (noun.)

sentences.english: Reverse the paper in the printer.
sentences.chinese: 把打印机中的纸翻过来。

sentences.english: The wrong attitude will have exactly the reverse effect.
sentences.chinese: 这种错误的态度会得到恰好相反的结果。

detailed_translations.english: if a vehicle or its driver reverses, they go backwards

detailed_translations.chinese: 反向的； 相反的； 颠倒的
detailed_translations.english: Reverse means opposite from what you expect or to what has just been described

detailed_translations.chinese: 撤销，废除；使完全相反，彻底转变；使反转，使次序颠倒
detailed_translations.english: to change something, such as a decision, judgment, or process so that it is the opposite of what it was before

detailed_translations.chinese: 相反情况，对立面；反面，背面，后面；损失，倒退
detailed_translations.english: the exact opposite of what has just been mentioned

name: review
trans: 检讨, 回顾, 审查, 复习 (noun.)

sentences.english: The government will review the situation later in the year.
sentences.chinese: 政府将在今年晚些时候对形势重新加以研究。

sentences.english: The decision will be reviewed by the Supreme Court.
sentences.chinese: 这个判决将由最高法院复核。
